1.content:
Marc trudged through the hallway of the ASL to his new mistress. His last one hadn't been so bad but she ended up in pissing off the wrong fighter and got challenged to a Survival match. Then, stupidly, she accepted despite just being accepted into the ASL at Bronze level while her Challenger had been Silver, formally Gold. Poor deluded girl ended up in her opponent's gullet faster than Marc could blink.

As such, Marc had been reassigned to another fighter to serve. He just hoped it didn't end up too bad, he could due with not ending up in the infirmary too much.

But what division was he heading to?

112.content:
It didn't take Marc long to notice that he was entering the large, elegant structures of the Gold Division. He gulped. His situation really hinged on who he got assigned to. With Bronze, despite their shortcomings as fighters, they tended to be rather easy to deal with due to not really being used to having access to a servant who would do virtually anything they demanded. Silver, on the other hand, was hit or miss. Some where reasonable while others where abusive. It just depended. Some Silvers were recently promoted and felt that they were owed something while others were to happy making it up the food chain to really care about servants really. But with Gold, most were self-assured bitches that took full advantage of their station to derive as much amusement as possible. It was really like you couldn't win with the ASL top division of fighters.

Marc was so engrossed in his thoughts that he didn't even notice the large figure in front of him until is walked right into her. Marc's eyes widened as his vision was obscured by a white furred belly. He quickly looked up, past the large protruding belly and sizable breasts into the amused face of Claudine. The titanic unicorn was looking down at him with an amused expression and eyebrow raised. Claudine was wearing a black tank top and shorts, meaning that she had most likely was coming from or was heading to training.

In that instant, several memories of the thrashings he received for staring at his past mistresses flashed before his eyes before he jumped back and bowed. Even if she wasn't his new mistress, he rather not receive a beating before he even met her.

"I'm really, really sorry for that, ma'am," Marc spoke quickly. "I got a little lost in thought on my over here."

"I noticed," Claudine intoned softly. "You wouldn't happen to be Marc, would you?"

Her voice was quiet and cultured but it still managed to send shivers up his spine. He couldn't read anything from her tone and from her question, she had to be his new mistress. And his first act was to possibly disrespect her. His mouth suddenly went dry and he couldn't speak, so head nodded to her.

"I see," Claudine stated, looking him over. "Now what to do with you now?"
112.title: Claudine- elegant, lonely unicorn

choices: "...this is how things are going to work." She sets some rules.
"...take a seat and tell me about yourself."
1121.content:
"Let us proceed back to my apartments then. I wish to speak to you in private." Claudine spoke softly and turned on her heel.

Marc jogged to keep up with the unicorn's longer stride. It wasn't long before the two arrived at the door to Claudine's quarters. Once Claudine opened the door, Marc got a good look at the space. The room was rather nice, all things considered. There was a large dining table with a vase full of roses in the center surrounded several large, plush chairs for anthros and even one raised chair fitted for a human with a ladder attached to it. In the far corner of the room was large desk sporting a high tech computer and swivel chair. On the back wall was a large flat screen TV with a comfy looking sofa sitting in front. Against the right wall was a large bookshelf filled to the brim with various books and novels. There was also another doorway, from which Marc could see lead to another set of rooms. Marc was quite surprised just how normal the room seemed.

"Welcome to my humble abode." Claudine spoke softly as she walked in with March right behind her. "Wait here. I am going to change into something more comfortable. I will not be long."

With that, the unicorn disappeared into the doorway. leaving Marc standing by himself. He would've plopped down on the plush couch but was too afraid that Claudine would be upset if he did without permission.

He didn't have long to ponder as soon Claudine came back through the door way, in a blue silk robe. She immediately plopped herself down onto the couch and waved you over. Marc walked around the couch until he was facing his new mistress who was staring at him quite intensely.

Deciding to try and make a good impression. "Is there anything I can do for you, ma'am?" He questioned evenly.

Claudine's eyes never left his as she nodded. "Yes..." She drawled smoothly. "You see..."
1121.title: Claudine decides to take him back to her quarters.

choices: Somethings happens with Claudine in the middle of the night...
The next day: Marc's new life begins.
11212.content:
"...if you're going to be my aide, then I need to know a little about you." Claudine finished, her gaze boring into Marc. She patted the seat next to her on the couch, inviting him to sit.

Despite the scrutiny he was under, Marc relaxed a little when Claudine said 'aide' and not 'servant' before moving to sit on the couch. He already been through a few other mistresses and as such, had some experience with predicting mannerisms. While views of the those like himself varied from fighter to fighter, most viewed them a glorified toys: to be used, worked, and discarded at a whim. They were another luxury, to be enjoyed but not important in the grand scheme of things and they made that apparent with everything they did and how they spoke. The fact the Claudine even used the word 'aide' was a least an encouraging sign. Not guarantee but reassuring nonetheless.

Marc took a small breath before answering. "Well not much to say, really," he started. "I signed up to ASL to get some money to go to school and well, being the moron that I am, I didn't read the fine print, I ended up a servant here."

Claudine nodded, the look her face seemingly agreeing with the 'moron' statement. "You should always read fine print." Her tone was soft but admonishing, like she was speaking to a child.

It took a good bit of Marc's willpower to bite back the retort that bubbled up his throat. He didn't need her to tell him that, he was and had been living it!

When he first got here, he would've snapped at Claudine but the beatings he received for had drilled into him the importance of watching his tongue. That and the fact that Claudine was at least starting out reasonable so he should atleast try and be cooperative.

"Ain't that the truth," Marc continued evenly, "Anyway, I got been passed around between sumos, mostly Bronze and Silver, which didn't last too long in the ring."

Claudine raised a brow. "So you've never really been with an ASL member for anyextended time?"

Marc shook his head. "Not really. All of the ones I've been assigned to eventually got eaten, killed or just quite after taking too many beatings."

The unicorn snorted, her contempt on full display. "Such weaklings. Obviously their drive wasn't strong enough. Be rest assured, dear Marc, that I do not have such a problem."

We'll see, Marc though cynically. After hearing such lines for so long, he just need to see Claudine actually do well before he put that kind of faith in her.

The two continued this for some time. Claudine would as various questions or make observations and Marc would do his best to elaborate. Marc found the novel experience of simply being able to talk rather freely to be a novel one. Dealing with all the overbearing fighters and his past mistresses, had left him tongue tied and missing general conversation. For Claudine, she just continued to note various things about her new aide.

By the the time the two stopped it had grown rather late in the day. This was demonstrated when Claudine gave a discrete yawn.

"Well, Marc, I do believe that that is enough for today and that we should retire. I want to be up bright and early tomorrow. I will be showing you my training schedule and your expected duties."

"Okay." Marc nodded. Claudine rose from the couch and motioned for Marc to do the same. She led him through the doorway he spotted earlier. The unicorn showed him to what would be his new room. It was a rather spartan room with but it held a comfy looking bed, a sizable closet and nightstand with drawers and a desk with a laptop on it. There was even a window! The room itself was positioned the opposite of Claudine's.

After showing him his room, Claudine bide Marc a goodnight, telling him to be ready by 8 am the next morning. Marc immediately went to bed, deciding to get some rest for what was probably going to be a long day.
11212.title: "...take a seat and tell me about yourself....

choices: She's awake, but looks pretty forlorn...
112121.content:
Come on, FALL ASLEEP!!! Marc mentally screamed at himself, rolling around another tense spot in his back, but nothing he did could let him comfortably sink into the mattress.

Right on the first night, and he couldn't sleep a wink. With a welling fear in his chest, he could see every other day working for Claudine tumbling like dominoes by any possible fatigue-driven disaster that tomorrow could bring, and there wasn't a thing he could do about it. All he could do was lay back and stare up at the ceiling, hoping that the gods of sleep would eventually answer his prayers.

The ceiling itself actually bowed temptingly low by the center, thanks to the mountainous weight of his boss laying above, likely sleeping better than he could. Even though he could stand up straight in the room built beneath her bed, it was still pretty cramped for a human to easily adapt to, and the intimidating bulge in the ceiling only made things harder. How the hell am I not her friggin' tattoo right now?!!

But then a loud, metallic groan hummed through the entire room from the ceiling, which slowly flattened out as the weight on top rolled off the roof, accompanied by a deep WHUMP! on the floor outside. Even from his bed, Marc could feel a heavy set of footsteps trudging from the bed to the door, accompanied by a soft dragging sound along the carpet that he could tell was Claudine's belly.

"Huh..." Even though the room was 100% less deadly, Marc curiously slid out of bed and went for the door, clad only in a white T-shirt and plaid pajama pants. When he opened the door, Claudine was just leaving her bedroom, her barn-sized back passing through the door. "Claudine?"

Claudine either didn't hear him or didn't heed, and kept walking to the living room.

Marc tiptoed as quietly and swiftly as he could to the door, hiding behind the doorframe with his cheek resting on the lip. He watched as Claudine carefully craned her weight into the couch, using an aura of golden magic flaring from her horn to flip the TV on, shining bright light shone upon her and the rest of the room, blaring the melodramatic whining of some random soap opera. A door across the room also opened on its own, from which a tub of ice cream the size of an SUV floated in, joining her on the other end of the couch.

"...What's going on?" Marc whispered to himself as Claudine dig out an ice cream scoop from the bucket, taking a hearty bite of sherbet...
112121.title: Somethings happens with Claudine in the middle ...

choices: Marc's better nature wins out. He goes to speak with Claudine.
He doesn't want to risk anything yet and goes back to bed.
Something happens before Marc can make up his mind!
1121212.content:
What drew Marc's attention however was the look on the unicorn's face. Now, he hadn't known her for too long but Claudine seemed so...so composed, self-assured of herself and proud. But currently looking at the Gold-Level fighter, all he could see was someone who looked tired and miserable.

"...Why..." Claudine mumbled to herself through the sherbet and staring at the tv. "...why can't I have something like that...?"

Marc's brow arched into his hairline before looking towards the TV. Just like he thought it was a soap opera. But the scene was what caught his attention. It was a young couple, just talking, laughing...they seemed happy. Marc looked back to Claudine and connected the dots. "She's lonely..." Marc realized.

It was incredible to him. That someone who had everything on a sliver platter didn't have something that basic. Back in the human world, Marc had had plenty of friends. Heck, even had a few ex-girlfriends he could still call friends! But it really seemed like Claudine didn't have any of that. "It really must be lonely at the top..." He mused,

Now this left him with a dilemma. Claudine seemed honestly distressed and if he was right, maybe she just needed a friend or at least someone who showed they cared. He just met her, but he could understand that and sympathized. As a plus, it could really help set the tone with them going down the line, for however long that lasted.

Yet, something nagged him. What if Claudine really didn't want anyone to know about this? What if she lashed out at him? Every other fighter he'd been assigned to had been a pure bitch in how they acted. Maybe it was better to walk away and try to get some sleep...
1121212.title: She's awake, but looks pretty forlorn...

choices: Claudine shrugs glumly, patting the seat next to her....
Claudine refuses, lashing out as he'd feared!
11212121.content:
You know what? What the hell? Marc challenged, his face growing determined. I'd been sat on before, and I can get sat on again for trying to help somebody out!

But it was the very moment that Marc turned around and stepped past the door that he froze in his spot, immediately fearful as he finally stood out in the open. ...what am I gonna say to her?

"Uh...Claudine?"

Claudine yelped and snapped the remote, switching to some colorful gameshow, but when she looked over at the source of the sound she gave a bemused frown. "Marc? It's two in the morning! What are you doing up?"

"I-I couldn't sleep..." Marc confessed weakly. "I just heard you getting up, and...well, I just wondered what was going on, and, uh...yeah."

Claudine narrowed her eyes at him, but let out a resigned sigh, lazily turning her gaze back to the TV. "...guess that makes two of us."

A stretched moment of silence passed between the two, with Marc standing still in the door, and Claudine watching the TV, but to Marc it looked like she wasn't as invested as before.

"Is..." Marc began carefully. "...is everything alright, Claudine?"

"Oh, I'm fine." Claudine snarked. "Just as fine as anybody could be in the gold division. Why do you ask?"

"Well, I just saw you get up and watch TV, and..." Marc's confidence faltered as Claudine's face fell back into her glum, clearly unamused at his eavesdropping. "...well...would you like me to join you?"
11212121.title: Marc's better nature wins out. He goes to s...

choices: Go to tomorrow at the start of the training.
Skip ahead a week: How much has Claudine changed?
Skip ahead a month: Just how much progress have they made?
112121211.content:
Claudine looked like she was about to protest but then sighed, shrugged her large shoulders and proceeded to pat the seat cushion next to her. Marc quickly moved over to couch and took his seat. He turned to look at Claudine's towering figure and saw her expression. Marc had no way of really describing it but sad.

"So," Marc started. "You said gold division like it was a curse."

Claudine looked down at him for a moment before speaking. "Marc, I've been here at the ASL for a few years now. I started as a simple Bronze and clawed my way up on nothing but pure skill. No eating other fighters and not even being the biggest fighter around. I wanted to be the best. Here I am now. And what do I have to show for it?"

The unicorn gestured around the luxurious room with a hand. Marc followed it and it was then that he noticed it. Claudine had no pictures in the room. There were expensive looking vases and flowers, paintings and the like but no actual pictures. None of any friends or family.

Claudine continued, her tone bitter. "I've gotten to the top and I'm alone. When I decided to join the ASL, my family weren't what one could call supportive. But it was what I wanted to do, so I broke off with my family. I would be the best, no matter what they said. I was so sure that once I got to the top of ASL, I get some respect and who knows, maybe some friends and maybe get something more than that. But that's not what happened. I'm alone and I'm stuck here."

"What do you mean?" Marc asked, honestly surprised and confused. "You're one of the best fighters here."

Claudine gave a dainty snort. "I maybe respected, Marc, but that's it. I threw away everything I could have had so that I could come here. Yes, I've gotten into the Gold Division. Despite that, I'm still not the best. The one anthro I could call my friend here, has never been defeated. Like me, she works with skill more than anything else. Yet, she's never lost and I have. And like I said, she's my only friend. Everyone else around here is either afraid of me, envies me, or disgusts me. To add more salt in the wound, I really can't leave. Look at me."

Claudine got off of the couch and stood in front of Marc, who blushed a little when noticed that her robe was open, revealing her black bra and panties.

"I'm huge. This body demands a lot to keep running. Food, exercise and so much more. If I were to leave, how would I support myself. Outside of fighting, I don't have that many skills. The ASL takes care of all our needs and reward our hard work with virtually whatever we want but not real money. I've have if I leave. So again, I'm trapped. Trapped here alone, with no one who cares. You think those fans who cheer my name and stream my matches care? No, I'm entertainment. Good entertainment, but still entertainment nonetheless. If I dropped off the map, no one would."

With that, the unicorn sat down again, her face a mask of misery and disappointment. On Marc's side, he couldn't believe it. He and Claudine had so much in common. Marc wanted to got to college so that he could do something with his life. For that, he was willing to leave his home just to get the money to go. Claudine had done the same. The only difference, she was so much closer to getting what she wanted. It rang a bell with him and he knew that he couldn't let someone so much like himself give up.

"Claudine," he said, getting the unicorn's watery gaze upon him. "We may have just met, but I think you shouldn't just give up."

Claudine's look showed she didn't believe that. "No seriously!" Marc implored, his tone firm. "You've come so far. I just met you and I can already tell that. You deserve better. You deserve to be the best. If no cares, I'll care. If no one supports you, I'll still be here. I've met all the wannabes who claim they'll be the best. You're the first one who really seems like she could do it. And I'll help."

Marc watched her as the unicorn regarded him. She smiled after a while. It was small and seemed brittle. "And how would you do that?" She intoned.

Marc didn't hesitate. "However you want me to. You want to bulk up, I'll get down to the kitchens and make sure they arrange you a feast like none they ever even dare make. You want muscle, I'll make sure that every single machine in the gym is working and up to date. If I've got to twist a few arms and stand up to even other fighters, I'll help you get to the top."

Claudine stared at him before allowing an actual smile grace her lips. "Then go get some sleep. You'll need it, because starting tomorrow, the training begins."

Marc smiled, proud that he actually was able to motivate her. He got up off the couch and went to go back to bed.

"Oh and Marc?" Claudine called over his back. He turned a looked back at her. "Thank you."

Marc gave her a grin. "Anytime."
112121211.title: A little chat

choices: The two, as far as humans and anthros can be, have gotten somewhat cordial.
1121212112.content:
"30...29...29...27..."

With his hand holding the stopwatch just over eye level, Marc could watch the time and still bask in Claudine flexing her arms to and fro across the table in what was probably the ASL's best exercise routine, grabbing food at arm's length and cramming it into her eager mouth in a mad frenzy. He had to admit, getting Claudine to put down the fork and go by the hand was a bit of a challenge, but with enough well-worded arguments, he had her going in at full charge.

With decent progress, too. At first it'd just looked like an optical illusion under her constantly pouring down food by the barrelful, but in the later days of the week he could see the clear feet of weight being added to her hips, creeping out and over the ends of her dining table's end seat. The yellow shirt was a dead giveaway, too, courtesy of the red one she'd outgrown and thrown out, but now this one was about to cross lines with the third as the mouth rode up to the top of her back's lowest trench of fat sitting on top of her gym pants' superstretched belt.

"...5...4...3...2...1!"

Claudine's back shot back into her seat, hands laying on her belly as she finally took a long, winded breath of fresh air from her session.

"Great work! How're you feeling?"

"Like...like a blimp." Claudine panted.

"We'll see if that's true. Come on!"

Claudine's hooves dug deep into the carpet, not moving as her legs craned her butt up from the chair and straightened her back up at its full length. Given just a week, it wasn't much, but Marc could see just enough extra height on her shoulders to tell that she was taller since they'd last met, but several extra feet of belly bulged away from her spine along its entire curvature, and toned with enough exercise that the flab was tightly rounded out, puffing out in full without any rolls of flab sagging around her body.

She didn't even seem any bit winded on her trek from the table to a wide spot of empty rug they'd kept visiting ever since her revelation, and Marc dragged the ladder in place with a tape measure in his teeth. As he climbed the rungs, the ends of the tape were grabbed by blobs of golden magic that threw its length around her body, but with many feet less of excess than yesterday's cramming.

"Well?" Claudine asked hopefully.

"Hold on..." Marc pulled the tape taut , lining up the furthest dashes of the few-dozen feet wrapping around her massive form. "Damn. 62 feet!"

Without seeing her face, Marc could still feel her satisfaction by a contented being loosened out above. "Perfect...not the biggest, but it's great progress!"

"...and that's just from half a week, if we're going off of tuesday." Marc replied as he stepped back down from the ladder. "So, did you wanna take a break, or anything else?"
1121212112.title: Skip ahead a week: How much has Claudine changed?

Claudine decides to bring up something serious about their training...
11212121121.content:
Claudine took a moment to think before replying. "We will take a small break. The one thing I've learned is that constant training will over create undue stress. A shower would be quite nice."

Marc nodded in agreement. Ever since he spoke to Claudine several days ago, her demeanor had changed a little. Whenever she spoke to him, her tone was always friendly and inviting. Even when she game him what amounted to an order, she was never demeaning or overly strict. In return, he did his best to get her what she needed.

Also, Marc also noted how many times Claudine allowed him to relax around her. Many of his past mistresses would run him ragged and rarely gave him a moment's peace. Claudine, on the other hand, allowed him to take breaks when she did. During those moments, he and Claudine would usually find something to do: watching a movie, talking about the latest crazy thing to happen around the ASL or review Claudine's old matches.

As such, when the two made their way back to Claudine's quarters, Marc wondered what they would do this time...
11212121121.title: These two are getting rather close...

112121211211.content:
***


         Normally for Claudine, the shower would be the most relaxing part of her day; after a long day of training or an intense match, she found nothing put her at ease more than a nice rinse. However, today she found no solace, rather having something, or more precisely, someone, on her mind. It was something Claudine could no longer deny to herself, even though she had only known him for a week, she found herself smitten with Marc. The past couple of days spent with Marc were some of the best she had since joining the ASL. For the first time, she had someone who she actually call a friend beside Avery. Someone who cared and was happy to see her. After much thought about the matter, Claudine decided that she could not wait any longer, the time to act was now, she let too many opportunities pass her by before, she would not let this one slip by.

         After Claudine finished her shower, she found herself looking at the mirror in her room, wearing nothing but a set of black lace lingerie that now seemed a size or two too small for her. Ironically enough, this was the set she wore when Marc found her at night eating ice cream and being forlorn. To add even more to the irony, the lingerie was gifted to her by Avery as to in her words, "Help her find a man!" Claudine was used to Avery's teasing, and so she kept the bra and panties, she used them for when she was in her quarters, and she hated to admit it, but they were very comfortable. As Claudine looked at herself in the mirror, nervousness started to settle in. Would Marc even share the same feelings she had for him? She started to let reality set in: Not only was she significantly heavier than Marc to say the least, she was also much taller, 20 feet versus 6 feet was a very large margin. “Who knows,” Claudine uttered to herself, attempting to comfort herself, “Maybe Marc likes girls with a figure like mine.” Claudine heard of some assistants coming into the ASL purely to ogle at the wrestlers. As lousy as that sounded, it gave Claudine some faith as she saw her large figure. Her heart was racing as if she was finished with a training session, “It’s now or never,” Claudine whispered to herself, ready to face whatever may come next.

***


         Marc was a little concerned; normally Claudine was a lot faster in her showers, but he figured he had her reasons, Marc decided to pass the time by scheduling out the rest of Claudine’s regimen. It’s only been a week but she’s made amazing progress so far. Marc himself felt good as well, never before was he so invested in a wrestler, and for the first time in a while, he was actually happy. His thoughts were interrupted when he heard Claudine.

“M-Marc? Can you come in please?”

         The thought hit Marc, he had never been in Claudine’s room before, he wondered what Claudine could want, and decided to not keep her waiting.

         Along the way, Marc questioned how he would even open Claudine’s door, given the size difference between the two. Thankfully though, the door was left partially open, so Marc didn’t have to worry about that. As Marc opened the door, he saw that the room was…dark? Marc found that the only light in the room came from candles, which was a little weird, but that left the question, where was-

          “Claudine!” Marc exclaimed, seeing her on the bed with nothing but a black bra and underwear, both of which seemed way too small for her. Marc was stunned, he didn’t know what to say, he had seen Claudine like this before, but she was covered in a robe at least, was she going to ask him to find it?

“What…what are you doing Claudine?” Was all Marc could stammer.

         Claudine raised her hand at him, most likely as an attempt to calm him down, “I know this is a little weird Marc, but please, just…sit down and I’ll explain everything.” She patted the mattress, inviting him to the bed. Confused, Marc had no other choice but to join the unicorn. Even though she sat on the bed, Marc still found himself craning his neck to look at her face, which looked just as nervous as Marc was. Due to Claudine’s sheer weight, as soon as Marc sat on the mattress, he found himself slumped against her side. For a while he attempted to get out of hit, but eventually gave up, wanting to know what Claudine had in her mind.

         Claudine let out a long sigh, and she began to speak, “I’ve had a lot of assistants in my time in the ASL, but you…you Marc, you’re really something different. Every day you’re always happy to see me, and you work your best to keep me in shape. When you look at me, you don’t see me as a boss, but rather a friend.” Marc was happy to hear this, to be honest; Marc hoped Claudine would consider him as a friend, so this was going even better than he hoped!

“But…”
         That’s not what Marc wanted to hear! How did he mess up, what did he do? More importantly, what would Claudine do to him? It was obvious that Claudine saw the panic well up in Marc, as she immediately tried to soothe him, “No no Marc! You did not do anything wrong! It’s just…” Claudine sighed again and shifted her position in bed as to face Marc.

         ”Do you remember that romance show you caught me watching at night, the first day you met me? As time passed and I got to know you better, I saw that you were nice and kind and…sometimes at night I imagined us doing the things in the show and…” Claudine took a second to compose herself. “I’ve never been good at this, so let me just get to the point, I’ve grown fond over you over the past week, I know this maybe too soon, but I would be remiss if I were to let this chance slip by. I…I want to be more than friends with you Marc, I…I have feelings for you. My question to you is, do you feel the same way as I do?”

         Mark was in shock, he did not expect any of this, perhaps his enthusiasm for Claudine worked a little too well. He took some time to process what she said, Claudine liked him, enough so that she asked him out! It was a short amount of time, but Marc liked Claudine as well, however, he wasn’t sure if he liked Claudine the way she liked him. Should he give Claudine a chance?
112121211211.title: Claudine's Confession

choices: Claudine wanted to take the relationship slow.
1121212112111.content:
The more Marc thought about Claudine's offer, the more he found himself liking it. Out of all the wrestlers Marc worked under, by far he found Claudine to be the best. She was nice and fair to him, and actually treated him like a person. Even though their time had been short, Marc felt the happiest he'd been since working under the ASL. When Marc found Claudine at night alone, he promised her he would do anything to get her to the top, but he also wanted to see her happy. And if he could do anything to help her, then he would.

         It also helped that he thought Claudine was pretty as well. Her white fur was elegant much like herself, and her personality won him over. And although Marc would never admit it, he would give the occasional glance over at Claudine whenever she bent over to stretch. Marc made up his mind: he'd give Claudine a chance.

Unfortunately, while Marc was thinking, time went by, and the more time went on, the more Claudine thought Marc's silence meant a refusal to answer.

She sighed, "I knew it was a long shot. It's fine Marc, I promise I won't be mad at you." By the time Marc got out of his train of thought he saw Claudine nearly in tears.
He tried to grab her attention, but much like Marc earlier, she was consumed in her own thoughts. "Claudine!" he shouted, trying to get her attention but failing, so he decided to grab her attention in another way. He kissed her. Due to the size difference, it took all he had to jump up, so the kiss ended up being a small peck. It wasn't the kiss Marc had in mind, but it was just as effective. "Marc...what are you..." Claudine whispered.

"Claudine, I want you to know that I'd love to be your boyfriend, how can I not? You're kind and sweet, and you actually care about me. Of course I'd go out with you! I'd do anything to make you happy."Marc said, meaning every word.

For a few seconds, Claudine didn't say anything. Finally, she let out a small laugh, which eventually turned into a giggle, which soon turned into a fit of laughter. It was the first time Marc saw her laugh like this, it was different from the elegant nature she usually carried around, but it was goddamned adorable, and he couldn't help but laugh with her. So much so that he didn't even notice Claudine grab him, and by the time he realized, he was face first in her chest, not that that was a bad thing, Marc thought to himself.

"I am so glad you said yes Marc." Claudine cooed to her now boyfriend, lifting him up so they could be face to face. Marc replied, "I wouldn't have it any other way."
Claudine giggled again, and brought Marc closer for another kiss, this time with passion! It was easily the best kiss Marc ever had. Still dazed, Marc asked, "So, what do you want to do know?"

Claudine took a moment to think about it, and made her decision. "Well my little Marc..."

112121211212.content:
"Marc," Claudine intoned as they entered her apartment. "I have a serious question for you."

Marc blinked. "Okay."

"I think it's safe to say that we have made good progress. But I can't help but feel like I could get bigger, faster..."

Marc frowned slightly. They had been training hard for the past several days. What more could they really do but stay the course. It wasn't like there was some magic way for her to get larger. Or, at least none that he knew.

Claudine sighed when she caught his expression. "I'm sorry Marc, I don't mean to demean any of your efforts. Truly, if it wasn't for you, I wouldn't even be as big as I'm am now. But I can't help but feel I'm doing as much on my part..."

"But you've done nothing but stuffed and worked yourself like crazy! I mean, you've done in a few days what most fighters do in weeks!"

Claudine nodded. "Under your encouragement and management we've achieved much. However, there is another way, I was thinking. A way for me to take the a true leap into becoming the best. If I do this...it would be compromising part of my beliefs but it could truly turn out for the better..."

Marc's brow arched in surprise before his eyes widened in realization. "Y-You can't be saying..."

Claudine gave solemn nod. "I am saying that I will agree to do a survival match. Just one, Marc."

The young man slapped a hand to his forehead. "Against who?" He was afraid of the answer.

"Charla."

Now Marc's jaw fell. Charla was one of the biggest anthro in the entire facility. She was also one of the best fighters and hungriest to boot. She was always looking to devour more and larger competitors. Charla, however, would also take whatever she could get her claws one.

"...You're serious about this aren't you?" It was all he could say.

"Yes. I am." Claudine responded. "I'm going to do it, Marc. You got me to realize that I had fallen into a rut and helped to start getting me out. But you also helped me realize that I need to change my methods. If I don't, then, all of this will mean nothing. I can't allow myself to just plateau out like before. I don't want to simply be one of the best, Marc. I want to be the very best."

As Marc stared in her eyes, he knew Claudine meant every word of that. He need that she might actually be able to do it but he couldn't shake off the feeling that of what if she couldn't? What if things went bad? Claudine was more than just his ticket to an easy time in the hellhole that was the ASL. She had become a dear friend.

"So, Marc. What I'm asking is if I should wait or should I just go for it? I know enough about Charla, so studying her would be redundant. Also, If I were to try an bulk up even more, I'm just really playing her game aren't I? She's used to being huge, I am not."

Marc bit his bottom lip. He never thought he'd be in this sort of situation. In the end, after about two minutes thinking it over, he gave his answer.
112121211212.title: Claudine decides to bring up something serious ...

choices: "...I know somebody who could help us."
Skip to the fight, or something else.
1121212112121.content:
"Claudine," Marc began, looking her right in the eye. "I'm not gonna stop you if you decide to go through with this, and I'll help in any way I can to prepare, no matter how many dinners I have to ship here. But I just wanna make sure, and be absolutely sure that you're ready to go through with this.

"Now, with all that said, are you absolutely sure about this?"

Marc's mind held true to what he'd said, legs ready to run and take any order she'd lay out first, but a small part of his heart still hoped Claudine changed her mind. Throughout all the time they'd spent together, Marc never had much of a fear of Claudine never returning from the ring, but here, he felt a genuine risk of losing a friend like his past master.

Indeed, Claudine looked like she was taking his words to heart, face tense in deep thought. She scratched at the bottom of her chin, letting a long moment of silence between the two of them, but then gave a confident nod.

"Yes." She finally spoke. "I'm absolutely sure about this."

Marc breathed in, held it in, then let it out, shrugging. "Alright. I'm in."

She nodded again, then pushed her immense weight off of the couch, footsteps seeming to strike just a little bit harder as she dragged her belly across the carpeted floor. The two were silent once again as Claudine pulled out her desk's chair with her magic and sat down, also unrolling a browned sheet of paper from a roll on the wall.

Even after saying yes, something about Claudine's movements were still slow and cautious compared to her average confidence and speed as she took out a pen, licked the tip, dipped the quill in ink, flattened out the paper, checked the pen once more, and then flattened the paper again before scribbling Charla's name into the survival slip. She looked back at Marc, who quietly turned his head the other way, and she looked back down to jot some other notes concerning the match's specifics.

At the bottom of the sheet, her quill hit the dotted line, but stuck there for several seconds before swiftly drawing her name in cursive. With all the needed details filled in, Claudine took up the page and observed her handwriting at arm's length, giving it one last, long look until she grabbed a pneumatic tube and unscrewed the lid, using her magic to roll up the scroll and tuck it into the pod.

Marc still didn't turn back as she went through one more pause, nor when he heard the pneumatic system's port open up for the tube to be slotted in, which he could hear zoom right into the ceiling.

"Alright." Marc noted, stepping around to face her. "I'm in with you all the way."

"Thank you, Marc." Claudine answered, both hands braced on the desk. "...I've signed us up for tomorrow at midnight."

"So, what now?" Marc asked. "You know what to do when you go against her?"

"Well, as soon as possible, I was thinking..."

11212121121213.content:
Before either knew it, the time of the match had arrived. The stadium the match was taking place in was enormous, built to house the largest of competitors. There were rows and rows surrounding the gigantic ring, each filled to the brim with various humans and anthros. Each one of them had paid hefty sums to be at the ring today and were eager to see the match get going. Their combined energy filled the air and their roars and chants made the entire place vibrate.

For his part, Marc was ringside. He was at a special lift allowing him to be level with Claudine's neck. The unicorn was seated on a large metal stool fitted for her size, eyes closed and simply meditating. She was blocking out the hoots and roars of the crowd, focusing herself. Her horn pulsed and hummed with energy, ready to fire at a moments notice. Claudine's expression was peaceful if stern. Marc had taken to gently rubbing circles in the crook of the unicorns neck, a small but reassuring gesture.

Honestly, while Claudine certainly didn't mind, Marc was honestly doing this for himself. It comforted him to feel Claudine's healthy combination of flab and muscle underneath his palms. It reminded him of how much work they had done and that Claudine was hopped up rookie with a death wish.

It also helped him to keep his mind off her opponent who stood eager at the other side of the ring. Charla was an immense form of dinosaur of dinosaur protoplasm and muscle. She was honestly the biggest anthro Marc had ever seen, towering over the ring and much of the stands in the background. She was also some strange hybrid. Her neck and tail reminded him of large hebivores with their immense length. However, he could spot the large and sharp teeth in her smile and the strong claws that were her hands. Marc couldn't even begin to guess at all that was in her.

"I can take her, Marc." Claudine spoke, getting his attention.

Marc took a deep breath. "I really want to believe that. I trust you, I really do but..."

"She's huge." Claudine finished. "I know. That makes her dangerous but it's also her biggest weakness. Charla is not fast and she needs to get in range to do damage. I'm her worst kind of opponent. I can hammer her energy blast even before she gets near me and I'm used to fighting those bigger than me. It also helps that Charla has been preying on large but inexperienced fighters for some time now. Mainly from the Silver division. She will be rusty."

The young man nodded to her logic. Suddenly, a siren went off, signaling the start of the match. There was no referee as one wasn't need. Once both combatants got into the ring, there was no turning back and to top it off, there were no rules. Only one of the fighters could walk away from a Survival match.

Claudine hoisted herself up from her stool. She peered down at Marc and smiled. "Don't worry. I'll win." Her tone was so confident and sincere, Marc felt his doubts start wash away.

"I know you will." He returned the smile with actual feeling.

Claudine nodded and turned, stepping into the ring and her destiny.

112121211212131.content:
At the same time, Claudine's hoof and Charla's claw set foot in the ring, and all the cheers of the audience faded into silence. Even if there wasn't a rulebook, a moment of silence was a common custom for all the other matches in the ASL, especially for the more anticipated or iconic battles, but now, the entire stadium was completely hushed. Not even the usual idiots screaming "I love you" to the fighters made a peep, allowing Charla to break the silence first with an amused chuckle.

"Well, I can see somebody's decided to give the high dive a try, then." She spoke rather eloquently, to Marc's surprise. "Why the sudden change of heart?"

"Oh, there's not been a single change, Charla." Claudine responded, trying to fit in with what'd probably be first and last sophisticated moment between them. "I've simply accepted what I should've seen the moment I'd entered the gold division; to advance."

"...and I guess moving onto the very top wasn't enough for you, was it?" She retorted, hitching up her gold-framed belt.

"The top's always beyond our reach, Charla. There truly isn't any end to the journey." Claudine hunched over, squashing her stomach along the rings rubber-coated floor as she braced her hands along her legs. "Once I've beaten you, I'm sure I won't even be halfway there."

"Very well." Charla followed her action, her ambitious smirk never leaving her maw. "Prove it."

"On go!"

The referee waved a flag right down the center line, the terror clear on his face and ready to send him running out of the stare down's path.

"Three...two...one...GO!!!"

He sloppily threw the flag down, more occupied as he ran for his life into the safety outside of the ring, even though they didn't slam into one another the moment the match began. Charla was the one who gave the first move and, as slow as her weight forced her to be, ran as fast as she could towards Claudine, who didn't move from her spot.

The doubts swam back into Marc's mind as Charla threw her arms down, now close enough to rip Claudine in half like a phone book, but her claws only swept through a swarm of pink particles of energy twirling in the air. Having sent a rippling blast of magic from her horn, Claudine's boulder-like form quickly swerved away from the attack and hovered around Charla's side with a trail of rippling, golden-hued waves in her path, her hooves skidding along the ground when she was behind her foe. With another spell, she leapt off of an explosion of yellow light that sent her weightlessly flying towards Charla's back, and she hooked an arm out to connect around the chimera's neck.

Charla nearly came tumbling down as she felt Claudine's arm and weight suddenly cling onto her neck, teetering her onto one foot, but with her mind racing she swung her arm down and spun her entire body around so she was facing up, her momentum throwing the unicorn up into the air like a hammer.

"COME ON, CLAUDINE!!!" Marc screamed, both supportive and fearful as Claudine regained her senses in midair. With another spell, her body bounced off a round forcefield of pink that stopped her spinning, and she then dented the metal in the stadium's skeleton as she slammed back into the ground with both hooves.

True to what Claudine had said, Charla didn't have that much of an acrobatic way to recover from the shock, and the unicorn was ready with a stunning energy blast that struck her foe's face. The chimera blindly stumbled into the ring, trying to steady her head, and Claudine was quick get on her case with a magic-infused running start that sent her sliding and skidding on her back with a leap, and another gold burst sent her flying up to knock the wind out of Charla's belly with a hoof, soaring overhead.

Marc's screams turned to cheers, melding into those of all the rest of the crowd.

Even better, as Charla'd found her balance, he could see the confidence that she'd been smiling around was waning away, already giving into frustration. Claudine didn't give her a chance to act on it and, only noticed then by the audience and her foe, pulled down on a cord of yellow light stringing from her horn that she'd cast onto Charla's forehead. The larger anthro was yanked onto her side, losing her balance again, but didn't fall, only giving a few zig-zagged stomps to regain control.

Claudine didn't even have to superjump to grapple with Charla's neck again as she ran past, and she was allowed to stay for a little while as Charla let her anger get the best of her, now to desperate to claw or swing her sudden archenemy off as she braced her legs onto her scaly backside and leapt off, sending the once-towering behemoth to the ground with a resounding boom.

1121212112121311.content:
Charla's world was spinning and she couldn't comprehend the 'how' or 'why'. How was this-this runt of a unicorn doing this to her? How was her supreme and magnificent bulk being thwarted so easily?! She, Charla, was being handed her extremely large ass on a platter! Her vision was somewhat blurry, making it hard to focus. She tried to turn over onto her stomach but nothing happened. Oh sure, she lifted herself up for a second but then quickly fell back to the arena floor with a thundering *boom*. Her limbs felt like lead weights attached to her body, heavy and unresponsive. Even her tail was like onto a limp rod sticking out from her blubbery body.

But Charla wasn't given too much time to ponder her pitiful condition. Before she knew it, her limbs were moving but not of her will. Her strong and bulbous limbs were being straightened out and pinned to her body. Just as she was about to try and do something, anything, about it, she left the same force that acting on her limbs, seem to wrap itself around her head, specifically, her jaws. Charla's eyes widen as they glimpse a familiar golden glow. The unicorn's magic!

The fuzziness of her brain clears and everything comes back into focus...just in time for her to witness a gaping maw approach her head.

Claudine, horn shining brightly with power, stretched her jaw as wide as she could before descending onto the tip of Charla’s snout. All the while she maintained her magical bindings on her opponent/prey. Through the spell, Claudine could feel Charla trying to move. It was far too weak to even hope to break the unicorn's hold but she kept them tight, just in case.

Claudine worked her way down Charla’s snout. Unlike many others, who would have drawn out their meal, taking time to savor their opponent, Claudine only cares about ending this. She cares only about her final victory and her true prize. So, she wastes little time. Her focus is absolute. Between her sheer gusto of devouring Charla and maintaining her hold on the dinosaur’s limbs, she barely registers the taste of her competition.

This may have been her first time ever eating anyone but Claudine was taking to hit easily. She had long studied how to do it, even if she never had employed it. Always better to have knowledge and even if you never intended to use it. You might never know when it may benefit you. But it was clear now, that she had done the right thing if her quick and steady progress was anything to go by.

Marc was nearly screaming himself hoarse as he watched his mistress, his friend, his partner work her way through her meal. It was almost surreal watching Claudine’s body distend and grow to accommodate her meal...

112121212.content:
In a brief pause, Claudine's face went slack in defeat, and her head hung lower. If just for a few seconds, it no longer looked like she was trying to seem invincible warrior immune to defeat or stress; beneath all the expensive makeup and training, she seemed just like any other anthro, one with a lot of stress tangled in her heart in need of someone to open up to.

Sadly, it was only for a few seconds, and she'd caught her guard just as quickly as she'd let it down.

"Oh...what do you care?" She snapped, tears still flowing down her rounded cheeks as she turned her anger on him. "What's it to you what I'm going through?!"

"I...just..." He may have expected it, but Marc still found his words tumbling out in the wake of her volume. "Saw you, and I...Thought I'd...see if I could...help?"

"Help?! How could you help?!" She growled, grabbing the couch's arm as she leaned on her side to leer at him. "How could you understand what I'm going through?! You haven't even known me for a single day! You don't have any idea what it's like to be totally alone in this dump, surrounded by people who either can't stand you or couldn't care less if you got eaten in the ring!"

Having heard that, Marc had to supress the urge to give her a sneer of his own, but he managed to keep his voice steady and calm. Right now, she just needed some time to vent. "I'm...I'm very sorry, Claudine, I only meant to help..."

"Well, I don't need your help!" She turned back to the TV, crossing her arms along her chest. "If that's the way the system works, then fine! I don't need anybody!"

She didn't say anything else, but Marc stayed in the doorway, watching as she pointed her eyes at the cheerful colors and upbeat music in the gameshow with bitterness and anger. She stayed totally still, the only visible movement from her being that of her blinking, but Marc could still see the streams on her cheeks flowing with new drops.

Marc let himself look at her before he pulled himself back in the room, suddenly feeling sleepy enough to give a tired sigh...


.....



Through the night, Marc'd never been woken up. The ceiling to his room was still flat when his alarm clock went off, having never had any weight be placed on it after Claudine left.

Taking as much time as he was allowed to waste, Marc got dressed, washed himself up, and steeled himself for having to be face to face with Claudine again, not all to fond of the idea. When he'd left through the bedroom door, which as still as ajar from when it'd been opened over night, Claudine was nowhere to be seen, and the lights were all off behind the doors at the room's other end.

Looking around, he caught notice of a white note taped to the TV, and ran over to its cabinet.


Marc,

I'd gone out for a walk around the facility, and I'll be back at ten. Be ready for your duties when I return.

Claudine.


"Great." Marc said quietly. "Not even twenty four hours in, and she hates me."
112121212.title: Claudine refuses, lashing out as he'd feared!

1121212123.content:
...as he probably should've come to expect, a thought that made him loosen up with an exhausted sigh, despite not feeling remotely tired. With that foresight in mind, he shrugged it off like he had with many of the cruelties he'd been forced to endure before, and crumpled the note up before tossing it over his shoulder.

"Back at ten..." He reminded himself, looking over at the TV's DVD player. 9:05, it read out, which he knew was plenty of time for a quick breakfast before getting himself prepped up. "Eh...might as well enjoy some freedom."


.....



"Hello, Marcus! What can I get you, today?"

No matter who his master was, Emily's smile was always more than enough reprieve whenever he had the rare chance to visit the ASL's coffee shop, the fox girl's portly waistline just the right level of cushy plumpness for him.

"Hey Emily. Mind hitting me up with a plain bagel with cream cheese, an orange juice, and a candy cookie?"

"Ooh...candy cookie." She hissed, knowing full well what that meant. "New boss?"

"...and I made her hate me right on the first night." He finished for her, his head slumping into his hands.

"Ah, I'm sure somebody with your charm'll fix that up in no time!" She winked, turning around to grab from the bagel shelf. "Just wait right up, and I'll be right back!"

"Will do." Emily replied as she turned around to grab from the bagel shelf, but caught notice of her glove when she brought her paw up, a large hole visible along the palm. "...just a quick second, and I'll be right back!"

"Take your time." Marc replied, knowing that half an hour still lay before Claudine would return.

Emily bowed politely before trudging off to the back room. Now alone, Marc gently drummed his fingers on the counter to the beat of the elevator music playing from the ceiling, humming along as he cherished the rare privilege of not being the target of anybody's attention. It may have been just bland stock that was playing, but when compared to the nagging voice's of all the masters he had before, it was like one of the most pure symphonies being played in his ears.

The only detraction from being fully immersed was when the anthro standing behind him came in a little more, coming impatiently close to his back.

"...I'm down here." Marc said loosely, but with no response. That is, until they came in a little closer, letting him feel the warmth of their body's padding beneath a layer of feathers. "Mind backing off?" He spoke again, but was met again with silence. This time, he hunched forward as far as he could to try and ignore them, but now they came forward so much that the breath was squeezed out of him as he was crushed between them and the counter. "Okay, asshole, I'm sure I'm wasting a ton of your life's time right now, but could you just wait and..."

But Marc felt his heart and soul plunge deeper than the basements of the facility when he angled his head to the side, recognizing the golden color off the feathery cliff wedging him in place. Even worse was an orb-like shape to the halves of adipose clipped around him, and he pulled his head back to verify the worst of his fear coming to life; seeing a bright red and yellow set of tail feathers dangling right at the base of an enormous pair of buttcheeks, the signature belt of the gold division digging tight into each of their owners thighs. Their back alone was wide enough to flatten the entire countertop should they fall back, and he bent himself forward to peek at the very top, and whispered a silent prayer when he saw Amaya's head perched right in the very top, who was busy rambling about some story into her phone.

"And so I told him 'no way, you crotch jockey!" and he just stares at me, acting like I'm the one who had the first punch..." She went on, seemingly oblivious to Marc's presence.

With a growing hope that Claudine would be the worst he'd have to face today, Marc tried to wriggle forward, to see if there was any space left to move, but found himself hopelessly trapped. Even worse, he could hear Emily mutter a curse as something inside fell to the floor, and she hurriedly bent down to clean it up, taking away even more precious time.

"Emily!" Marc whispered, but Emily was too far away to hear him without alerting Amaya, who went on with her story in the most obnoxious, nasally voice that she could muster. It just fell into white noise to Marc's ears, who came to zone himself out from the rest of the world, desperately trying to keep himself from moving enough to be noticed.

Sometime soon, but after far too much time to not be torturous, Marc could sense the whining of Amaya's voice give a pause. Curiosity gave way beneath the existential terror building up within, and he angled his head back up to see what was going on, but whimpered when he found himself making eye contact.

Amaya stared right back at him, holding her phone in a way that he could see that it wasn't even on.

"...what are-"

Whatever Marc would've said was snuffed out as Amaya pushed her legs further down around him, crushing all of his body at once within the midpoint of her ass' depth...

11212121231.content:
"...and you kept him where?!"

"Hey, where else was I supposed to?! He was just there, so I went for the kill!"

As his eyes opened, Marc's head was spinning too much for him to recognize the voices as anything but "familiar." All around him was darkness, and in his musty state he thought he was just waking up in the middle of the night from what he was beginning to think was just a weird, horrible dream.

He knew all to well, though, that that horrible dream was only beginning when he looked up and saw a single light hanging from the ceiling that kept only his corner of the room lit, and was quick to realize that his wrists were bound together beneath the seat of the chair he was in.

"Would you two shut up?" A third voice snapped, coming from something big and lumpy in the shadows standing between to others. The center thing noticed he was staring at them and froze up, then her pose relaxed. "See? You've both awoken out guest."

"W-Where am I?" Marc demanded, fighting against the ropes, but found they were nice and tight. "What the hell's going on here?!"

"Just business." The center one's voice answered, and Marc stopped struggling, his mind now cleared enough to recognize who was speaking and be utterly, utterly terrified of it. "The only kind of business you can do if you wanna get up in the ASL."

Marc didn't answer, his lips moving about as he narrated a voiceless prayer. Seeing him stay still, the center one stepped towards the light, the first thing entering being the front of a heavily muscle-packed gut that was armored with sturdy black scales, followed by a large pair of breasts that lay on top in a black tank top.

When Roxanne's head entered the light, an all to pleased grin opened up to a line of razor sharp teeth, and she brushed away a lock of her raven hair to bask in his terror.

"Good." She observed, pulling a balisong from her pant's pocket and flicking open the clip, expertly twirling it around between her clawed fingers. "Now we know who's on what end of the room."

It seemed impossible, given the situation, but Marc let out a chuckle, albeit a very nervous one. "T-This is a joke, right? You can't do this to me! There's...I dunno, regulations? Or something?"

Roxanne snorted. "Well, there's definitely 'or something' going on here, that's for sure." She looked behind her, motioning her head to the other two standing behind her. "Girls?"

The other two started moving, coming into the light at either side of Roxanne, and whatever ability Marc had at finding hope in the situation was cremated when they were fully visible. Predictably, Amaya stood at Roxanne's right, her muscular arms crossed as they sat on top of her immense, room filling stomach, while Roxanne's left was occupied by Sapphire, the very edge of her massive behind nearly knocking the dragoness over when she was present, a sneer of utter distaste along the swan's bill as she stared Marc down,.

"Now." Roxanne began, still snapping the knife to and fro. "Here's the deal. You have something we want, and I think you're smart enough to understand the flow of power that's going on around here. Got it?"

"Wh-What could that be?" Marc whispered. "I'm just a servant! I don't have any ties, or anything!"

"Oh, that's where you're wrong, Marky-Mark." Roxanne continued as she tossed the balisong up behind her back and reared her head to catch it in her teeth, then spat it up and went right back into a routine as she caught it on her finger. "A servant's a very important job, and as of yesterday, you're the one of the highest-ranking servants in all the facility!"

"...and you want me because I'm around Claudine." He observed tonelessly, which Roxanne nodded to.

"Yup." Roxanne answered simply. "So, if you still want to be the owner of that title, then we thought you'd be able to help us out before out next fights. Just to keep things fair, you know?"

"What, that's why I'm here?! So you guys can make me get her to lose, or something?!" Marc snapped. "You can't do this! I'm her property, not yours!"

At that, Roxanne stopped playing with the knife, but a toying smile still sat on her face as she pocketed it and came towards Marc, bending down on one knee when she was right in front of the chair. He could feel the fiery air waft through her breath as her face came right in front of his, and he bent his head back as far as he could as the slits of her eyes narrowed on him, her grin turning into that of a hardened killer ready to make the pay.

"Well, whatever it may have said, the law didn't do jack shit to save my boyfriend from me, did it?"

...oh, FUCK.

1141.content:
Marc blew an impressed whistle as he looked up at the distant ceiling of the gold division's residence hall, which was enormous even by anthro standards. Framed black-and-white photographs of anthros fighting in the ring periodically hung the distance along the crimson wall, bordered with white molding against the ceiling, which arched up in a tall concave with intricately designed gold arches meeting in the center beam, from which lights filled with shining crystals were hanging.

Pretty classy for giants paid to beat the crap out of each other... Marc snickered as he pulled out a slip of paper out of his pocket, which bore directions to his new mistress' room.



Hello, Marc Youngblood ,and welcome to the Gold Division of the Anthro Sumo League!


You are one of few with the privilege to help maintain the flow of one of the world's greatest pasttime and invigorate the spirit of our reigning champions, bringing excitement to thousands of eager fans spanning across the globe!


Your assigned champion is Avery Etherglades of chamber 722 ! We wish you a hearty welcome and hope you enjoy your experiences in the Anthro Sumo League!





"722...722...772..." Marc muttered as her walked down with his eyes on the brass number plates on each door of the hall. The doors were incredibly big, each a couple stories tall and almost as wide. Behind a few he could hear muffled, adamant voices, as though their owners were demanding something or scolding a staff member.

But a ground-shaking WHAM!!! slamming into the wall behind him made him jump and spin around in shock, just in time to see a framed picture fall and shatter on the ground. By fate's hand, the door's plate read 722.

"AND THE CROWD GOES WILD!!!" Somebody whooped inside, followed by a chain rattling.

With his heart pounding from the surprise, Marc uneasily approached the door, fearful of the potential strength of this "Avery", and how big she could possibly be against his relatively tiny body. A doorbell was built for his height into the doorframe, which he took a few moments of self-encouragement to press with his thumb. But in an unusually quick instance the door swung open on its own, with nobody to greet him.

"C'min!" A voice called from inside.

Marc obeyed, stepping into a room that almost looked like a gymnasium stocked with giant-scaled dumbbells, a bench press, and all other kinds of exercise equipment, with a gold-sized bed standing in the corner. In the left half of the room was a hulking, monster-sized roc whaling into a punching bag chained to the ceiling, rallying into it three times before its chain snapped and it soared into the wall away from her. Her body was covered in spotty gray feathers with a head of straight, decent-lengthed brown hair, sporting a medium-sized curled beak that looked as though it was carved from metal. He couldn't tell how "XL" the black t-shirt and gym shorts she was wearing were, but assumed they were far beyond the thousands.

Oh, joy... Marc dreaded as he verified his new boss' size. She looked to be near thirty feet tall, and her balloon-body was ludicrously swollen with fat, but beneath her obese exterior he could see copious amounts of muscles that made her limbs even wider than he'd think possible, her legs large enough that her mammoth-sized butt completely filled her body's width. Her shirt's design was blurred as it stretched around her titanic breasts, and only covered about a third of her stomach's surface area as it sprawled out onto the ground. But rather than hang in front of her like a saggy blob, it boasted a firm, orb-like roundness from constant exercise he assumed she always practiced.

She stomped on a button on the ground, which made another punching bag lower from a panel in the ceiling. Tensing her fists, she stroke three more punches into the bag, sending it flying into the growing pile against the wall.

"Yeah...that's the stuff!" She sighed proudly, then turned her head to look down at Marc. "So, you that new 'Marco' guy working here?"

"Yup. It's Marc, though."

"Gotcha. Name's Avery!" She picked up a drink the size of an oil drum from a shelf on the wall and took a long swig, wiping her beak upon breaking away. "Wanna drink?"

"Nah, I think I'm good."

"Suit yourself."

Her belly dragged along the floor as she heaved her bulk to a full-body mirror on the wall, staring straight in the eyes of her own reflection. She clenched her fists and slowly raised them in front of her face, then started throwing empty punches at the mirror.

"So, uh...anything you need me to do, Avery?"

Before Marc could respond...

Marc carefully grabbed the lever and pushed it forward, causing a whirring sound to buzz within as its contents began running through the hose and into Avery's beak, who happily chugged down the shake without pausing even to take a breath. He could see her belly slowly crawl forward along the ground as it became distended from her feasting, and creases started to stretch along the sides of the shirt as it stretched around her expanding girth.

"ulp...ulp...ulp..ulp...MMM!" Avery flashed Marc a thumb's up, who threw the switch back and cut off the flow. The shake left her gut significantly more bloated, which made it harder for her to evenly walk as she laboriously lurched to a shaking machine in the corner and wrapped the belt around waist, but it was so tight that it dug deep into the flesh of her stomach.

She flipped the switch that brought the machine to life, sending a steady vibration through the softness of her body.

"Good luck out there, Avery!" I told her as the two of us stood outside the stadium doors. By that point the shake she'd eaten had completely assimilated within her body, thickening her already enormous body even further.

"Trust me, squirt. If it'd been luck all this time, I'd be She smirked and grabbed the door's handle and cranked it open, filling the hallway with the frantic cheers and screams of the audience filling the stadium.

The stadium itself was massive, awe-inspiringly so. Every single seat was packed, hundreds of rows surrounded the ring all the way to the furthest regions near the ceiling. The lighting above was arranged over the ring to make it look as though its rubber surface was pure gold, down to the shimmer and sparkle of a gold brick. Dead center above was what looked like a chandelier of LCD screens showing feed of Avery strutting down the aisle, standing tall and firm with great pride as she relished in the excitement from the crowd.

"...LADIES AND GENTLEMEN, TONIGHT ONLY ON ASL, YOU'LL BE SEEING THE ARTISTIC FLAIR OF ONE OF OUR GREATEST FIGHTERS IN ACTION!" The loudspeakers resounded over the roaring audience. "WILL SHE PROUDLY STILL CARRY HER MOUNTING STREAK, OR SHALL IT BE BROKEN TONIGHT? LET'S FIND OUT AS WE INVITE TO THE RING, THE BOXING BEAUTY HERSELF, AVERY ETHERGLADES!!!"

The cheering somehow manages to ascend even louder as Avery stepped onto her end of the ring, a confident smile across her beak as she flexed her biceps to show off the great strength beneath her meaty exterior.

"...AND ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE COIN LIES HER COMPETITOR, EITHER ANOTHER VICTIM IN HER REIGN OR HER POTENTIAL SUCCESSOR..."

"Remind me to *urp* remind the ASL to give ya a raise!"

.....


"So, any final consensus on Avery as a boss, yet?"

"Well, I'd been too busy getting her protein shakes as of late to really observe her, but she's still been pretty cool."

Claudine gave an amused giggle, quaking the shoulder that Marc sat upon. "Well, whatever that filth is, it's a gold mine. That's for sure."

11:57, and still no sign of the Roc that'd laid down the time in the first place. Marc hadn't even seen her in bed that morning, only a thankful note on her bed telling him to take the day off. With nowhere else to really go, he went to check up on Claudine, who was more than welcoming towards her frenemy's helper, even going so far as to make him breakfast.

But even if he wasn't the one about to be in the center of the stadium, Marc was getting weary. Word' been spreading pretty quickly along a lot of the other fighters about Avery and Claudine going into demigod size to fight one another out of the ring, and many of the league'd gathered in a colorful row some dozens of feet away from the ring, anxious to watch the impending mushroom cloud.

"Where is she, by the way?" Claudine pondered, finally getting concerned. "She's never late for a fight!"

"Well, we've only got..." Marc checked his watch. "Two minutes. I'm sure she's just-"

WHUMP

A loud tremor quaked from past the doorway against the training ring, strong enough to actually send a jiggle through Claudine's flab. Another followed, followed by another, and another, and the distant audience of sumos all broke out in a roaring applause, shaking their fists in the air with obnoxious whoops.

Without a word, Claudine gently plucked Marc off her shoulder and craned him down on the ground. Once free, he didn't waste any time running as far from the ring and audience as he could get while still having a view of the two fighters, and Claudine slowly rose off the ground, bracing her legs into the mat floor and rising her arms into fighter mode. She didn't look look the least bit intimidated; determined, even, ready for whatever opponent could stomp through the door.

Marc wasn't.

Avery simply walked straight into the doors and let her stomach push them apart. Heaving its weight around cost her several seconds to completely lug her entire body through the door, as it formed a borderline perfect sphere of mass puffing out from her body, save for its droop onto the matted ground.

Marc couldn't believe it. Ever since Avery'd gone to bed, she looked like she'd shot up another ten feet, and her body'd been overcome by a noticeable lean towards the flabby half of her body over the muscles she also boasted. A pair of sizable love handles hung down along either side of her belly, along with dimply cellulite hanging underneath her arms and thighs, but still throbbed with ridiculous tanks of muscle underneath.

Whether she was still cramming for the battle or giving her doughy body more character, Avery was choking down a hero sandwich, gagging it down her throat without chewing a bite. She crammed the rest of the end into her mouth and swallowed the whole enchilada in one swig, chasing back up with a soft belch, leering at Claudine with a cocky grin.
114122111323.title: "Sure but I'll have to bulk up a bit. T...
