1142.content:
Marc's eyes fell on the name of his new mistress...and he winced. They'd stuck him with Pearl, the voracious orca woman: "Buffet Girl", the hype guys called her--she was only on the ALS scene to eat. That was it, just eat. Not the fame, not the money; just gulp down everything she could; be it other fighters, or "normal" food.

Nobody knew her thoughts on humans...but that assumed she HAD any thoughts beyond her next meal.

Great, another throw of the dice, Marc snarked mentally. At least with crazies like Dominique I'd KNOW I'm walking into pain, but with Pearl you never know if she'll eat you first thing or just ignore you all the time. I could be signing my death warrant just opening the--

*SMACK!*

"--door," He finished aloud. Without realizing it, he'd been walking down the hallsduring his reverie, and right to a fiighter's door. Again.
Marc rubbed his aching nose, thankful nobody saw that embarrassment. He REALLY needed to stop spacing out like that...

He took a moment to listen at the door, hoping to hear something that could clue him in to Pearl: a movie playing, her exercising...or a screaming human getting eaten. But nothing came. Had she soundproofed the door? Weird. Well, better just bite the bullet.

Steeling himself, Marc threw open the door...

...To behold a giant black and white beanbag chair flopped on the couch.
"What the hell?" He looked around, expecting to see a giant animal woman pounce at him from the side; but no attack came. "Um, hello?"

The beanbag burped. Then it moved.
Marc's jaw dropped as the topmost section of bulge swiveled down, and found a pair of beady black eyes staring at him. Pearl had been right there, so fat and obese she barely resembled an orca. She was more like a blob TRYING to look like an anthropromorphic whale.

Pearl swallowed whatever she'd had in her mouth, sending rippless down her impossibly fat body.
Marc had to strain to spot her limbs and fins amidst the rolls of blubber.

"Huh," she rumbled, "My human's here. Neat." She shrugged, grabbed an entire pizza from somewhere...then rolled it up and stuffed it in her mouth, chomping it in two bites. Then she burped again. "Well, since you're here and all..."
1142.title: Pearl.

choices: Pearl groans and spits him out
11421.content:
"What?!" Marc yelped. "I just got here two seconds ago!"

"Yeah--urp--and I'm already wasting--bworp--away," the blob-shaped orca said casually between eruptions of gas. "Now be a good snack and climb in my mouth."

Pearl leaned forward and opened her mouth, rolling out a fat, pink tongue like a red carpet. URRRRP! Her latest belch washed over Marc, making his eyes water. Her breath reeked, smelling like an ocean full of dead fish and junk food. With one fat finger, Pearl pointed inside, acting as if it was completely reasonable to order a man she just met to climb into her mouth and be swallowed down to his doom. Marc had other ideas. He turned around to run out the door and reached for the doorknob. It took his brain a second to process that there wasn't one.

The orca groaned. "You humans are all alike. Why can't you just do what you're told?" Pearl reached into a roll of fat and pulled out a box of cookies. She ripped open the top, lifted it above her head and poured them all down her waiting gullet. She then followed it up by swallowing the empty box.

"Oorp--whatever," she said. "Guess I gotta do this myself."

Even though Pearl had the advantage of size, Marc figured he was easily fast enough to outrun this tub of blubber. He had to run to put distance between him and her until he could find some way to fight her off or escape. Maybe he could crawl through the air vents and--Pearl opened her mouth and heaved herself off the couch with impossible speed. Marc hadn't managed to take a step before the avalanche of fat was falling towards him, her mouth perfectly positioned to engulf him up. It was clear this wasn't her first time.

Marc let out a scream as Pearl landed on her stomach and clamped her jaws around his top half. With practiced ease she slurped up his legs like a noodle. Luckily--for a given definition of "luckily"--she didn't mindlessly swallow him like she had the pizza or cookies. If her happy moans were any indication, the obese orca enjoyed the taste of live prey. The rational part of Marc's brain knew it shouldn't be a surprise, what with all the survival matches she'd fought in and won. However, the rational part of Marc's brain had gone bye-bye, and he was screaming for his life as Pearl sucked and slurped on him, drenching him in saliva and running him over her taste buds. As she tasted him, she let out another belch, then another, and another. Marc choked on the scent, even as he struggled in vain to free himself.

"Knock, knock," a suave anthro velociraptor in a suit barged into Pearl's room without waiting. "I just came to see if you're ready for--"

"Can' talk, Mistuh Tal'n," Pearl slurped. "Eatin'."

"Yes," Dante Talon said, rolling his eyes. "When are you not--Pearl?! Is that the human you've just been assigned?!"

"Uh-huh," Pearl said, unashamed.

"Damn it, Pearl," the raptor said. "You've already eaten the past dozen humans assigned to you this month! Don't you remember our conversation yesterday?"

"Nuh-uh."

The raptor sighed. "I told you that if you ate the human I sent you today, then you've reached your limit for the rest of the season! Do you really want to go the rest of the year doing your own chores? Making your own meals? Training by yourself?"

Pearl grunted and the gears in her brain turned as she continued to suck on Marc. On the one hand: food now. On the other hand: work... But on the one hand: FOOD NOW! What to do? She mulled over the question as Marc begged for mercy in her mouth. Now Marc's fate rested on whether the orca's sloth outweighed her gluttony. Judging by the size of her stomach, her sloth would have to be several tons.

What happened next?
11421.title: "Meh, guess I'll eat ya."

114212.content:
As Pearl thought about whether or not a slave was worth giving up a treat now, a sound from her stomach made her decision for her.

Grrrrrrrrwwwwwwwwwlll...

FOOD NOW.

Marc gave a scream as the orca forced him to the back of her throat and swallowed him whole. He was constricted all around by her throat muscles as he plummeted down into her gut. He landed on a mountain of masticated food, some of which he'd just seen her munching on only minutes ago. Her stomach was a landfill of past meals, but her gut was so large, Marc could--and did--take a few stumbling steps forward and began punching at her stomach walls.

"LET ME OUT! LET ME OUT!"

UUUUUUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRRRPPPPPPPPPPPPPPP!

Outside, Pearl gave a satisfied sigh as she smacked her lips, tasting her would-be human servant all over again. Mr. Talon rolled his eyes at the display.

"What are we going to do with you, Pearl?"

"Give me seconds?" the orca asked hopefully.

"I just told you you've used up all your allotted human slaves!" the raptor said.

"Oh... right... BWAAAAAAAAAAARP!" She smacked her lips again. "Worth it... Can you help roll me back on the couch?"

Mr. Talon sighed.

While the two anthros approached the situation casually, Marc wasn't willing to resign himself to his fate as whale food. He kept hitting at the walls of his fleshy prison, begging for release long after it became clear Pearl had no intention of letting him go. She and Mr. Talon talked about her upcoming match and the only sign of Marc's presence was the gaseous emissions the whale regularly unleashed. Even a full grown man hadn't filled her up for long though, as she kept eating throughout the entire affair, causing bits of food to rain down on Marc's head.

Eventually Mr. Talon left and Marc staggered away from the stomach wall, physically and emotionally drained. He sat on a lump of food and immediately jumped up again as something poked him in the butt. He spun around and saw he'd sat on a bone. Specifically a leg bone belonging to a human dressed in casual clothes and sporting an ASL name tag.

"Andy?" Marc whimpered, looking at the skeleton. "I just saw you last night. And now you're--"

PPPPPPFFFFFFFFRRRRRRRRRRTTTTTTTT

Pearl sighed in relief from the explosion of flatulence, the only eulogy she bothered to give for poor Andy. He heard an echoing sound as Pearl patted her stomach contentedly. The walls of her gut pulsed all him, and Marc knew that if he didn't find a way out of here soon, he'd end up being just another skeleton found by the next poor sap Pearl ate.

Can Marc escape?
114212.title: Food Now

choices: Marc lands in Pearl's room without a problem
Marc falls short and lands back in Pearl's mouth
1142121.content:
Pearl awoke the next day around noon. She stretched her fat, little arms as far as they would stretch, shifted her weight off one cheek to let out some morning gas, and grunted contentedly. She'd had a long sleep and was left feeling refreshed, well-rested, and, most importantly, well-nourished. She took in the piles of clutter crowding her apartment, filled with empty food wrappers, dirty dishes and clothes that needed a wash. She knew that if she had a human servant working for her, the place could've been clean enough to eat off of, which appealed to her considering she did little else but eat off of things. However, no human servant would be coming. Mr. Talon had said so. She'd reached her limit and now she'd have no choice but to do all her work herself for the rest of the season. Still, if she had to choose between free labor or a free lunch, food won out every time. She'd never once eaten something and regretted it. Not even that time she'd eaten an entire ice cream truck and gotten the mother of all brain freezes afterwards.

She wasn't completely alone though. Not yet, at least. Though it'd been forty-eight hours since she'd swallowed Marc whole and alive, the little guy, to his credit, had not given up on life in all that time. Alternating between begging for his life or pounding at the walls of her stomach in pitiful attempts to make her sick, her human was hard at work trying to find a way to save himself. She didn't mind it. Whenever she devoured her opponents in Survival Matches, she was usually rendered immobile afterwards, since her meals were just as big if not bigger than she was. She could barely enjoy their struggles with them stretching out her insides. Humans, on the other hand, were the perfect size to snack on. They tended to last for at least a day and during that time they gave the nicest internal massages. Plus, every time she burped she could savor their taste again and again. They were like a meal she could savor long after she'd already eaten it. Marc was no different. He tickled her insides in a funny way and had a yummy aftertaste so she left him to his own devices. He wouldn't escape. No one ever had once she'd eaten them.

The most important thing, Pearl thought, taking out a gigantic size bottle of soda and guzzling it, is that he's right where all food belongs. In my belly.

=== In Her Belly ===

"That's right, drink it all up you fat fish," Marc said as the waterfall of soda cascaded into her stomach. Marc had positioned an empty oil drum on the pile of half-digested food in her gut to catch all of the fizzy liquid. From the smell along the inside, the drum had been filled with fish when Pearl had swallowed it. He had no idea how long it'd been in her stomach, but it hadn't digested yet. Marc had been using it to catch every ounce of soda Pearl had drank since yesterday and now it was overflowing.

The first few hours trapped inside Pearl had been a nightmare as Marc had given in to blind panic and just kicked, screamed and begged to be let out. Naturally all his efforts were met with nothing but silence and continued snacking from his orca captor. When he'd regained his wits, he'd tried collecting all the food into a mountain tall enough to reach the opening leading back to her throat. Unfortunately, the whole thing was unstable, and though he'd reached the opening, he couldn't actually get it open before the mountain collapsed and he was sent tumbling back into the pool of stomach acid. This time the only reaction he'd gotten was an unimpressed belch.

However, that burp had given him inspiration. He'd been around--or rather inside--Pearl for two days now and her expulsions of gas were second in frequency only to her snacking. With the amount of junk food and soda she ate and drank, it was no mystery why. But Marc had to stop himself from laughing with glee when he realized the gas the orca emitted gave him his own built in propulsion system. After he'd found the drum, he began collecting every drop of soda she drank, and now, with the drum full, it was the moment of truth.

"Wish me luck, Andy," Marc said to the skeleton of his co-worker, giving him a thumbs up before wrenching off his leg bone. He drove it into the pile of food, under the heavy drum of soda, and pushed down hard. The makeshift lever went down, the drum tipped over, and gallons of carbonated liquid came into contact with Pearl's insides all at once. The effect was immediate. Everything around Marc started shaking. He braced himself.

=== Pearl's Room ===

Pearl clutched her stomach as it rumbled with the force of an earthquake. She felt like her insides were inflating. She'd never felt like this before. She felt... FULL! Not just full, but like she was about to burst! She didn't even feel like this after she'd eaten that ice cream truck!

She let out a small burp. Then a larger burp. Then an even larger one after that! They kept coming like miniature hurricanes from her belly!

"Was--URAP--it--ORP--something--BBRRAAAAAAPPP--I ate?!"

She couldn't contain herself any longer. Her throat opened involuntarily and the biggest, most earthshaking belch she'd ever made in her life came rumbling out.

UUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPP PPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPP!

=== In Her Belly ===

Marc gave a joyous whoop as Pearl's insides contracted and he was sent flying out of her stomach. Up and up he went, riding her burp like a nuclear warhead. He made it all the way up her throat. However, the fleshy tube constricted. His momentum started to slow down. He was worried he might not make it. He'd just crested her throat and got his first look at the outside world in two days when he realized whether or not he'd make it.

Would this be enough for Marc to escape? Did the burp carry him all the way out to freedom or did it land him right back in the whale's mouth, just short of freedom and an easy second helping for Pearl to swallow back down?
1142121.title: Up Urp and Away

choices: Pearl continues her attempts at persuasion. Are they just as desperate?
Pearl gets winded out and falls asleep. Is this a chance for Marc to get free?
Marc can’t keep his grip forever! He falls!
A knock on the door. Pearl’s got a guest! Do they side with Marc or Pearl?
11421211.content:
Peal fastened her mouth shut with her own tubby mitts, fighting a lone war of conscience at feeling something she’d eaten, something that had seen the inside of her belly, squirm its way back out the very way it came, undigested and alive. This was insanity, outright ludicrous; even Morgan didn’t put up the battle that a single human was putting her through. Seven plus three didn’t equal eight. The Earth wasn’t a giant banana floating space. Anything that Pearl eats never comes out uneaten! This wasn’t happening! THIS WASN’T HAPPENING!!!

...but Marc hadn’t taken his warm cup of reality that morning. No, even if he got plunged back to whence he’d came, if Pearl gulped him back down like he was just another hunk of beef jerky, he was at least going to get far. If he were going to see the afterlife and be bound to the same realm that he, Andy, and all the other humans who met their end with Pearl shared, he wasn’t going to show face around them without a story to tell. He punched, kicked, even bit back at Pearl’s throat muscles’ attempts to put him in his place, grabbing at the wet, scratchy flesh with but a human’s strength battling that of the vacuum of space, but saw the will to move forward, if at a handful of Pearl’s neck at a time.

Pearl craned her head upwards, massaging her throat to try and drive the feisty little twerp back down, emitting an uncharacteristiccllly sick moan that was mollified when the nigh-constant symphony of all things bodily inside of her digestive tract reached a full crescendo. The reckless abandon she spent in tossing food, living creatures, or even just casually discarded household items into the digestive cauldron that was her stomach filled her insides with a endless surplus of gas that she belched or farted off with no recluse, even allow her to let out a belch or rip one out for three minutes straight if she so intended to, but with a peak of digested air pushing its way against the roof of her belly, a few errands of gas forcing its way in in the form of few choked gurgles underneath her neck folds, at long last did she wish that she’d learn the long-forgotten art of keeping her burps and farts contained.

Her other hand massaged her belly folds to alleviate her tummy troubles, but couldn’t register anything past the heaping blankets of adipose swaddled about her body’s nerves to amount to much; with what few there was before, any visible difference between an orca and some horribly misshapen balloon was decreasing even further, her arms and legs getting sucked into her obscenely round middle’s growth spurt, losing what mobility they may have once possessed to keep the battle raging.

All that remained was her jaw, the strongest muscle in her body. Her eyes were squeezed shut by her own cheeks puffing up, her neck merging into her billowing self as her limbs had, but she let the tears flow in her fight to keep her maw shut and tongue compressed to the roof of her mouth. Her neck muscled crushed Marc’s twiggy figure in and made it impossible for him to move, whether forwards, backwards, or even to struggle against the rapidly closing passageway they he’d made his victim, but with what little life he had left to live on his last moments of air, he saw victory atop the agonizing pain; he was to die in her throat, not with the indignity of being felt wading about in her stomach, to have screams for freedom that’d only fall on deaf ears.

Until...

UUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARRRRRRRRRRRRRPPPP!!!!! !

Pearl’s entire body ached with great relief as all her pent-up gas exploded from her throat in an invisible geyser of air marinated by the stench of her innards, but she couldn’t relish in the sweet release when a certain speck launched from her mouth at the loud updraft coming from inside of her. Marc screamed, spun, and flung about in his crash-course through Pearl’s room, the light of the world outside of his master agonizing on his face, but past it all, with his ears ringing, his arms and legs flopping like wet noodles on his body, and his body damp with the horrid stench of Pearl’s breath tenfold, he had won. If getting belched up by Pearl meant splattering against the wall in a mess of skin and blood on the wall, then it also meant he’d fought the belly of the beast and came back out the very means he was forced in.

He was rapidly gaining height, soaring to the ceiling at a frightening rate, and the rejoicing in his brief, likely bittersweet victory passed enough to recognize the oncoming roof. The threw his arms over his head, the simple act heavy at the force of the wind battering on him, but as his velocity came to a crawl, he opened his eyes at a ventilation duct that was coming in close, and he flailed his hands about to manage a quick glance at one of the rungs, shivering as he reached up with his other and held on.

With Marc alive and uneaten, albeit once again trapped by the undoubtedly deathly fall he’d be in for if his grip lessened, Pearl promptly rolled her blobby self from the couch and hurried over under where his stubborn meal hung for life, breathing hoarsely as she hopped upwards with a swing of her fin to snatch him back down, but merely smacked through nothing. Another jump, and she tried to swipe down on Marc again, then again, and again, and again, and again, but Marc didn’t have to pull his legs up to avoid Pearl’s continuous mad flapping. Not even the likes of Dominique or Avery could make the jump if they tried, as adept at moving their bulks around as they were, and Pearl likely weighed twice as much.

Something Pearl would do good with being told with a few hundred times, but as she continued to leap and fail to give her fat feet any meaningful distance off the floor, no doubt driving her neighbors absolutely bonkers as she hammered on her room with her own mass on repeat, twice as many might not have been even a decimal enough of, and Marc saw some solace in his trappings that he at least had a show to go off on. Not that there were many encouraging words he had to use and describe his boss-turned-captor, but when Pearl had a task at hand, he saw that she’d try and see it through no matter with how many and how obvious her failed attempts at catching him were getting.

All of three hours were spent with Pearl putting up the same fight with no change in strategy, only interrupting herself on occasion to catch her breath, lean against a wall, or sit on the couch to gather her bearings, her workout likely shedding half her entire body’s water weight in sweat. Marc didn’t even want to escape anymore. Heck, all things considered, he already had. Pearl was his prisoner, reduced to a sloshing, quaking mass that was desperately trying to grab for her next meal when she had a fully stocked fridge just a short walk away, and that glazed, half-lidded dullness to her eyes was giving way to desperation, her attempts at leaping to him coming more sluggish than the last.

It was during one of her many, many breaks that Pearl hunched over, wiping at the waterfall of sweat pouring from her brow as as air hoarsely flew in and out through her drooling maw. Marc frowned, hoping she wasn’t going to give up, but she instead set her fists on her hips and glared with what little intensity her chub-caked face could entail. She pointed her finger at him, opening her mouth to speak, then let her arm fall so she could wipe away at more sweat. Then she pointed at him again, taking on that same rigid stance, then just let both arms drop to take a few more rugged breaths, the cycle repeating itself for ten minutes till, with one more look of demand, she thrust a finned finger out at him and spoke.

“Aaaaaaaaaaalright!” Pearl bellowed, putting on her big-girl’s voice. “I know a squeaky wheel when it hits an immovable object, I’m gonna cut you a deal!”

“I’m listening.” Marc answered, guaranteeing a swift, certain ‘no’ for her.

“What I’m thinkin’ is you...that’s you, come down here,” She explained, pointing between him and the floor, “and I’ll eatcha.”

“...and?”

“That’s it.”

“I think I’ll cut my losses.” Came Marc’s reply, preferring to gaze up into the vent than watch any further.
11421211.title: Marc lands in Pearl's room without a problem

114212111.content:
"Alright, knock it off!" Pearl said, stamping her foot. "This isn't funny anymore! Get down here right now so I can eat you! Look, I'll even make it easy for you and open up nice and wide. See? Ahhhhhhhh," Pearl stretched her mouth open as far as it would go and rolled out her tongue like a red carpet event. She pointed into her mouth helpfully, as if Marc was confused where to go.

Marc watched her, unimpressed. "Are you really that dumb? Remember the last few days I spent kicking and screaming for you to let me out? Did you think I was pretending? I don't want to be eaten!"

"Oh... Oh! You don't want to be eaten," Pearl said, as if suddenly understanding something that had never occurred to her. "Well why didn't you say so? That's fine! ... Say... why don't you come on down and I promise not to eat you. I'm not even hungry anymore," she lied, her stomach immediately proving her wrong by letting out a loud growl.

GGGGGGRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLL{ /b}

Pearl giggled sheepishly and shushed her stomach. "Quiet, girl. Mommy's negotiating."

"Wow... You really are that dumb."

Pearl fell to her knees, causing the entire room to shake. The moment of inattention almost caused Marc to slip from the air vent. He renewed his grip and looked at the orca as she started pleading desperately.

"You don't understand!" she bawled. "You're food! Food is supposed to be eaten! Once it's in my tummy, food can't just be ejected back out the mouth! It's impossible! It's so impossible there's not even a word for it!"

"Yes there is! It's called vomiting!"

Pearl snickered like he was joking. "That's the most phony-baloney word I've ever heard. Look, you're food and food belongs in my belly. Please just come down so I can eat you!"

"No way, Dum-Dum," Marc said. "Look, this has been fun and the bun and all, but I'm gonna pull an action movie and try to escape from this nightmare through the vents."

"You can't do that! No human has ever survived escaping through the ventilation!"

"Oh yeah? And how many have ever survived escaping through your digestive tract?" Marc asked as he began pulling at the metal grill. Pearl opened her mouth to respond but a loud, bassy BRAAAAAP of flatulence slipped out of her backside. "That's what I thought."

The grill came loose and swung down on a hinge, letting Marc scramble up.

"This isn't happening!" Pearl said. "You can't die! If you do I'll never get to eat you! Food belongs in my belly! It can't be uneaten! YOU CAN'T GO!"

"Watch me, Dum-Dum. Enjoy starving yourself."

"W-W-WAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIII IIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIT!"

"WHAT?" Marc snapped, seconds before he could disappear into the air vent.

"I have a new deal for you!"

Marc was surprised that he almost felt some pity for the obese orca. Sure she was a mindless eating machine who'd reduced countless coworkers--fellow human beings with hopes and dreams and lives--into foul smelling gas for the sake of her own pleasure, but she was just sooooooooooooooo stupid Marc was finding it harder to get joy from her pathetic attempts at persuasion... Harder, but not impossible.

"... Ah, what the hell. Fire away, Dum-Dum."

"What I’m thinkin' is you... that’s you, come down here," she explained, pointing between him and the floor again, "and I’ll try to eatcha."

"... Later, Pearl."

"BUT," she shouted, causing Marc to stop short, "if you can escape out the door and into the hall, I won't eatcha."

Marc felt the strangest feeling deja vu as he waited to see if there was anything else. "... and?"

"That's it."

"Still no."

"I'LL GET YOU OUT OF YOUR CONTRACT WITH THE ASL!"

"What?" This time Marc stopped in genuine interest.

"Your contract with the ASL. I can get you out of it. Marlene owes me a favor. I ask and she'll let you go." Seeing she actually had Marc's interest, Pearl decided to double down. She'd never lost a meal before and she wasn't about to lose one now. One way or another, someday, somehow, that human would be back in her belly, digesting where he belonged. She pulled a remote that looked like a garage door opener out of one of her folds of fat and pressed the big, red button, causing the door to the hall to swing open. "See?" Pearl said. "All you have to do is make it out into the hall and you're safe. I'll even back up to give you a head start," Pearl said, waddling her massive bulk against the back wall.

Come on, Mr. Food, Pearl thought. Come down, back into my belly to join all your food friends. You'll never escape. My belly is your home.

Marc, oblivious to the orca's true intentions, watched her carefully, torn between his desire to simply escape into the vents and go his own way and the seeming impossibility of simply being let out of his contract. But it just seemed too convenient. Pearl was a terrible liar and her story stunk. Stunk worse than any emission she'd let rip in his presence. On the other hand, it seemed so easy. Just make it into the hall and no longer live under threat of being eaten. His nightmare could finally be over.

"We got a deal?" Pearl asked.

What should Marc do? Believe Pearl or take his chances in the vents?
114212111.title: She was never in debate club

1142121112.content:
Marc stared at Pearl. He blinked once. Twice. Thrice.

"Hell NO!" He deadpanned.

There was no way he was trusting that! Once he got down, he was a sitting duck. He had no guarantee that Pearl would keep to her word. He'd had so many mistresses that promised him something just to snatch it away for shits and giggles. Besides, Pearl had opened the door with a remote. What was stopping her from simply closing with the remote? She was desperate enough for it! Even if he did make it out, there was really no way out of his contract. Since he'd come to ASL, he'd actually taken the time to read over that blasted legal document and while he was no law expert, the thing was air tight. His only real way out was to survive his term with the ASL or for them to release him out of the generosity of their hearts. Marc reigned in a snicker at the thought of that.

He quickly moved into the ventilation. He might not survive this but after coming so close to biting the dust in Pearl's stomach, nothing seemed to scare him anymore.

"NOOOOOO!!!!" Pearl's bellow of despair, rage and frustration actually shook the vents.

Marc actually did snicker at that. Serves you right, he thought. But what now?

11422.content:
Pearl swiveled her blobby head back to it’s original position and procured another foodstuff from thin air, this time a triple-patty hamburger, and gulped it down in one bite, her beady eyes never leaving the blank T.V screen, expecting it to turn on.

Marc, not wanting to leave a bad impression on her new mistress, even if all she could presently think about at this time was eating more food, scrambled to get the television on as fast as possible. He shimmied up one of the legs of the table that held up the analogue, cathode tube box of a television, a skill he had gained after years of adapting to anthro sized furniture, and pressed the whole weight of his body on the power button.

The dated television monitor sprang to life. At first, there was nothing but static, and than the image cleared along with the sound. The semi-familiar sound of the discovery channel logo playing elicited a relieved sigh from Marc. His first task for his new mistress had been done. However, Pearl was not impressed, or at least, she didn’t show it. Instead she gave a wet burp and blinked, noticing that the T.V has been turned on.

“Good.” Pearl commented. And after that, besides the noise spewing forth from the ancient electronics speakers, there was silence. Marc expected his new mistress to give him new directions, or show him where he would be sleeping for the night, or even just acknowledge that he was alive. But no, Pearl was completely unresponsive save for eating, burping, and blinking.

Nervously, Marc slided down the table leg and walked towards the base of the couch, where he could scarcely make out Pearl’s bloated legs under her perfect sphere of a stomach. With nothing to do and deciding it would be wise to wait for her close by, he took his seat on the floor, and proceeded to watch Shark Week.

After several minutes going by of uninterrupted discovery channel, the channel went for commercial, and Pearl turned her head down again to get a good view of her new human servant. “Hey, what are you doing down there?”.

“Oh! I was just watching T.V with you...should I...should I not do that?” Marc gulped as Pearl’s emotionless eyes gazed at him.

For a brief moment, Marc thought he saw his new mistress break face, the ends of her mouth creeping up for an amused smile. But than it was filled with a whole cake that met it’s demise as quickly as it appeared. “You can watch T.V, but not on the floor.”

“...alright. Where should I-?” Marc began to ask Pearl where exactly he should sit, but cut himself off as, what he could only guess were her arms under all of that greasy lard, came down and picked him around his sides. And before he could even ask what she was doing, Pearl had deposited his body next to her on the couch.

But there was only one problem with that. Pearl, with her immense size and girth, took up all of the couch alone. What could only be described as ‘next to her’ was the tiny sliver of sidearm that wasn't engulfed by her thigh flab. The moment she let go of Marc, he was almost instantly wedged between her and the side of the couch itself. Thankfully, her flab was too soft to crush him beyond some uncomfortable seating arrangements, but the thin layer of sweat around her body made it difficult to squeeze himself out without risking falling deeper.

“So…” Marc began, trying to break the pregnant silence with some polite small talk. “Why do you like to eat so much, Mistress Pearl?”

“Because food tastes good.” Peal replied after swallowing yet another foodstuff before procuring another. “And I’m hungry.”

“How many Human servant’s have you had before?” Marc tried to make banter again. And it was also important to know where Pearl lied on the ratio of him surviving this stunt.

“Actually, you’re my first.” Pearl confessed, before giving out another burp. “I always wanted a Human around, just to be there, you know. Humans are a lot better than anthros.”

“I-I’m very sorry, Mistress Pearl. Could you repeat that please?” Marc wanted to make sure that he had heard her correctly, or as correctly as possible with one of his ears smothered in Orca blubber.

“I said Humans are better than anthros.” Pearl actually broker her stare with the stream of infomercials on the television monitor to actually look at what little Marc was un-squished. “Anthros think that they are better than everyone. They get cocky thinking that they have the world’s best body, the strongest or the fattest or stuff like that. And than they digest in some other Anthros gut and they become just like them. I like Humans. They don’t try to pull the wool over your eyes with showy lights. You see a Human, that’s what your gonna get. You see an Anthro, there hiding something.”

Marc, who honestly did not think Pearl was capable of saying so many words in a sentence, was struck dumbfounded as he was smooshed a tad more into the couch as she shifted herself. He had been under the employ of many Anthros over the years, and almost all of them were now dead. Fighters came and went on a daily basis, but Pearl seemed to be the only one who wasn't infatuated by it’s high risk lifestyle. She really was here just for food.

“And In case you're wondering: No, I’m not going to eat you.” Pearl move her gaze back to the T.V and popper a fistful of potato chips into her mouth. “Your too small to even be a light snack...plus your kinda cute.”

Well, Pearl really wasn't one for subtlety, that was for sure.

114222.content:
As Marc and Pearl sat next to each other on the obviously undersized couch while watching sharks do some pretty neat tricks on the T.V, the Orca and the Human continued to chat and converse. At first it was light small talk, but as the minutes went by Marc found himself actually stopping Pearl’s constant train of food to her mouth at times as she listened to him speak.

To the Human servant’s surprise, the black and white blob of an Orca did in fact have a personality besides eating underneath all of that blubber. Although Pearl naturally gravitated to food in their conversation, the two found themselves talking about their favorite moments from the shows they both watched, the best video games that they ever played, and it turned out they had a lot in common as far as an Anthro and a Human are concerned.

Marc felt cautiously optimistic about his future as Pearl’s servant. He didn’t want to let his guard down yet, but things are already going so much better than his introduction to his last mistress. He was being squished by a giant wall of whale flesh, but asides from the pressure he was fine, the thigh flab being more of a plush inconvenience than a life impediment.

However, things soon started to take a bad turn for Marc. As sedentary as Pearl was at her massive size, she was still able to move. And each time she wiggled her round rum to get more comfortable on the couch, or swallowed a particularly big piece of food, her layers of blubber move with her, sending small, soft waves of flab to travel along her smooth surface. The human soon found that each time one of these waves reached her thigh, he slipped deeper between her and the sofa.

“You know, I’ve always thought that I’m half shark, you know?” Pearl commented as she watched the Television whist gulping down a whole milkshake in one go, oblivious to her human’s situation. “I mean, I never knew my dad ‘cause my mom ate him, but he had to be a shark. I’m the most carnivorous gal in the family, yet I’m still the runt compared to my sisters.”

“Ooof…that’s uh, really Interesting mistress Pearl.” Marc said as he struggled his arms against the ever encroaching wall of fat, the light layer of sweat on her smooth skin making his resent go faster. He honestly did think that what Pearl said was interesting, the thought of one of the biggest sumos in the ASL being the smallest in her family was certainly a lot to think about. But he was preoccupied with trying to stay afloat in a sea of whale lard. “I’m really sorry to ask this if you, but do you think that you could scoot over a tad? It’s starting to get hard to-“

“Of course, the only reason I’m the smallest is because I work out.” Pearl continued as she stuffed more food into her mouth, liking having someone to talk to for once despite unknowingly cutting Marc off. “They eat less, but they all live back in the South Pacific, where you don’t need so much energy to move ‘cause you’re in water. All they do is eat and float, getting as big as Islands.”

“Mmmmpph!” Marc grunted as he slipped further into the dark crevice. His entire lower todo has been devoured by the hungry blubber, and it wanted more. He hung onto the couch’s sidearm with all his strength, but it wasn't amounting to much. “P-Pearl! That’s real sweet and all, but-!”

“Sweet? Well, yeah, I guess my family is pretty sweet.” Pearl leaned back in total relaxation, comically not hearing how strained Marc’s comments are underneath all the pressure she was putting on him. “They were really supportive of my decision to move to the surface, see the world and taste the sights. I had to work off a lot of my fat to make it to the beach, but it’ll only be a matter of time before I get back to my old size at the rate I’m eating...geez, I haven’t really told a lot of people this before. You’re a real good listener you know that? Thanks, it means a lot.”

Marc could his new mistress chat away above, and he would have loved to respond and say that he was just honored she would share that with him, the moment he tried to open his mouth a cascade of salty, black flesh spilled into it. He had been completely engulfed in Orca thigh fat, and it was not the most pleasant experience ever. Each time he tried to move he sank deeper, like quicksand, only here he had small pockets of air to breath in to keep him going.

Pearl continued to eat and talk as she watched the sharks do flips in the water and bite provocative idiot documentarians, while Marc could only groan in discomfort as untold thousands of cushiony blubber presses his body into the hard furniture. Seconds turned to minutes and minutes turned to hours as this ordeal went on. All the human had for company was the sounds of the television, the orca’s jabbering, and the constant sound of food being munched on with the occasional, muffled gurgle from her stomach.

Finally, after an untold amount of time, Pearl finally got up from her seating on the poor couch. “I guess since you’re my servant now, it’s your job to refill my food stores. But I think I’ll do it this one, last time, rest a little bit before your real work begins.”

Marc’s flattened form suddenly found itself falling onto the Anthro sized couch cushions in the sudden absence of Pearl’s body. He gasped for air, air now no longer being a luxury and in limited supply, into his squashed lungs. He saw his new mistress’s over bloated form waddle to what he assumed was the kitchen as he catches his breath on the sofa cushion. It appeared to the servant that even though the Orca won’t put him in danger on purpose, he was still going to have to keep on his toes around her heavy circumference.

After a while, Marc felt confident enough to relax on the bent furniture when Pearl didn’t come back. He let out a small smile and reclined himself on the cushion as he watched the T.V play infomercials. He was exhausted after that whole ordeal and was ready to take whatever free time was given to him. But than his whole world began to shake as the fat orca entered the room, each footfall rattling the floor and walls. The familiar sound of her munching and a telltale burp signifies that she once again had food.

“Huh. Some panther is getting eaten by a shark. Neat.” Pearl said nonchalantly as she move around to sit down on the couch...failing to notice Marc relaxing on the cushions. The large, bare ass begins to descend towards him.

“Uh, Pearl…? Hey, hey Pearl!” Marc shouts as he realizes too late what was happening. Pearl bends her ass down even further, the human’s life flashing before his eyes. “Mistress Pearl I’m right here! I’m under you, don’t sit! Please!”

Soon, Marc’s entire vision was enveloped by rapidly looming darkness. He might as well have been talking to a giant, fatty wall by that point.

*BOOM*

The naked rear end of the giant whale-sumo made Marc little more than an impression on the same sofa cushions he was content to be on only moments ago. Thankfully for him, as he was flattened against the couch’s fabric, he felt no immense, bone cracking, fatal pain. Just pressure pinning him down. The human works up the courage to open his eyes to find his world gone pitch black. From the few slivers of light he could see two large, smooth cheeks to either side of him. It dawned on him he was stuck between her crack, immobilized but relatively fine.

“...please don’t fart.”

1142221.content:
The entire room shook when Pearl plopped her gargantuan bottom onto the couch. As she reclined in her seat she couldn't help but notice how much more comfortable her usual spot was. Given her size and weight, it hadn't taken long for her butt cheeks to leave two minivan-size imprints in the cushion. She'd been thinking of getting a new couch for a while now, had even made a mental note to have Marc order a more endurable one, but if the couch had suddenly become this comfy, she might not need to anymore. She wiggled her behemoth, blubbery behind back and forth, getting better situated. The couch made some strange squeaking sounds she'd never heard before, but they were muffled soon enough, allowing the orca to relax in the perfect spot to sit and enjoy her shows. She'd come back with a veritable mountain of food, and had placed it on the table in front of the couch. It looked like enough to feed a small town for a year.

"They didn't have enough food on the property to restore my stock. All I got is just enough for a snack. Sorry but it looks like you'll have to get more food for me after all. Tomorrow though. I'll suffer through these measly portions tonight. Now, where was I? Oh, right..."

With her eyes glued to the TV, Pearl was utterly oblivious to the fact that Marc was buried beneath her metric tons of fat. She began tearing into her food and continuing their conversation where they'd left off. Apparently she really was just looking for a good listener, since she talked for a good half-an-hour without realizing Marc was gone, ignoring the strange squeaks and creaks from the couch.

"Holy crap! You see that--BWARP--shark tearing into that gazelle?" Pearl asked through a mouthful of food. "I went to high school with her! Biggest--BELCH--you'd ever meet in your life. Used to call me Blowhole. I nearly ate her for that one. She never did that a--URP--gain," Pearl said, laughing, crumbs spraying from her mouth with each burp.

A few minutes passed and Pearl felt a pressure building in her abdomen, her constant eating finally catching up to her. While she had no problem letting air out from attic in front of her new human servant, she felt a little self conscious letting it out from the basement. She talked a little bit louder, hoping to cover up the sound as she subtly lifted a butt cheek up a little and let one rip, hoping it would be a silent one her human wouldn't notice.

Unfortunately for both of them, Marc knew all too well what was about to happen. For the past thirty minutes he'd been in hell. It hadn't been so bad at first, at least not relatively speaking. He'd been wedged in between Pearl's butt cheeks, trapped, but otherwise fine. He'd tried to alert her to his presence beneath her, but his hopes had been dashed when his mistress had wiggled her ass deeper into the couch, wedging him deeper up her crack. Now he was trapped on all sides, contained in her rank, sweaty butt. There was some air, but not much. Marc envied the good old days of an hour ago when he'd merely been pinned between the armrest of the couch and one of her thunder thighs. He tried yelling for help, but his pleas were muffled underneath all of the orca's layers of fat. That and she kept droning on and on. Marc couldn't make out what she was saying but it sounded like she thought he was still there on the couch, listening to her speak. A half an hour had passed in misery, with Marc only being able to make the slightest, pitiful yelps when she adjusted herself in her seat. The absolute worst moment game when he heard ominous groans coming from above, within the bowels of the orca.

"Oh no. Oh no! OH NO!"

PPPPFFFFFFFFFFFRRRRRRRRTTTTTTTTTTTTT!

Pearl had lifted a butt cheek and let loose with a fart. The gas washed over him like a tsunami of funk. Marc gagged on the stench, eyes watering. He redoubled his efforts at wiggling himself free but he remained just as trapped as ever, only now, he was trapped with the rancid stink of a million dead fishes.

On the outside, Pearl blushed. She'd been hoping to pass off whatever noise her passing gas made as another creak of the couch, but this emission had sounded like an explosion. She caught a whiff of it and it burned her own nostrils. There was no way in hell she could hide something so obvious.

"Sorry about that," Pearl muttered, embarrassed. "I need to gain weight, and that means eating a ton of crappy food, but it plays havoc on my stomach, y'know? ... Marc? ... Marc?!"

Finally, Pearl looked away from the TV to the spot where her human had been sitting only to find him gone. She looked around the room without getting off the couch, craning her neck to try and find him.

"Marc? MARC!"

There was no response. It was as if the human had disappeared. Had something happened to him while she was gone? She knew some of the other wrestlers weren't fond of humans. It wasn't uncommon for a rival to kidnap a wrestler's human servant and haze him as a way of messing with their competitor. Usually these pranks weren't fatal, but they were definitely unpleasant. If that was the case, her new human was in danger.

Or, Pearl suddenly thought, horrified, had Marc abandoned her? Had he seen his chance to escape while she was gone and was now laughing at her for trusting him? But that couldn't be true, could it? She'd shared her feelings with him, talked about her family with him. They'd watched Shark Week together! Had that meant nothing to him?! The idea he could've betrayed her trust cut deep, and caused dark, angry thoughts to come to the front of her mind.

She knew she'd have to track Marc down, but which emotion did Pearl settle on? Worry for her new human friend's safety or blind fury at his perceived treachery?

11422211.content:
When bad things happen in life, it can be easy to give in and let your emotions override judgement. It can be easy to think the worst of people, that they did you wrong, and that the only thing that will make you feel better is to do something drastic, something extreme, something you might regret later. When Pearl couldn't find Marc, her mind was split between two worse case scenarios: A. Marc played with her emotions and hightailed it out if their the moment he go the chance, and B. Someone came into her room and snatched him away.

In the end, Pearl chose to give her human the benefit of the doubt. She knows how the other servants are treated in the ASL. She knows she was a godsend to Marc compared to the other sumos. The question was than If Marc was stolen, who stole him? Bronze League did not have access to this part of the facility, so that narrowed her choices down. Claudine was too dignified and self-respecting to pull such a stunt, Daisy wouldn't dare mess with Pearl after she almost ate her, and than there was…

Dominique.

The whore hippo who fell in love with human con man back when she was a detective, who put her heart on the line in front of a hardened criminal and thought she could change him. She couldn't, and that broke her. She hates humans, especially the male ones. She took Marc. She had to, no one had more of a motive. The blob of an Orca soon found herself overwhelmed with anger, a strong enough anger to set down the burrito she was in the middle of eating back on the table. She slowly raised herself from her seat on the couch with a determined look in her eyes.

“If she touches a single hair on his head, I swear to whoever will listen that she will be fat on my ass.” She waddled out of her room and entered the hallway, looking for the way to the silver league to pay a certain pachyderm a visit.

Meanwhile, Marc’s stay in hell had gotten even worse. Now that Pearl was off the couch, the pungent eye watering vapors were allowed to dissipate into the air, but the Human was stuck smelling like a rotting car as at the bottom of the ocean. And now she was moving, with him stuck between her cheeks, grinding and wobbling against one another, molding over his body like concrete gelatin. The sweaty, musky whale ass flesh squished him with the force of an Industrial steamroller, making each second Marc found himself not dead from the pressure a blessing.

The poor human’s consolation to all of this while Pearl waddled slowly to her destination was that it was an accident. It didn’t detract away from the massive pain he was being put through, nor was it an excuse for his new Mistresses carelessness, but Marc had been in similar situations under others on purpose. They made sure every second of those experiences were hell on Earth. Even if it was just slightly, the torture the Orca was putting her servant through was far from the worst he’s ever been in.

“Where the hell is he? I know you have him.” Marc could make out his involuntary captor demand if someone else. Her voice was muffled under all the layers of lard, but still audible to the human’s ears.

“What are you talking about you fat bitch?” Marc heard another voice respond to Pearl, and he instantly recognized it. His blood ran cold as the poor human put the voice to the intimidating and sadistic Dominique the dominator. What the hell was Pearl doing here, he didn’t know. But he did know that it was bad for humans to be just in range of her voice, and began to wiggle his way out of the whale’s vice grip on him.

“I got my first human servant this morning. Nice guy. Talked to him, he listened. Watched T.V. Now he’s gone, and you took him.”

The indigo hippo made a sneering laugh. “Oh, is just priceless. You think I took your pathetic chew toy? Wimps like him aren’t worth my time.’

“No one in the ASL hates Humans as much as you do. Give him to me now, or I’ll bulldoze you over and tear up your room looking for him.”

“You seem to be pretty sure he was kidnapped. How do you know he just left, Huh?”

“...take that back. Now.”

“Why should I? His species are a race of pitiful cowards that are only good for a light snack. It’s not my fault you got attached to a sniveling monkey.”

Marc heard the two titans bicker back and forth. The both of them were mad-no, royally pissed was a better description, and the human could hear all of the venom and coldness in their voices. They went silent for a moment, Pearl thinking of a reply to Dominique, while the hippo patiently waited. What came out between the Orca’s lips gave her human goosebumps.

“Well Dominique, it’s not my fault you fell in love with a known criminal and got yourself knocked up, got roped into a shotgun wedding to avoid having a bastard out of wedlock, and let yourself be surprised when you found out he was cheating on you the entire time. It’s not my fault your human left you at the altar while mine was taken by some immature slut.”

Marc was sure that no one had ever, EVER talked to Dominique like that before. The amount of bluntness and vitriol in those two sentences made the air, as hot and humid is was, ten d greed colder. And he was almost impressed for Pearl to have the guts to say it, if it wasent for what Dominique said next.

“I'm going to eat you. I’m going to eat you right here and now and turn you into fat. Than, I’m going to find your delicate little human and crush him into foam under my foot.”

“I’ve never eaten a Hippo whole before. I wonder how you’ll taste…”

And just like that, the two were at each other’s throats in an impromptu survival match. Mark's works spun and twirled around as Pearl flung Dominique into the wall, the sound of plaster crumbling to dust ringing in his ears despite where he was. The Hippo retaliated with a punch to the Killer Whale’s face, knocking out a tooth and making her stumble backwards. Marc was afraid she would sit down again, but she regained her balance before she could.

While all of this action went in, Marc continued to wiggle his way out of Pearl’s ass crack. She was working up a sweat now, and it as foul smelling as it was, it made the fatty flesh slippery enough to move through. He choked down vomit as he mentally promised himself to take a hour long shower after all this, if he got the chance.

At the end of it all…
