114222111.content:
Dominique screamed as orca teeth sank into hippo flesh, Pearl grunted in pain as Hippo knee was thrust into Orca stomach, and Marc was being swung around left and right as the two fought, wrestled and rolled over one another, his form flinging about like he was trapped in some sweaty, fleshy carnival ride at the country fair. To try and pull himself free or remain trapped in Pearl’s buttcrack, he couldn’t decide which would guarantee his survival, his senses bombarded with the scent of Pearl’s body odor, the hurricane of colors sweeping around him, and his limbs voming dangerously close to being ripped from their sockets by the centrifuge alone, his mind barely able to comprehend anything but the sheer agony of the situation.

That, and the chants of the surrounding crowd of onlookers.

“FIGHT! FIGHT! FIGHT! FIGHT! FIGHT!”

Dominique’s arms smacked down at both sides of Pearl’s face, the orca dazedly stumbling backwards, vulnerable enough to take a headbutt to the belly that sent her flying backwards, the wall’s crumbling disguising Marc’s shrieks of terror as the plaster surface came close enough to crush his form, but was cushioned enough by Pearl’s ass that he remained a few inches away.

With her Pearl’s splayed form open for attack, Dominique came in with a barrage of punches and smacks that continuously wrenched the orca’s head left and right.

“Wanna say that shit again, you human-fucking cunt?!” Dominique snarled, pausing in her onslaught, but robbed Pearl of any chance to answer with a left hook to her jaw. “Who’s the one letting herself get surprised NOW?! HUH?!”

Dominique answered for her in one, two, three more smacks, each garnering a cringe from the audience. Despite being crazed, insulted, and hungry for orca blood, Dominique managed to pause again to relish in the fruit of her labor, seeing Pearl’s face be beaten, bruised, and bloodied more than it would’ve been in a genuine match on the ring...

...but Dominique's smile loosened out in surprise when Pearl managed to peel her eyes open and glare right back, completely unbroken.

“You...” Pearl groaned, fins clamping around her rival’s tank top and yank her off the ground, the orca’s head swinging down to smash her face right into Dominique’s skull.

Despite his ears ringing, Marc could tell everything had went silent. Pearl wasn’t spinning about, and even the onlookers were silent as a tomb when...something tried to work its way into his battered eardrums. A voice, his senses were gradually clearing up to understand...somebody feminine.

That of Dominique’s, only now it was muffled as she screamed long and loud. Not in rage, pain, or victory, but in terror.

Much of the crowd was frozen in whatever excited poses they’d taken during the fight, but their faces were all molded in shock as Pearl reared her head up to gulp Dominique down, arms carrying the hippo’s fat frame upwards to help guide her down, already past the neck and working on the torso. Dominique’s arms flapped to smack at Pearl’s face, a few magic sparkles fluttering around her hands, but the adrenaline in her system made it impossible to string up a single consistent spell, and soon, her arms were swallowed past Pearl’s cheeks, reducing her only movements to paddling her legs about.

Sucking air in through her blowhole, Pearl’s eyes watered as she forced Dominique's widest proportions into her cheeks and felt her neck bulge grotesquely around the girth of her new meal, but, being something Pearl was set out to eat, Dominique met her fate and was pulled into the damp, fleshy cavern and was sucked into the catacomb of the Orca’s belly, whose cheeks puffed out in a content sigh.

A few polite claps rung out from the audience, but unlike the movies, there was no thunderous applause to follow. Everybody either disbanded in awe or trotted past Pearl to give her a congratulatory pat on the side, the Orca’s stomach now even more of a grotesquely swollen ball of whale blubber, arms awkwardly forced upwards by the new width added to her form, breasts clamping around her maw by a new dozen feet of whale blubber protruding out in front of her.

Pearl barely acknowledged them; neither the disappearing crowd or the painful tautness occupying her body mattered much as something else on her mind. “...Marc? Marc!”

Terrified to see what had happened, yet eager to escape, Marc grabbed at Pearl’s thong to pull himself free, his legs gradually pulling free from between her legs, but his weight pulled down on her underwear enough to dangle him a few feet above the ground, a short enough distance that he could let go without breaking his legs, but still landed with enough of a thud to roll over in pain.

Hearing the sound, Pearl’s head shot up, fighting against her flabby shoulder to see past her even more enormous frame, and beamed at seeing Marc crawl into view.

“Marc! Are you okay?” She asked hurriedly. She tried to move her legs to turn him, also reaching out with her arms to pick him back up, but any tasks that were near impossible at her old form were outright at the moment, and she settled on tilting on her side and holding an open fin out for him to take. “You, uh...mind getting up yourself, at the moment?”

Marc managed to guide his aching muscles to stand himself back up, legs aching at the weight of his own body, but barely even realized Pearl was still there until he was grabbed from the ground with her webbed fingers, lungs only full enough to groan in plain as Pearl brought him up to hdr cheek and began nuzzling him.

“Oh, Marc, I’m so sorry about whatever Dominique did to you!” She cooed, her absence of a nose or nostrils preventing her from realizing where he was. “Good thing that pocket dimension spell she must’ve used was broken when I ate her, huh?”

“...Pearl?” He mumbled, his brain to battered to understand any sentences more than three words long. “What...did you do?”

“Made sure Dominique’s not gonna hurt you again, pal.” She promised. “Don’t you know what happened?”

Very little, despite having technically been in the fight himself, but with his hand massaging his forehead, Marc glanced around before seeing what lay past Pearl’s cleavage; that being nearly a dozen feet of orca belly extending out from her body, its curvature occasionally broken by a fist-shaped lump pouncing from her skin.

“...Pearl?” He mumbled uneasily, the dots connecting. “Did...did you eat Dominique?”

“I wasn’t gonna take any chances when she had you, buddy.” She answered. “It was the only way.”

“Pearl...but I...you...” He babbled, unsure if he should be terrified, angry, probably even thankful. “Pearl, Dominique didn’t kidnap me! I was stuck in you butt crack the entire time!”

Pearl jolted in surprise, eyes opening wider. “...excuse me?”

“You sat on me back at your room! Dominique had nothing to do with this!”

“But...” Pearl raised a finger, but no further argument came from her mouth. Her eyes glanced around a few times, her brow’s expression changing as she turned the situation over in her brain.

Her mouth slowly closed, seemingly stunned as the realization of what’d she’d done set in...only to be shaken by a wobbly smile and a giggle working its way from her lungs, shaking Marc around slightly.

“Heh...heh-hahahahahha!” She chuckled festively. “Heh...damn, I’m sorry about that, Marc. Talk about a crazy first day on the job, huh?”

“Pearl, wha...what’re you talking about?”

“Listen, consider this the beginning of your raise, then. C’mon, let’s go back.”

With a triumphant grin, Pearl began dragging her feet across the floor...but didn’t move an inch, her belly’s excess mass keeping her anchored. She barely acknowledged, marching in place like she was leaving a stadium giving her an uproarious applause, but when her eye peeked open, noticing that Marc was observing her with a slack jaw, she gradually came to a stop.

“...Pearl?”

“Yeah?”

“Aren’t you forgetting something?”

“Forgetting what?”

Marc pointed a finger downwards. “Dominique.”

“W-What about her?”

“She was completely innocent!” He snapped back. “She didn’t even know I was missing till you came to her room, and you ate her!”

Pearl glanced down at her ballooned middle, then back up at Marc. “...and?”

“Aren’t you going to do something for her?”

“Like what?”

“I...but...you...how...” He stuttered incoherently, then shook his head and glared at her. “Spit her up!!!”
114222111.title: The Whale ate The Hippo

1142221111.content:
Pearl rolled her eyes so Marc kept talking before she could refuse. "Look, Pearl, let's forget the fact that Dominique is technically innocent--of this at least--let's focus on the fact that this wasn't a legal match. I mean, sure you two attracted a crowd, but it wasn't a sanctioned Survival Match. The ASL would want to broadcast a fight like that between two of their most popular fighters. You're the nicest boss I've ever had so far, I don't want you to get in trouble over some jerk like Dominique! What if they fired you?" Marc blinked. "Wait. If they fired you, do you think they'd fire me too? On second thought--"

"You're right, Marc," Pearl said, apparently not hearing what he said. "She's not worth risking my job over. How else would I get the food I need to maintain my figure?"

"Um, valid point, yes," Marc said. "But on the other hand--"

"Stand back!" Pearl said dramatically. "I'm an expert on swallowing food down, not bringing it back up. This might get a little messy."

"You don't have to do--"

But it was too late. Pearl scrunched her face up in concentration. She compressed her abdomen and Marc watched in horrified fascination as the gargantuan bulge that was Dominique made her way back up the way she'd come. It was happening slowly, too slowly to be frank. By now the hippo was midway between the orca's stomach and esophagus. Pearl's eyes were bulging out of her head and her face was turning red. It took Marc a second to realize she was choking. She tried to swallow Dominique back down, but now that she was so close to freedom, Dominique wasn't going anywhere. Marc had to do something or Pearl was toast!

He rushed over behind Pearl, in the space between her backside and Dominique's sofa. Steadying his feet against the couch, he began pushing as hard as he could against her back. With any luck, she'd end up lying on her stomach, making it easier to throw up Dominique than if she was sitting straight. It felt like trying to budge the biggest boulder imaginable. The combined weight of the orca and hippo made it almost impossible to move, but when Pearl noticed what he was doing, she began leaning back and forth, back and forth to build up momentum. Unfortunately she did this without considering that Marc was still behind her. The first time she lurched forward, Marc lost his grip and fell into her crack.

"NOT AGAIN!" he moaned.

Marc was back in the prison he'd only just freed himself from, and he was totally helpless as Pearl swayed back and forth. Each time she would get a little bit closer to rolling on her belly, and Marc would get a little more smooshed between her massive butt cheeks. He didn't even bother trying to escape, not wanting to distract Pearl from her task. At last she landed on her stomach and opened her mouth. Dominique's form was shot out of Pearl's throat like a cork from a champagne bottle, riding a torrent of pent-up gas.

UUUUUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPP !

Dominique, slick from a fresh coating of orca drool, slid across the floor and crashed into the wall in the outside hall. She got to her feet unsteadily and shot Pearl a look that could kill.

"YOU'RE DEAD!" the hippo bellowed. "BOTH OF YOU! I SWEAR I'LL GET YOU AND THAT HUMAN MAGGOT IF IT'S THE LAST THING I DO!"

Pearl wiped the spit from her lips and shot her a look of equal venom. "You hurt a hair on my human's head and I'll send you on a one-way trip back down my digestive system, and this time, you won't be coming out!"

"Just you wait," Dominique said, before staggering away down the hall.

"Some people," Pearl grumbled. "Do them a favor and they don't show any gratitude. Ah well. That was a good idea with pitching me forward, Marc. If it wasn't for you I'd be sleeping with the fishes!" She chuckled at her own choke. "Thanks for the assist, Marc.... Marc?"

Pearl listened attentively for any sign of her human when she heard muffled cries coming from behind her and chuckled. She reached behind her and pulled Marc out with a squelching sound. Marc gasped for air.

"Marc," Pearl said playfully, "if I didn't know any better, I'd guess you were trying to get there on purpose, you naughty boy!" She batted her eyelashes at him and Marc gulped.

"No!" he said panicked. "It was an accident! I swear!"

"Right," Pearl said, smiling. She didn't sound convinced. "Well if you play your cards right, maybe you can have another "accident" soon." She winked and Marc shuddered. "For now though, I think it's time for you to carry out the first of your duties..."

What is it?

1) Having thrown up Dominique, Pearl is famished. Marc will feed her.

2) It's time for Marc to help Pearl train for an upcoming match.
1142221111.title: Pearl rolls her eyes, but relents.

11422211112.content:
So...you want to fight against Dominique in a Survival Match…”

Neither Marc or his mistress Pearl had ever seen the big boss of the Anthro Sumo League in person, but they have always heard the rumors surrounding her. A mountain of flesh even amongst Anthros with the strength of a Greek God, a champion of hunger in food, wealth, and lust. The human thought she didn’t even exist, just a story to tell servants on their first day to instill fear, while the whale believed that she would turn out to be another run of the mill wrestler like Dominique.

Both of their beliefs were disproven as they gazed upon Marlene, the founder, owner, figurehead, and champion of the ASL. Marc thought that Pearl was a Goliath compared to his size, but as he stared dark purple and white colored penguin sitting on a reinforced chair behind her desk, he realized his mistress was half her size. Both her tits and ass were so huge they made the Orca’s waistline look pleasantly plump. Her stomach, cascading onto the ground like a waterfall, was so big that it not only served as her personal surface, it looked like it could fit two of Pearl no problem.

“It’s certainly an intriguing proposition.” She purred, stroking her literal building sized gut absent mindedly. Marc almost felt tempted to leave his perch on Pearl’s shoulder in favor of her prison of a backside under Marlene’s...suggestive glares. One if the biggest rumors surrounding the penguin was her fetish for all things tiny, and at her size humans are the size of an ant to her. “The two of you have certainly amassed quite the number of followers and fans, a fight like that I could sell seats for thousands of dollars. But why the suddenness, Pearly Wearly?”

Pearl blushed and grimaced at the cutesy nickname, but decided to suck it up. “As long as Dominique is alive she breathing, my human isn’t safe.” She gestured to Marc on her left shoulder and nuzzled him gently with her flabby cheek. “And knowing her, I don’t think she’s in a position to be peaceful...neither am I.”

“Yes, I understand how you feel, my rising star.” Marlene stood up from her chair, her stomach still glued to the ground, and walked around her desk to Pearl. Each footfall heavy enough that even the Orca could feel the tremors. “Humans certainly are a curious species that most can’t help but fall in love with. So tiny and fragile, yet so cute and innocent. It certainly would be a shame to let Mr. Youngblood...leave our company on bad terms.”

“But here’s the thing.” Marlene suddenly pushed her gargantuan belly into Pear’s in comparison tiny one, her intimidating shadow looking over her like a dark diety. “Fights like These takes months of training to prepare for, but I can see by your cuts and bruises that you don’t have that time. I’ll let you have the chance to turn that hippo into blubber...but I can only give you three days.”

“Three days?!” Marc shouted in disbelief. Pearl tried to talk, but no words could come out if her agape mouth save for incomprehensible stammering. “That’s like telling a farmer he has an hour to grow a bumper crop, you can’t ask that of her!”

“I’m sure your mistress appreciates your caring of her wellbeing, Marcus.” Marlene smirked, purposely using her employee’s full name to agitate him. Humans were so cute when they got flustered. “But that’s all the time I can give in your situation. If you want, I can give you a couple months to get ready...if you think Dominique won’t make any moves in the meantime.”

“No.” Pearl spoke up, drawing both her human’s attention and Marlene’s. “She needs to go, and she needs to go now. I’ll take it.” Pearl stood up from her chair and turned around. “C’mon, Marc, we’ve got a long they're days ahead of us.”

Marlene smiled silently as she watched Pearl and Marc walk out of her office with determination. “What a sweet couple...I do hope she wins…”




News inside if the ASL facility travel fast, so when Pearl came marching down the halls to the training room, everyone gave her a wide bearth. Sime called her grave behind her back as she walked past, others said she was foolish, and all of them glared at the tiny human on her shoulder. The human that she would kill for. Marc gulped audibly under the scrutiny, never one for the center of attention.

“So, how do I help you train?” Marc asked Pearl as she pressed her ID Card against the scanner and walked into the training center. “I don’t think I could survive a sparring match on the ring, no matter how gentle you handle me.”

“Basically, I just need someone to coach me, tell me to do things and how to do it.” Pearl grabbed Marc from her shoulder and held him to her face. “I need to make sure I’m in my prime for the fight, so your job is to direct and motivate me to get they're. And since you’re my coach, you can decide what I should do first.”

Marc looked around the training room to see what training Pearl should start on. It was pretty full, but they're were at least three options for him to choose from that weren’t being used.

But which one did he pick?
11422211112.title: Meeting Marlene

choices: A fighter turns off the machine
114222111122.content:
"Ok," Marc said, looking around the crowded gym and spotting one unused piece of equipment. "How about the treadmill?"

Pearl groaned. "I hate running."

"I've noticed," Marc said. Given how often he saw her sitting, Marc thought Pearl disliked movement of any kind. Unless the motion was raising her hand to her mouth to deposit her most recent snack inside. "Dominique is pretty fast for her size. You should work on your agility."

"Fine. Whatever you say, Coach."

Pearl waddled over to the treadmill. The pieces of equipment in the gym ranged in size to accommodate the range of sizes for the anthro fighters, but the treadmill Pearl was going to use was actually pretty big for her. Marc had actually heard stories about another gym deeper in the ASL facilities where kaiju-sized anthros trained. Remembering their encounter with Marlene, Marc wouldn't have been surprised if that was true. Since there was no other treadmill free, they'd have to make the best of this one, even if the controls came up just above Pearl's head.

"Can't reach, oh well, guess we'll have to do something else."

"Don't be a quitter," Marc said. "Lift me up, I'll turn on the machine, and you can tell me when you're feeling exhausted." Pearl sighed and lifted Marc above her head and he climbed onto the controls. "Ready?" he called down.

Pearl groaned again. "Fiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiine."

"I'll start you off on the lowest setting," Marc said, stomping on the number 1 on the panel. The treadmill started and Pearl began to shuffle her feet. He went over to the Up arrow button and stomped on it to increase the speed.

Pearl wiped sweat off her forehead. "This is torture."

"You're on 2, Pearl."

"Can we take a break?"

"No!" Marc said. "Do you want to be eaten by Dominique?"

"No," Pearl grumbled.

"Then keep running!"

Marc increased the speed. Instead of a slow trudge, the orca was going at a brisk walk. He turned it up again and she started to jog, her whole body jiggling with the effort. After five minutes she was huffing and puffing and drenched with sweat like she'd just finished running twenty miles. The sight did not inspire much confidence in Marc. It was hard to believe that someone who couldn't last five minutes on a treadmill had bested a fighter as deadly as Dominique.

Marc watched her and felt a wave of guilt. What if her beating Dominique had been a fluke? What if she couldn't do it again? Marc had been the one to convince her to throw the evil hippo up. If Pearl got eaten, it would be Marc's fault for convincing her to show Dominique mercy. He didn't think he could live with her death on his conscience. She was the nicest boss he'd ever had in the ASL. He called down words of encouragement to her. It wasn't anything to write home about, the stock, "You can do this," "I believe in you," routine. It wasn't much but it was enough to get Pearl to run for a solid ten minutes without complaint. As far as Marc was concerned that was a good start.

"That's enough!" Pearl gasped. "Turn it off!"

"Come on, give me five more minutes! You can do it!"

"NO I CAN'T!" she snapped. "My shoe fell off!"

Marc wasn't sure if she was telling the truth or just looking for an excuse to give up early. He leaned out over the edge of the treadmill to a catch sight of her feet. By the time he saw her barefoot, the treadmill jammed and shuddered. Marc was rocked off his perch and sent falling to the treadmill below. Pearl didn't have enough time to stop and Marc didn't have enough time to get out of the way. Marc let out a pitiful scream and raised his arms to protect his head. It didn't do any good. Her foot--as big as his whole body--came crashing down on him. In the split second he had left he was just grateful he was about to be crushed by her barefoot.

SLAM!

The gigantic, blubbery sole smooshed Marc into the ground. The pain was extraordinary and as she lifted her foot off him, Marc was stuck to the bottom of her foot like a piece of chewed gum. He had only a second of relief before her foot slammed back down, stomping him into the ground.

SLAM!

"I'm sorry, Marc--"

SLAM!

"I can't reach the controls--"

SLAM!

"I can't turn it off!"

SLAM! SLAM! SLAM!

Marc shouted at her to just hop to the side to get off the machine but his words were muffled as his face was ground into her sole. Though not as bad as being in her backside, the smell coming off her sweaty foot was far from pleasant. He had no choice but to breathe it in as Pearl kept running, mashing him into the ground like a bug with each stride. He prayed that either Pearl would finally realize how simple it was to get off the treadmill or that some fighter would take pity on them and turn off the machine. He thought the latter unlikely. He remembered the death glares and harsh murmurs they'd gotten as the fighters saw Pearl with a human perched on her shoulder. It was more likely they'd leave him there out of amusement. Still, he had to pray for help from somewhere! Pearl was so huge, being stomped under her full weight was unbearable.

How would Marc get free?

1) Pearl finally realizes she can just hop off the machine and Marc is freed. They go on to train on another piece of equipment.

2) Another fighter turns off the machine. Is she friendly or does she have a sinister motive in mind?
114222111122.title: Stop this crazy thing!

choices: "...I need food. A whole LOT of food."
1142221111221.content:
Marc grunted in excruciating pain each time Pearl raised her foot, only for it to come crashing down into the treadmill mat half a second later. He could feel his bones rub against each other from the impossible weight they were being put under. And the smell, the funky, sweaty smell of grime and dirt put invaded his nose and made his eyes water. While nowhere near as bad as Pearl’s backside, the Human still wanted to get away from it as soon as possible.

“Pearl!” Marc shouted with all of his rapidly fleeting strength. He could only speak in between stomps, and he had no idea if his voice was audible, but at this point he was willing to try anything. “Just...hop...off!”

“You’re gonna have to speak up, Marc!” Pearl wheezed like a wild dog, trying to keep her voice at an indoor level. Her whole body was drenched in sweat, definitely not used to this much physical exertion. She could faintly make out what Marc was trying to say over the sound of her own rapid breath, the whirrings of the torture device she was on, and the footfalls that kept him lodged in her sole. “Because all I heard was ‘hop’, is that what you me to do?!”

“Yes!” Marc shouted, frustrated at the miscommunication occurring. “Hop...off!”

“Off?” Pearl echoed, not particularly understanding what her human servant was trying to say. “Marc, that doesn't make any s-...oh goddamnit!”

Pearl slapped her fat forehead in internal frustration as she realized what Marc was trying to say, upset that she didn’t think of it sooner and that the solution was so easy. Much to her aching legs satisfaction, the bloated Orca halted her endless run on the treadmill by simply jumping her body to the side.

By the time Pearl peeled Marc off from her blubbery sole, he could here the amused chuckles and hurtful comments being made in his expense.

“Good God, she let her Human coach her? Pearl must have more fat than brains if she did something that stupid.”

“Look at him, covered in sweat and filth. Ugh, where’s pest control when you need them?”

“He’s still alive after all of that? Piece of trash is durable, I’ll give him that much.”

Marc sighed and lowered his head down. He was used to this kind of treatment in the ASL. Humans were expendable, used for punching bags and a lite snack. It was just the natural order of things around here. However, someone clearly didn’t inform Pearl of the natural order of things, something that she made quite evident as she waddled her way up to one of the heckling anthros with her human in hand.

“Sorry, I couldn’t quite hear you earlier over all the fat in my ears. What did you want to say?” Pearl glared venomously at the Anthro in question, a sumo, while still large, only half the Orca’s size. “C’mon, you were talking all that good stuff a moment ago.”

The Anthro, clearly not expecting any confrontation, gulped audibly as beads of nervous sweat ran down her neck. She swallowed her fear and took a step forward, poking Pearl in her monumental stomach provoking. “I s-said your piece of g-g-garbage human is lucky to be alive, lardass!” She stuttered angrily, obviously not getting the fact that the person she was antagonising was twice her size. “When I get ready to fight, I don’t want to see some filthy monk-!”

Pearl cut the smaller sized sumo off by effortlessly bucking her hips forwards, forcibly grinding her between her gut and the wall behind her. “G-get the hell off of me, You behemoth bitch!” She gave out a cry of anger and fear as she felt her spine press up against her abdomen from the agonizing pressure. “Who do you think you are?!”

“Someone who worked up an appetite working out.” Pearl licked her lips without a hint of emotion. “And you look like you’ll go down easy.”

“W-wait a minute!” The sumo said, suddenly realizing how much mortal danger she was in. “I’m...I’m sorry, okay!”

“Not me.”

“W-what?”

Pearl lifted up the hand that held Marc in an Iron grip and shoved it near her face. The human in question shrank down to avoid the Sumo’s glare and merely waved his hand pathetically. “Pearl...what are you doing?”

“No.” The Anthro sumo spat with venom. “There is no way in HELL that you can make me-Gaah!” Pearl thrusted her gargantuan stomach even harder against her, cracks appearing on the wall behind her.

“FIND!” The sumo shouted, fearful for the air in her lungs. Pearl stopped increasing pressure, but kept her fat stomach pinned against her, waiting patiently. The sumo looked down at Marc in the Orca’s hand with a look that could kill. Through gritted teeth, she whispered just loud enough for the two of them to hear. “...m’ sorry.”

“Good.” Pearl eased up her grip on the diminutive, yet still large Anthro and trudged her large body backwards. Everyone In The Gym has their eyes on the Whale, some In fear, some in annoyance, and some in respect. The sumo composed herself and walked out of the room with as much dignity as she could muster after such an embarrassment.

As soon as she left, Pearl changed her tune from somber and serious to chipper and happy. “Hey, Marc. It looks like a new piece of equipment opened up for us. Wanna make a bet which part of my body you’ll get squished to?” The obese Orca chuckled as she gestured to the weight lifting rack formerly used by the heckling Anthro from before. “It’s like a running gag with you. What has it been, your third time today?”

“...fourth.” Marc rolled his eyes and gave out a sigh as he relayed the events that happened through the course of his first day with Pearl. “You know, you didn’t have to do that, Pearl. I’m used to people talking to me like that.”

“Well, I’m not.” Pearl huffed as she sat her fat ass down on the weight lifting bench, making it cream under her weight. The last piece of equipment was comically oversized, while the rack was undersized. It was obviously made for someone a little under thirty feet, but Pearl took that fact in stride and made due. “I don’t like it when people trash talk my friends.”

“Yeah, I get that, but…” Marc wanted to shut Pearl down for trying to defend him, knowing that it would lead to nothing but more trouble, but trailed off mid sentence to focus on what she had said. “Wait a moment...you said friend.”

“Well...yeah, I said friend.” Pearl shrugged as she set Marc down on the arm rest of the bench. “You’re my friend, Marc.”

“Y-you only met me this morning.” Marc stuttered, not sure how to proceed with the conversation that was unfolding. “I’m just Your servant. I just make sure that I do whatever it is you ask me to do. It’s nothing special, really.”

“Well…” Pearl leaned her blubberly back down on the bench, her head hovering over the side of the undersized exercise equipment. “I didn’t ask you to talk to me about my family. I didn’t ask you to watch T.V with me. You’re also really patient with my...let’s say ‘clumsiness’. You told me to let out Dominique because you were looking out for me. Is it that what friends are?”

Marc blinked as he watched Pearl grasp on to the metallic rod supported by the bench. He didn’t think about it before, but it was true. He had gone beyond what his contract is required of him, which just entailed to be Obedient to his mistress. “I mean...uh, well…” Marc stammered. “Do you, Uh...wanna be friends?”

“Dude, you already are. Stop acting crazy and tell me to start lifting iron.” Pearl flashed Marc a toothy grin, one of the only that didn’t scream malicious intent throughout his entire career at the ASL. The human servant gave a small smile in response.

The next two hours consisted of Pearl using different exercise machines and equipment after she got tired of the one she was on. It was tiring, cumbersome, and just downright exhausting for the two of them; the whale because of all the physical exertion, and the human because, true to his mistress's words, he ended getting squished against her body repeatedly. Most of them were on accident, but Marc swore that Pearl meant to sit on him playfully when she lost balance doing yoga.

After a while, the rest of the fighters decided to leave, either to get a good night’s sleep for their fight tomorrow, or to raid the cafeteria while it was still open for dinner.

“Okay!” Marc exclaimed as Peal finally managed to curl her blobbish toso into a sit-up for the twentieth time, no small feet. “I think we’re good for today,”

“Thank god, finally!” Pearl exclaimed as she let her fat body fall back to the floor with a heavy thud. There was an audible squelch as she did so, the sweat around her body wet enough to drip onto the ground in puddles. She had worked a lot, perhaps the most she ever had done in her whole time as a Sumo. “Now, I hope you enjoyed being my coach today, because now I’m in charge again, and I say…”
1142221111221.title: Pearl hops off the machine

Avery helps them out, but on a few conditions...
Avery leaves them to fend on their own.
11422211112221.content:
“Holy shit!”

When a gray-feathered fist slammed down on the power button, Pearl shrieked upon landing face-first into the control panel, her sharp teeth biting into the metal and plastic. Her arms wobbled as she grabbed onto the metal bars to keep balanced, standing on one foot and the underside of her belly whilst she kept the offending fin uncomfortably pointed up in the air.

Marc begged cruel, cruel fate to finally have some mercy, that it at least not be blood in his eyes when he could only see red, that he’d be lucky to survive being smashed, pounded, and felt all of his new mistress’ weight squared on top of him for the second time in a day day. Amidst the buzzing in his ears, there was the vague mumbles of laughter surrounding them, but there were two other voices that he could make out; Pearl’s, and somebody else’s.

“You, uh...you okay there?” Came a raspy, but still prominently feminine voice.

“Marc...save...human...foot...” Pearl mouthed out between ragged breaths. “Help...Marc!”

Marc clenched his eyelids shut, relieving his injured eyes of being forced to interact with light and his blurred surroundings, but upon opening them back up, he flinched under the yellow set of eyes that seemed surprised by the presence of the squashed human under Pearl’s foot, their face’s nose and maw substituted by an ebony-hued beak that faded to match the gray of the surrounding feathers, surrounded by meaty cheeks that were curtained by long, brown hair whose tips grazed along her broad shoulders.

Cringing slightly at his predicament, the avian sumo daintily pinched him between her fingers and pried him loose, but waylaid him returning to solid ground so she could observe him up close. “...you okay there, squirt?”

As if getting crushed beneath his mistress’ foot wasn’t enough to make the scene any more surreal, there was the fact that this other girl’s voice carried a hint of concern for him, not unlike the kind Pearl’d generously been loaning him all day.

“You’re asking that and expecting more than one possible answer?” He dryly replied.

The roc girl, his mind was eased enough to recognize, tilted her head awkwardly, and without haste set Marc down on Pearl’s waiting hand. Marc was relieved that his body was intact enough that his legs didn’t snap right then and there under his weight, but couldn’t really eat up the experience before Pearl snatched him up and cradled him against his cheek.

“Oh, Marc, I’m so, so, so, so sorry!” She pleaded to him, only pausing to smooch him on the side of the face, his bruised face covering up the blush forming on his cheeks. “I promise, I’ll do the treadmill all you want, now! I-“

“NO!!!” Marc screeched, startling Pearl into giving him some space. “That...that’s enough treadmill. Forever.”

Hearing his savior give a humored sniff at the claim, Marc and Pearl both turned their glances to see the roc wiping her beak on an arm so bloated that her ‘wings’ were but decorative feathers dangling on the monstrously swollen limb. Marc observed her in curiosity; being around Pearl so much and used to looking down at everything from her shoulders, it was a strange concept for him to grasp that there existed an anthro but a foot away from being the same size, and no less seismic in sheer mass. Similarly, her hips were but a few hearty meals away from enlarging past her vertical height, to think a bird’s legs were even capable of containing so much blubber, rendering her talons but pudgy digits poking out from the girth of her ankles, and abundant breasts pushing against the chest of her shirt to give a feathery canyon in the collar rising around the hem like dough baking in a pan. An absolute behemoth of a stomach protruded out from her shirt and kissed against the face of Pearl’s as the two tried to converse, but whereas the whale’s was a sloshing, vaguely spherical ocean of lardy adipose that flowed onto the floor like a water balloon filled with gelatin, this girl’s sat on the opposite end of the spectrum with a dense underbelly of solid muscle that rounded the surrounding paunch into a perfectly sculpted orb, adding more or less a massive, feathery wrecking ball to her body fit to absorb any hit or blow she may come across in the ring.

“Well, never thought I’d live to see the day ol’ Blowhole decided to roll onto a treadmill.” She playfully quipped. “To what do I owe the rare privilege?”

“Hello, Avery.” Pearl answered, a mix of amused and miffed at being referred to by that title. “...well, if it really matters that much to you, I’ll let you know that I’m training for a survival match.”

Avery frowned. “You’re sayin’ that like it’s your first. What’s up?”

Weight. But spenin’ years lifting heavy weights and eatin’ yer own weight in red meats a day?”

Avery and Pearl both stopped in place, their attention focused on him. “Yeah, squirt?” Avery asked.

“Heh?” Avery uttered out.

“I’ll have you know my routine woulda beat that purple bimbo into grape juice!” Avery snarled.

“Well, if words bought victories around here, you’d take first prize for sure.” Marc countered. “But back here in the real world, I think a few more rounds on the treadmill would do us some good. Let’s go, Pearl.”

The orca girl nodded at the claim, and she raised her head in a snooty demeanor to waltz away from Avery. Marc stared backwards, expecting Avery to be snorting steam at the whale lumbering away with the human who’s mocked her fighting style...but instead found nothing of the sort. When she noticed Marc looking back in surprise, Pearl glanced as well to see Avery observing him with an almost admirable look, smiling.

He could try letting go of the straps, but he didn't think his hands would respond at this point, too numb to register anything other than pain. Marc was so caught up in his internal monologue that he didn’t notice the timer on Avery’s watch go off.

To Pearl’s relief as her little human’s torture was over with, Avery let out a long, drawn-out exhale of breath as her breasts rapidly deflated, the pressure on Marc’s wrists decreasing substantially. At first, his mind didn't register his tormentor’s feathers forcibly severe his grip on the straps of her bra, letting him free fall right into her open palm. When he did, he began taking in several shallow breaths he didn’t know. He had made it. He was alive.

“I’m alive…” Marc wheezed as he was brought onto the surface of the same, cinnamon-scented breasts that he had wiggled through and fought to contain. “...yay.”

“Of course you’re alive, silly~” Avery let out an amused chuckle as Marc basked in his victory over her as much as he could in his current state. “Do you really think I would put you through something I didn't think you could handle?”

“That scream told a different story,” Pearl stated bluntly, taking a small break from her jog in place to stare daggers at the grey toned Roc. Avery, in response, gave her Orca friend a smile, but her heart wasn't into it. It was the kind of smile one would make after they catch a falling glass vase just inches away from the floor.

“Maybe I went a little overboard…” Avery ran a feather down Marc’s back as he lay face down on her right breast, his body shivering from the sudden alleviation of stress her touch provided. “But I’m not going to say it wasn't fun. And guess what, Marc? You won. Now, name your award, and I’ll make it come true~.”

Marc closed his eyes as he sank into the plush breast flesh of the Roc. His body was sore, tired, and overall just done with everything the day had given him. Maybe if he wasn't in such a state, he would have asked for something else as a reward for all he had been put through. But right then and there, there was just one thing his body cried out for.

“Could you...just keep doing that back rub thing?” His voice was low and soft, but Avery still heard Marc nonetheless.

“What?” She smirked playfully, pressing her index feather at the base of Marc’s tailbone. “Like...this?”

‘Pop’

Marc’s body almost instantly went jello as relief coursed through his veins. A goofy smile formed on his mug as Avery kept running her pudgy, yet agile feelers up and down his body, putting pressure everywhere he needed it the most. The happy grin on his face made Pearl almost as relieved as him. After what seemed like the longest day, he fell asleep, nestled in the feathers and fat.

…

“Ugh…” Marc opened his eyes to the blinding fluorescent light of Avery’s gym slash quarters. He felt better, much better, more than he had ever felt since he signed up for the ASL. His eyes adjusted to the light, and he noticed he had been placed on a side table to rest while the two anthros continued with their workout. “How long was I out for,?”.

“A couple of hours, actually.” Marc craned his head to look up at the face of his mistress, Pearl, already in the process of grabbing him from his perch on the table. “Avery wanted to ‘play’ with you a bit more, but you looked so cozy snoozing like that, so she backed off.” The human took in the orca’s body as he let himself be grasped by her. While still a blob by every meaning of the word, some of the adipose seems to have shrunk down. Her features seemed more defined, even if barely underneath all her fat.

“Were you...just staring at me the whole time I was sleeping?” Marc asked as Pearl put him back on his usual spot on her shoulder.

“Yep.” Pearl smiled innocently as she gave her little human a playful cheek smoosh. “You’re really cute when you sleep, ya’ know that?”

“Uh...thank you?” Marc didn't know exactly how to respond to something like that. He felt his cheeks warm up as a blush came to his face, a fact that Pearl wasn't oblivious to. “So, what now?”

"Now..."

Pearl looked down at Marc as if he had just told her that the sky was neon pink, trying to understand her Human servant’s train of thought. Dominique, still struggling inside of the Orca’s stomach, pounded her meaty fists against the stomach wall and tried to cast some dark magical spells, but her movements were to frantic from fear to amount to anything than a internal belly massage. The hippo’s captor turned her attention to her bulging gut and smiled, running a fat hand over the surface.

“Mmm...now why would I want to go and do that, Marc?” Pearl patted her stomach, much to Dominique’s agony and her human’s confusion. It took a LOT of food to just make sure that the Orca to feel sated, but Dominique had given her so, so much more than that. “ You know, I can’t remember the last time I ever felt...full. Wow, it feels so weird to say that. She makes me feel content, not hungry.”

“But...but…” Marc struggled to find the words to describe the situation that was unfolding before him. His mind was still recovering from the torment his body had been accidentally put through. Thebiggest thing he hated about the ASL was how it didn’t even try to cover up it’s perverted hedonism, how people are taught that it’s okay to eat someone alive and whole. “It’s murder! She didn’t do anything wrong and you’re going to kill her!”

“Didn’t do anything wrong?” Pearl echoed with an amused look in her eyes. When Marc folded his arms over his chest and narrowed his face, her smile faded a little and she became a tad serious. “Oh sweetie, that’s real cute and all, but you can’t be serious. I’m sure you heard the rumors surrounding this bitch, and I cross my heart that they're all true. You think what I’m doing to her is cruel, well she’s done stuff that makes this look like a slap on the wrist.”

“Yeah, but...she didn’t do anything to you or me, and…” Marc sat down on Pearl’s cushiony breast flab as he tried to think of a good answer. Ending a life is a permanent thing. There's no way to say "I'm sorry", or to make up for it later. Dominique may not be the best person, but for a lot of people it’s just not a line that they wouldn’t cross. “It just doesn't sit well with me.”

“Why not? You know she hates your kind, you know she wouldn’t think twice about eating you.” Pearl reasoned, a little confused that Marc was trying to defend her meal. “She May have not have hurt you, but she would have, and she hurt a whole crap load of others before you. Didn’t you hear what she would do if I lost?”

“...foam under her foot.” Marc confessed, shuddering as he pictured the grotesque scene in his head. If Pearl let Dominique out now, they're was no way in heaven or hell that she’ll be grateful that a human is the source of her salvation. If anything, that would make her even more angry than she is now, flopping around in gastric juices. “Okay, so maybe she deserved what came to her, can you even move like that?”

“Of course I can! I didn’t get all the way to the gold league...ugh...without gaining...ooph…some muscle!” Pearl tried to prove to Marc that she was more than strong enough to haul a Dominique filled belly, but to her Surprise her slippery flesh just slid across the hardwood floor without an ounce of friction. “Oh...maybe not. Eh, doesn't matter! She’ll be whale blubber soon enough, than I can spend all day with you training!”

“...how long is will that take?” Marc grimaced as he looked past the horizon of Pearl’s clevage, Dominique unrelenting in her desperate escape as she kicked and screamed into Orca flesh. All he wanted to do right now was take a long bath to get rid of Pearl’s pungent smell and take a nap to rest his bones.

Pearl thumped her stomach to keep it’s noisy prey quiet and gave out a deep yawn as tiredness settled in. “I dunno. A prey as big as her…I guess around a couple hours. I got a knack for putting on weight and being always hungry, so maybe even less. I think I’m gonna crash here for a while, catch some Zs.”

“Here, In Dominique’s room? Is it that a little...disrespectful? Ah, forget it, she would have taken your room if she had the chance.” Marc relents his moral internal debate, allowing himself to feel comfortable with the sadist hippo’s demise. “Could you at least let me down? My arms feel like they’ll pop out if they're sockets at any moment, and I need to take a shower.”

“Here, let me help you with that.” Pearl offers with a warn grin. Marc didn’t understand what she meant untill after his mistress grabbed him with a free hand and hovered him over her slightly agape mouth. Before he could even let out a single shriek if terror, he was safely deposited on her tongue. She swished his bruised body around her mouth, washing away the foul oder of her sweat and replaced it with the more or less better smell of her saliva.

They're you go, clean as a whistle!” Pearl exclaimed as she set Marc back down on her breasts, soaked in spit but otherwise devoid of pungent stench. “Well, I’m gonna rest my eyes. See you in the morning or whatever. And Marc?...I’m...really glad that your okay. Thanks for putting up with me.”

“Your...welcome, Pearl.” Marc said as he observed his new master slowly close her eyes. Before long she was snoring, blowing warm air over his body as he rested on her plush tit flab. Today has been...unexpected for him. He had been squished into a couch, sat and farted on, and just now got a saliva shower. Considering his previous experiences with anthros, however, it wasent that out of the blue. What was out of the blue was the level of sincerity for his well being coming from his master. Humans are basically treated as less than pets, but Pearl…

It felt nice to be treated like a person, that’s all.

Marc leaned back into Pearl’s orbs and observed her snore, hot breath blowing over him as she breathed in and out, her heavy chest rising and falling like water. It would have been nice if she had set him down on the floor, but being stuck on top of her boobs was better than her mouth or ass. It was relaxing enough to fall asleep on, too. He closed his eyes and soon he joined his mistress in the land of milk and cookies.

11422211121.content:
When at last a squirm came from his laid form, Marc’s first feeling of the morning came as instant regret when he rose up to part from his infinitely soft bed, the one that had gifted him his first night of truly wondrous sleep in months. Too wondrous, as were all that he could remember happening the last 24 hours. Being bunked with Pearl, being smothered with kindness by the insatiable sea mammal, one such nonchalant act of compassion to slay the archenemy of every human in the facility.

Marc was yet to celebrate. So much chaos had passed yesterday and with such speed that they felt like some crazy dream, but with every blink as he stared at the ceiling, a little more doubt bled out. He wasn’t waking up from Dominique’s former room and into his own. She wasn’t going to leap from the bushes to laugh him in the face, nor Pearl and the rest of the fighters who were in on some cruel prank. No matter how many times he rubbed his eyes, no anvils were dropped on his head.

She was gone. It’d finally happened. Whatever way it could be defined, be spiritually, physically, positively, absolutely, undeniably, and reliably, it’d finally happened.

“...she’s dead.”

“She’s dead!”

“DOMINIQUE’S DEAD!!!”

His body shot up with his volume, bouncing about with tears and laughter of manic joy as he flapped about in some mad, unrehearsed dance whose flailing toured the edge between an actual dance and a mentally unsound man’s episode of hilarity. He and no other man would never see her name on the slip. Never would his nightmares of being squashed by her come true. He was free! Him and every human to suffer under her name, they were all free!

snore

But it was by his very savior that his little party saw an end, her sleeping lungs lurching so to make him loose his footing from atop her breast. A girly bleat later, his center of gravity was thrown off and he tumbled and bounced down towards her face, his head and limbs repeatedly making contact without shattered against her rubbery surface.

As many definitions of ‘heavy’ that Pearl was, apparently a sleeper wasn’t one of them. All it took to stir her was Marc landing face-down on her lowest chin to make her stir, giving a twist of her neck before her eyes parted and narrowed on her miniature intruder. With the sight of him came a smile, her pudgy finger affectionately scratching his back. “Mornin’, Marc.”

“OH MY GOD, PEARL, THANK YOU!”

The onslaught of flattery that Marc threw back at her greeting was more startling to Pearl than endearing, witnessing him hugging and kissing the flab of her neck like it were his last moment of human contact. “Oh, thank you, thank you, thank you! You’ve got a life debt out of me, Pearl, I...I can’t say how much this means to me!”

“What’re you...?” Oh, right...Dominique. “...ah, c’mon, buddy, it’s not like she’s the first I ate around here.”

“Yeah, well...it’s the first to me.” Marc retorted. “If I’d ever lost a mistress, it’d never been done for me, and the fact that it took you less than a day...well, you’re wrong. It means a lot.”

Even if Dominique tasted no more different than any of the nicer fighters she’d eaten, Pearl couldn’t bring herself to say so at the tiny amount of affection that was all the thanks that Marc could give his boss. She grinned warmly and wrapped an arm around her own breast to massage him back. “Aw...No prob, Marc.” She doted on him, but waking up enough to feel discomfort, she rocked around on a tight knot in her back “But listen, my back’s gonna snap in half if I lay here any longer. You wanna get off, or you wanna have a ride?”

“Honestly? After that night’s sleep, I’m off solid ground for life.”

“You’re welcome again, then.” She retorted, smirking, but gave a stiff intake of air as she plated both palms on the ground, dreading the usual routine of rolling up onto her feet. “Alright, time for the next twenty minutes...”

But with a single push, twenty minutes went by in the span of five seconds.

Orca and human alike screamed as instead of Pearl’s usual ordeal of hauling her big ol’ bulk up for the daily grind, the entire planet spun ninety degrees that only the two of them were immune, the foot of Pearl’s stomach hurtling upon the floor with a tectonic roar that rattled the facility all the way down to the damn bronze barracks. Much of the jiggle that her blubber provided absorbed most of the massive shift in speed, but Marc had none of the mental or physical training that an anthro used to avoid the shocks and realities of moving their bulks at such speed. He was catapulted from Pearl’s chest, and she watched him sail away in slow motion, paddling and screaming for a solid surface that wouldn’t be met splattering from the momentum.

...and seeing him float away at the speed of flowing molasses, Pearl plucked him in real time.

At his small body contacting her fins, time was kick-started back to normal speed, both panting heavily and sobered of any sleep for the next few days. Tenderly putting him in a stable spot on her shoulder, Pearl observed herself; really observed herself with the clarity she couldn’t from just waking up. Her stomach was fatter, yes, but stroking her moreso inflated middle gave yield to a surface different than her usual armory of paunch. Heavier it may have been, beneath all that lard was a hive of abdominal muscle that gave even the new excess of calories even more distance that spread outwards in every direction ahead, sculpting the normally waterfall-like sack of blubber into a spheric mass of seismic proportions, its mere presence in the room fusing the carpet into a wide, circular basin on the floor.

Stroking her arms up and down its curvature, Pearl realized the extra ease in movement and gave her arm a test as well, and was amazed by similar results; several times the limb’s former weight, and yet twice as easy to lift, her bicep fattening so as to display a backlog of incredible strength to the flab-blanketed limb.

“Huh...” Avery poked her arm to verify that the musculature inside was not only real, but casting a faint purple glow beneath her slippery sheen. She tested her other arm, then cautiously looked ahead before taking a few sampling steps, discovering that despite still possessing a waddle, it was now only brought on by being so much more wide. If the strength she could feel in her balloon-y legs was trustworthy, she could probably put in a jog.

“Damn...I’m no wizard, but maybe it’s from Dominique’s magic?” Marc offered.

Pearl herself lacked the expertise to argue back. Dominique may have been strong, but not that strong to assume she had that much muscle to digest. Whatever its source may be, though, came the question of where it would lead her. She’d barely been able to walk with her weight under tow before, now she had weight and speed. Where would it take her? What new territories could she explore beyond the lunchline, or the common trudge it’d take to make it to her fridge?

Pearl scoffed, smiling that there could even be a question.

At the corner of Dominique’s room was a couch that sat abused and worn by years spent in suffering of carrying its old mistress’ girth, but its day of solitude was also its last when Pearl navigated in front and fell inside, her ass pouring inside in an avalanche of black and white orca butt whose berth uprooted the arms from their seats, the act of leaning back dismantling the backboard. That left just a set of cushions standing on four legs, but hey! A couch was still a couch, and Pearl settled for good enough as she leaned back and switched on the TV.

Marc and Pearl Liesurely watched the first channel available, an ASL news report. Dominique’s morning greeting when she would win a fight, Marc assumed, but today there was no report of her victory. Quite the opposite, obviously.

DOMINIQUE WRENCAST, FAMED ASL FIGHTER CONFIRMED DEAD AFTER ILLEGAL FIGHT WITH GOLD DIVISIONER PEARL ORRID


The picture put to words was filmed right outside the entrance of the stadium, blockaded by a gang of overwhelmed security officers trying to contain a rally of protestors. Some waved signs, some screamed in anger, and some even wailed in sorrow as they chanted in harmony for Pearl’s blood.

“We come live from outside the ASL where petitioners are gathered in response to the murder of famed silver divisioner Dominique Wrencast, reportedly at the hands of gold divisioner Pearl Orrid in an offring fight. We’re yet to receive any development from management, but we have received word that they are busy creating a response to this turn of events. Further details will be updated in real time.”

Marc tried to wrap his head around her description, but he and Pearl were taken off track by a sudden sound from the loneliness of the room. That of...

1142221112111.content:
The Silver Division quarters of the Anthro Sumo League was always busy in the mornings. Still, today, thanks to an individual killer whale, it was downright hectic with the amount of activity coursing through its halls. The many ambitious fighters of the ASL pushed past one another with their human servants, unnervingly chipper in the aftermath of Dominique’s confirmed demise, in the bustling excitement, the air palpable with confusion, frustration, and fear. Everyone was on edge, and everyone had a tense tone of voice when they talked because while the public outside the stadium was kept in the unknown, for now, the news was first broken to them. A petty officer, a particular obese looking lobster, from the consulate for the Confederation of the Ocean traveled up from the city to lazily read the management Pearl’s rights as a dual-citizen.

The constitution stated that the government protected their predatorial expressionism, even when on the surface. Combined with the fact that she was apart of the Gold Division, notorious for being able to get away with the most rule-breaking, not only were there not going to be any repercussions, Marlene seemed pretty relaxed about it all. Humans and anthros alike whispered rumors under their breath about how the penguin's eyes twinkled at the news the tired-looking lobster gave as if she appreciated the notion of an actual challenge. And there was another person who seemed ecstatic to Pearl’s victory, someone who was given a respectful berth even in all the busyness. Indrid.

The massive moth calmly walked down the halls of the Silver Division, much to the surprise of her colleagues. The humans' restrained jubilation over the death of one of the most infamous sadists in the ASL was abruptly put to an end as they were reminded of another, even more, terrifying presence in their midst. Her black fur seemed to suck away the light as she shifted her wrecking ball of a stomach across the linoleum tiled floor, a crooked smile on her face like a jack-o-lantern’s as she breathed in the air around her. She strode purposefully across the tiles, with a set destination in mind as she regrettable restrained herself from indulging in the pure, unadulterated panic that was thickening around her. She was eager to pay a visit to an old friend now taking up residence in a rival’s apartment.

She knocked on the door of Dominique’s, really, now Pearl’s room as she waited for the orca inside to respond. Pearl huffed out a sigh as she heaved herself up from the pitiful remains of the sadist hippopotamus’ couch, the springs that managed to survive under her obscene weight letting out loud sighs of relief. She was careful not to send Marc flying off into the air this time, going slow as she could with all the new energy had in her system thanks to her meal’s magical properties. Still, even then, Pearl surprised herself with just how utterly easy it was to move her legs up and down now. She took a moment to run a bloated fin across her monumentally sized sphere of a stomach, the surface gently bobbing up and down with monochromatic blubber from the tentative pokes.

To her human, staring down at all that cresting blubber was like gazing into an ocean, almost relaxing. The orca caught her little buddy looking down her extra-obese frame and smiled before walking towards the door. The room shook and quivered slightly with each foot she stomped down onto the floor, her weight combined with the heft she absorbed from Dominique, making her a walking earthquake epicenter. Despite being the most physically able she had been in years, maybe even her entire life, Pearl still carried herself slothfully, moving through the room at the same pace Marc would take a light stroll if he were at her size. She opened the door after wiggling her huge gut of the way of the doorknob and let out a soft gasp of surprise as she was greeted by Indrid's imposing, only slightly smaller form.

What was more surprising came next.

"Hey, Indy! Long-time no see, girl!" Marc struggled to keep his jaw from falling from his head as he stared flummoxed at his master, actually brightening up and smiling as she laid her eyes on the gothic moth, the most terror-inducing fighter in the whole ASL. This being the human's first time seeing the ill-fabled insect, as he moved his attention over to her own eyes, like two drops of blood in a puddle of crude oil that was her skull, even then he knew that there was something off about her. He was expecting Indrid to be this sort of eldritch being of pure hunger. Still, with the aura of malice that surrounded her, she was not only matching Pearl's happy, warm smile, but she was wrapping her equally as fat-laden arms around the orca's form in an embrace. "Marc, this is my friend, Indrid! We go a ways back."

The human's mind metaphorically shattered with this new load of information heaped onto his fragile form. He involuntarily let out a surprised meep that rang out around the Moth's antenna. Indrid, the reclusive shut-in sorcerer who climbed the ranks of the ASL by inducing raw terror in her enemies...has a friend? And of people, Pearl is that friend?! "...nice to meet you." He offered just loud enough for her to hear him, his voice suddenly sounding far away even to him. "Um...you're not what I was expecting you to be."

"Mhmm, it's nice to meet you too, Marcus Waldreignewizch Youngblood..." Indrid rolled the human's full name off her tongue without a hint of mispronunciation, sending a shiver of fear down the back of his spine, much to her delight. However, something was missing that spark of terror from reaching its full potency. It could have been because she said it while she was giving his master's extended stomach and overly-long hug, groping and feeling the bouncing fat through her chitlin. It could have been her eyes, still a deeper shade then his blood and bright like a dulled stoplight, carrying a sense of emotion that wasn't hunger, the only feeling she was rumored to get from others. "Don't you worry, I'm everything you're expecting me to be and more. But I'm not here to get a snack. I'm here to congratulate your fatass of a mistress."

The way that Indrid insulted Pearl was didn't have the bitterness or the frustration in her voice for it to be real. It was the sort of playful, teasing banter best friends would only be able to say to one another. In a twisted sense of irony, all of this behavior was only freaking out the human, when she wasn't even trying to be scary. "Yeah, I'm such a pig. I wish I were as SMALL and THIN as you,” said Pearl with a pretend sigh, though she exaggeratedly raised both of her arms around Ingrid's back to return the friendly embrace, the fat moth letting out pleased coos as her ever so slightly smaller stomach mashed up with Pearl's. It was so surreal for the human to see someone who lived off of the fear of others act like an average person. "But's what do you mean to congratulate me? What, did you have it out for Dominique?"

"Mhmm..." Indrid nodded, thoroughly engrossed with the cuddle the two titans were sharing. Blushing a little bit, Pearl let go of her grip on the moth so she could have an actual conversation with her. Only then did the black obsidian insect end the hug, albeit reluctantly. "She had it coming to her, the hateful thing. If you weren't going to do, I would have...but you're the only person I'm okay with stealing my prey~." She winked and invited herself into the hippo's former apartment, Pearl moving aside to give the insect some walking space.

"Just to be clear, Indy." Pearl got serious for a moment. "Marc's off-limits, okay? You can do all that magical voodoo stuff with everyone else, but the last person who threatened him ended up as orca food." The human that Pearl was referring to allowed himself a smile as he heard his master protect him like that.

Indrid raised her eyebrows at this, nodding her head but still a little shocked looking. "Wait...the fight started because of your human?" She blinked her blood-red orbs slowly. "I mean, I got it, he's your human, not mine, but why would-?"

"Imagine if Dominique told you that Tiny Tim was shit." Pearl cut her off. "Marc's my Tiny Tim."

There was a long silence after that. A deep, tentative silence as Indrid's antenna twitched straight up. After what felt like an eternity, she took a deep breath and let out whatever rage was building up in her system for that imaginary scenario. "...got it." Her left eye twitched.

"Um...I don't mean to be rude here, but..." Marc suddenly joined in on the conversation, earning the attention of the two gigantic titans.

Choice 1: "Who's Tiny Tim?"

Choice 2: "Could we get breakfast? I think it's, like, ten or something."

Choice 3: "How do you two know each other?

“My stomach’ll tie itself in a knot if I don’t get any food soon. You guys mind if we talk this all over breakfast?” He asked, having not eaten since lunch yesterday.

“Well, he just said ‘food,’ so he’s got my vote.” Pearl beamed, drumming her fat fins over the roof of her belly. “Indrid, you up for breakfast?”

Indrid lost herself in thought for a moment or two, then shrugged. “I suppose. Technically, it has been three weeks since I’ve eaten anything solid.”

“...and once again, food wins.” Pearl affirmed with a triumphant nod. As with many of her courses in life, Pearl allowed her stomach to lead her to the door with Marc carried in tow and Indrid a few steps behind...but her very navigator put the three to a staggering halt at the doorway, wood bending against her abdomen as the monochromatic orb met the now-puny width of the opening.

“Uh...Indy?” Pearl asked, blushing. “Mind helpin’ out a little?”

Indrid’s eyes widened, but with a flitter of her eyelashes came up behind her friend, hands promptly open to aid. “Certainly, old friend...” The moth rolled forward atop her own belly slightly, enough that her head could sit in the fatty crevice down Pearl’s spine. Snaking her arms around Pearl’s waistband and into the doorframe, her throat rattled with something akin to the ghastly moan of a j-horror flick’s demon, but to Marc, it sounded like some sort of mothy equivalent to a purr.

Squeezing inward, and casting a spell so her own insectoid bulk was similarly compressed, the two titanesses’ bodily masses were pushed upwards. Not enough to keep from being marginally wider than the door, but just enough that their bodies had just enough give that they could snugly fit through. Once outside, both blew out happy sighs as Indrid let go, spring back into their properly globular forms.

“Ah...Thanks, Indy.” Pearl exhaled, satisfied that her last and only obstacle to the cafeteria was surpassed.

“It’s my pleasure,” Indrid teased, and Marc could tell from the subtle hop in her step that it was far from just an expression.


.....



“MORE!!!”

A simple breakfast omelette was all it took to curb Marc’s need to eat, but had he witnessed first the hunger cure-all that was Pearl eating in public, he ouldn’t have wasted their time and money. Put on display was the sort of whale Marc first expected of Pearl: eyes carved from wood that didn’t differentiate between living creatures and French fries, her booming demands ejecting from her mouth not out of anger or hunger, but just just untamable biological need that all the food in the cafeteria was losing grip on containing.

Just Pearl and Indrid entering the cafeteria was enough to drive the herds out. Indrid had mastered the art of scaring off crowds with her presence over years of effort, but even the more stupid members of the facility smart enough to see the danger looking over when Pearl was hungry and owned a license to cannibalize the faculty as she pleased. That just left a rather fat coyote chef to brave against Pearl’s hunger with frenzy in her movements, serving the insatiable whale with trays by her very claw tips as she no doubt regretted all the taste-testing that made her so pleasantly round. When trying to conventionally feed her fell ass over tit, she resorted to just piling the often uncooked rations of the kitchen around the whale and let her eat with no relent, but from the outside, Pearl gave no outward Indication that anything that traversed path the mouth physically anymore, or that whatever had plummeted into her cavernous stomach disintegrated into the void before it could feed her.

Indrid herself wasn’t above watching the poor waitress’ plight. She only had her own sampling of the uprooted cafeteria’s remains...that is, if ‘sampling’ didn’t end after ten platefuls of pasta and eighteen glasses of orange soda, but the mothwoman’s appetite was for a sensation that solid food or even fear couldn’t supply; she drew crosshairs with her eyes that directed right at the core of Pearl’s stomach, studying the black and white sphere with an intensity that could help her write a twenty-page thesis to the fleshy monolith.

Marc observed Indrid in turn, shivering at the sensation of being able to sit near Indrid and not be scared of her...okay, that was a lie. He was terrified, but that terror was mitigated by a subliminal knowledge that he were safe. Like a character in some horror movie, he could watch her in terror, but continue doing so with the knowledge that she would not hurt him, and she in turn let him watch. With her so often secluded in the darkness of her apartment, not more than a few had an opportunity to see what Indrid was like under the glare of a fluorescent, illuminating the patches of fur and skin that would disappear on nightfall. He could see her hair, an unkempt-yet-organized capping with split bangs hanging over her eyes, those cut-ruby irises capped by thick lashes and eyelids shaded a tint or two darker than the rest of her head, the skull of which gave her a nearly blank face. Absent of a nose or any other orifices to breath through but her mouth, her hissing breaths only adding to the ferocity of her staredown with Pearl. Feral, yes. Depraved, certainly. But Indrid sitting at the table had a naked air to her demure, shed of her fearsome bravado and allowing the animal inside to sit in the open.

If the many souls of those whose lives she’d ended would forgive him for saying, there was an odd sort of an unkempt beauty that the mothwoman gave off.

The mammoth insect was probably not so forgiving, however. Marc remembered all to late that she could’ve been reading his thoughts, and Indrid’s eyes had already flickered to Marc in the way that let him know they were directed to him. This was his chance: some answers to the biggest mysteries of the ASL’s most enigmatic fighter were at his disposal, a luxury denied to even the most pampered fighters served to a mere human. Where did Indrid come from? How and where she obtained her powers? Hell, what fear tasted like? With so many to ask, which was the first one to politely break the ice?

When most would take their time, thinking on that took him only five seconds.

“So, Indrid...” He chose his words carefully. “When you say ‘Tiny Tim,’ Do you mean the guy whose song was in that one Spongebob episode? That Tiny Tim?”

Her eyebrow rose, antennae perked in interest. “What’s a ‘Spongebob?’”

“Marc?” Came the owner of a fat fin that poked his side, and Marc saw Pearl much closer to the orca he knew and loved, dismay in her eyes. “I know you’re just bein’ curious, but if curiosity killed the cat, askin’ Indrid about Tiny Tim is peekin’ in the shower.”

Choice 1: Pearl needs to use the can, and trusts Indrid to be alone with Marc.

Choice 2: It’s Indrid who needs to use the bathroom, and while she’s gone, a bunch of Dominique’s friends show up and confront Pearl!

Choice 3: Indrid acts a bit too eager for Pearl to eat...and to rub her belly.

Choice 4: Roles reversed: it’s Pearl who wants Indrid to be a bit bigger...

Choice 5: Free choice.
