choices: Humans get in the silliest of places.
114222111211123.content:
Marc feels, abruptly, the force of Pearl's attention as she effortlessly transitions from being an all-consuming black hole of hunger to a caring mistress concerned for the wellbeing of her human in a second. Granted, she continued with her feast the moment her mouth wasn't occupied with doting words, but her attention was focused solely on her servant perched atop her right shoulder, even as she downed ten pounds worth of uncooked pork into her gullet. The human could see his reflection in those vast, if somewhat beady, eyes, the weight of the undivided attention almost suffocating on his form. "R-right, sorry..." He nodded his head firmly with a slight stutter, earning an amused giggle, or the moth equivalent of one, from Indrid. "So...what's safe to talk about, then?"

A smile crept to Pearl's lips as she rolled her eyes to Indrid. "Well, you could share how it felt when I accidentally sat on you back when we first met. The way she's been ogling me for the last hour and a half, you'd think she might be a little jealous of 'ya~." The leviathan of an orca gave the slightly less colossal moth a wink as she playfully pumped the same she had been staring at into her own. The insectoid Titaness let out a surprised gasp as she felt the monochromatic flesh crest over her fur in waves of fat, forced to shove her chitinous hands deep into the chub to keep balance. "Sorry about that again, but you did make that ratty old couch a lot comfier with you down there. If you're up to it, you can always ask if you want more 'accidents' happening around with me."

Somehow, pearl managed to block out Marc's immediate protest to such a suggestion, wanting to mitigate the number of times he was going to be squished underneath his mistress's form in the future. Though, even if she did hear him, he knew deep down that it was an inevitability when his job specified he stay at the whale's beck and call at all times, being a cushion was just an unfortunate reality for the humans at the ASL facility. All of Pearl's attention now focused on Indrid as the moth stopped struggling to push the stomach from her, and opted to rest her chin on the blubbery dome with a gentle croon. A quick wiggle back and forth formed a wonderfully comfortable indent in Pearl's belly, her chin coming to rest on the whale's chest as she sighed in bliss.

"Okay, I'm prepared to admit the possibility of being jealous, I suppose," Indrid mumbled, finally working up the energy to answer her old friend. Marc was beginning to feel like something of a third wheel to the scene unfolding before him, the polite thing to do was quietly scuffle away, but on Pearl's shoulder, there was nowhere to go. "But let me try something here...I want to show you something your human can't..." The insect was slurring now, finding it harder and harder to keep up the energy to talk. She giggled happily as a blush appeared on Pearl's bloated cheeks, the rosy hue only making her look cuter to the smitten bug.

After a few moments, she nodded and did as Indrid asked, turning herself away from the wall she was sitting against and slowly sprawling out onto her back. Marc, to prevent an untimely demise as the floor rapidly came close to his person, gripped hard onto the whale's neck flab to stay on her body. Indrid hugged herself around Pearl's middle to keep balance, crawling further up until her belly was fully splayed beneath her.

Both of Indrid's chitinous hands pressed in, rubbing in slow, deep strokes into the squishy chub on either side of her body. Pearl's breathing slowly grew huskier, deep huffs making more warm breath wash over the moth as she kept rubbing. Up and down, side to side, reaching around the curve of the orca's belly and pressing in from both sides, Indrid loved and doted over as much of the whale belly as she could reach. Both her hands were vanishing into the doughy surface with a firm push.

"She's got you there, Marc, that feels so good..." Pearl rumbled in bliss as she lazily reached for some of the assorted foodstuffs that were sprawled around her by the plump wolf cook, her tongue lolling out the side of her mouth as she kept panting loudly. Indrid took the opportunity to flash the human a prideful look, to which he rolled his eyes. Abruptly, she dropped all of herself on the ever-gluttonous leviathan, digging her face in the valley of her cleavage without shame.

Pearl's belly seemed to settle into a slow rhythm beneath her, the gurgling and steady, wet sloshing continually working away. Indrid's own body was relaxing as well, the moth feeling like she was floating above a waterbed, relaxing deeply against her friend. She barely twitched as the orca's fins draped around her back, holding her close and wiggling into a more comfortable position. They eventually began breathing in unison, Indrid's body rising and falling with each deep breath.

Before the two of them could lose control of their senses from the comfort that they provided each other..." Uh...excuse me?" And then the moment was ruined. Indrid rose her head from the crook of Pearl's soft bosom to glare red murder at whoever had the gall to interrupt them. It was the lone wolf cook, the nervous canine sweating bullets as Pearl rose to join the moth in the staring, though she looked less angry and more hungry then the smaller of the giants. "We're...uh, o-out of food, in the kitchen. You ate it all. P-p-please leave." The wolf announced nervously after thirty seconds of Pearl eying her up and down to see if she warranted a sizeable snack.

"No..." Pearl said once she'd allowed Indrid to climb down her stomach back onto the floor of the cafeteria. Marc, sensing something was about to happen, released his grip on the orca's neck rolls and fell a short way to the floor as well, just in time for Pearl to rise back to her feet. "You can't be done... I'm still hungry, and I need more…" She began to frown.

"Sorry, I can't help it, you have a v-very healthy appetite." The wold gave a small, anxious chuckle. "You are free to come back in an hour if you'd like, but-"

"Not enough!" The floor underneath Pearl splintered into a thousand shards as the same stomach that Indrid had been cuddling slammed down into it with the speed of a meteor. "More!" Without warning, Pearl's fin shot out and clapped around the cook's neck, prompting her to croak noiselessly in protest as she was lifted effortlessly into the air and dangled over the whale's salivating maw. The wolf flailed desperately, beating her fists in a futile attempt to loosen the whale's grasp; even biting the fin that held her with everything she could muster did nothing to prevent her slow, helpless descent between her jaws.

The wolf gave one last look to Indrid, the only person that could have been capable of saving her, who was unfortunately predisposed with the massive influx of fear she was providing her. Despite kicking and squirming, the cook couldn't stop her legs from being caught and slurped into Pearl's mouth, the muscular tongue working to hurry her along a one-way journey into her belly. The same eyes that looked over her human with concern not too long ago now stared hungrily at her new meal, devoid of any emotion, only hunger. It was clear that if Pearl could have swallowed the cook any faster, she would have.

The pressing, slick confines of Pearl's throat tugged on her lower body; the poor wolf could feel her legs had already slipped down into her esophagus, providing enough of a grip that the rest of her could be pulled down with alarmingly little effort. With a loud, echoing slurp, she was gulped further down Pearl's throat. The whale made short work of her puny morsel, and the cook disappeared between her lips.

"Mph, that was good," Pearl remarked bluntly and jovially as she slapped her stomach heartily, the great organ inside gurgling with renewed vigor as it made short work of its next influx of food. And just like that, the Pearl that Marc knew and loved was back in charge, going from one polar extreme to another as if it was nothing. Noticing that her human was gone, the orca looked around in worry before spying him on the floor. "Jesus, Marc, you scared me! What are you doing down there for?"

"Perhaps he's looking for another accident~" Indrid smiled as she bent down to the floor to grab the human in question. Marc saw his life flash before his eyes as one of the most feared fighters in the ASL casually picked him up from the ground like he was a grain of dust. His mind was automatically assuming that he was going to share the same fate as that cook, with the only difference being that he was going to cook in a moth's belly instead of his own mistress's. "Here you go~." And then he was safely deposited right back atop Pearl's right shoulder as if nothing had happened. He blinked, slowly looking over his shoulder to see Indrid struggling to hold back laughter. To her, the human had to be her easiest source of fear yet. She didn't even have to do anything to scare him to the core.

What happens next?

Choice 1: Pearl wants Marc to feel more comfortable around Indrid. Suddenly, she needs to be somewhere else.

Choice 2: Indrid continues with rubbing Pear's stomach, feeding off the fear of the cook inside.

Choice 3: Pearl's still hungry. Cuddles later, food now.

Choice 4: Marc somehow gets in another 'accident'.

Choice 5: You know, Rebel Wilson and Karen Gillan would be perfect for Pearl and Indrid~

1142221112111231.content:
...Pearl observed.

Being beady didn’t mean her eyes couldn’t see, and what she saw was one of her oldest friends scare her newest friend to his soul and get satisfaction out of it. More out of instinct than real malice, but she enjoyed it all the same.

“Agh...Pearl, come on, could you stop eating everybody that comes our way?!” Marc complained when the near-death experience of being held by Indrid settled down. “Look, I know you’re my boss, but Dominique at least had it coming! Could you please spit her up?”

“Don’t be worried about her,” Indrid offered. “I could read her thoughts. She was abusive to her boyfriend.”

Pearl’s eyes glittered. “Actually...no, Marc’s right!” She confessed, taking Marc up off her shoulder so she could place him back in the very hands he thought Indrid would use to shove him into her mouth. “Here, Indrid, how about you take Marc and I go spit her up in the bathroom?”

“P-Pearl? Wait, no!” Marc stuttered, legs kicking in protest. “I-It’s okay! I’m fine with the ground!”

Pearl only let him drop into the surprised moth’s open palms, but not without cupping her own hands underneath Indrid’s with her full warm attention on her servant. “Marc, trust me, I’m sure you have absolutely nothing to worry about...” She swiveled her gaze Indrid’s way. “...from somebody as sweet and gentle as Indrid. Okay?”

Indrid and Marc alike threw back incredulous looks, but with a pat on Indrid’s shoulder and a quick kiss on Marc’s cheek, Pearl left her blushing friends behind and marched onward for a toilet to spit up in, the severe bloating of her gargantuan middle putting her waddle to even more of some sort of clumsy, side-to-side rolling that somehow managed her along the floor.

“My,” Indrid emitted when Pearl was out of earshot. “She’s certainly serious about you and I becoming friends.”

“Mm-hmm.” Marc gave the weakest nod. This was it. In the hands of the deaths to a third of every human in the facility, the two out of sight and out of mind from the only boundary between him and getting eaten by another fighter.

“Easy, easy, you don’t have to panic” She insisted, reading him with a barely noticeable amount of annoyance. “I promised Pearl I wouldn’t hurt you, and what little ones I have, I don’t break promises with friends.” She rolled him not one palm, bringing him closer to her face. “If it means anything to you, you have my word.”

‘Anything’ to him being borderline nonexistent, but with what little emotions Indrid could display, they were absent of any quirks to imply she was lying. She could be a damn good liar, Marc knew absolutely despite truly knowing her for but two hours, but it wasn’t like she had to if she wanted an excuse to eat him, and time continued passing without her being submerged in the darkness of her stomach.

She’s right. Pearl is serious. He surmised in silence. Then came the test. He may have already made physical contact, but only as a floor for him to lay on. Sitting upright, body facing the red-eyed titaness, Marc’s arm extended and stretched ahead with his palm open, head turned aside with his eyes shut as the act of allowing himself to Indrid’s touch pained the remaining fight-or-flight nerves in his brains begging him to escape.

Then there were ten...twenty...thirty full seconds that passed with his arm shivering in the air under its own weight, and wondering why she was taking so long, he poked an eye open to observe Indrid with a rather quirk-eyed look, confused by his pose. “What are you doing?”

“...offering my palm for you to nuzzle?”

Clarifying only made her straight-up bamboozled, a pause following that put his discomfort to a full minute, but finally, an act that she herself was scared to do, Indrid brought him in so his palm could lay on the center of her face, his fingers nestling into the coarse, yet soft black fur. A bridging of worlds that lasted for ten seconds in an absolute emptiness of friendship and love, her head gladly pulling away when Marc finally released.

“Please never ask that of me again.” She asked.

“Totally.”

A long, drawing exhale came from Indrid’s mouth, and her face settled on...

Pearl comes back, happy of how well they're getting along

11422211121112314.content:
Despite how utterly awkward and uncomfortable the earlier palm nuzzle was for both parties involved, Marc observed that Indrid's head didn't pull back to where it was before. The moth opted to keep her skull close to the human in her hand without making physical contact, but eye contact was okay. Those two rubies in her noggin that made up her eyeballs focused themselves solely on Marc's own like she was trying to stare into his soul. "You know...I was stunned when Pearl told me she ate that hippo because she thought she had taken you. I mean, I've been friends with her for as long as I can remember, and I always thought her general attitude towards you humans was indifference. Too small to be food, too small to be seen, too small to care about what happens to them. But I guess I judged her wrong." Suddenly, Marc felt something warm and soft creep up on his back.

Looking over his shoulder, the human saw Indrid's chubby fingers gently curling up to press up against his form, not enough to grip his body, but enough to make him stagger on his feet. "Or...maybe I'm not. Maybe there's just something about you out of all the little hairless monkeys in the world that makes her want to listen to what you have to say, make time for your needs, and ask what you want." Marc finally noticed, after prying his eyes away from the moth's gaze, that said moth was smiling. It was the kind of smile someone would make after they had a particularly satisfying meal, but they still wanted just a little more, which made Marc a little unnerved combined with the near-constant attention Indrid was giving him. "From far away, you look just like all the other insignificant specks, but up close... you're a little cute."

"Cute?" Marc echoed with an air of amusement laced with bewilderment in his voice. He was not sheltered from the reality that some anthros had a human fetish, the same way humans had an anthro fetish, but he never took the time to understand the former. He couldn't put it into words correctly, but he would admit, if only to himself, that there were some aspects about anthros that he liked more than his fellow species, regardless of if they were his size or walking mountains of lard like those at the ASL. But the other way around just confused him. "What exactly is so 'cute' about me?"

Indrid let a wave of warm air escape past her lips as she closed her eyes to contemplate marc's question, the human bearing the full front of it as it washed over his form. He regretted asking her in the first place; he did not think she would take the time to think of a response. "Well, for one reason, it's because you're incredibly small, at least to someone as big as me. Small things, by their size, tend to pose little danger. One of the critical features that make a thing cute is the absence of feeling threatened." Marc blinked, taken a little aback by what Indrid had to say. The human couldn't tell if she was purposely trying to tease him, but he certainly felt like he was being played with as warm blood rose to his cheeks. Was she...flirting with him?! "Flimsy tiny furniture and other miniature collectibles may seem cute because we know that they could break unless we handle them delicately. I like that you force me to act carefully around you."

"R-right, but...that doesn't answer my q-question." Marc tried to stand still on his two feet without staggering and tried to sound confident without stuttering, failing miserably in both attempts. Now Indrid's eyes drooped down in amusement of all things, making the red blush around his cheeks grow more pronounced. "You've eaten a lot, and I mean A LOT of other humans before me, and I'm assuming they were all just as small and helpless and breakable as me. What's so 'charming' about me besides that?"

"Okay, so If I was excluding how tiny you are, that adorable little stammer in your voice when you get nervous like right now, that rosy hue to your cheeks and your perfectly tussled up hair..." The human wished he didn't ask so many questions. He wanted to know how to shut up and not drag himself into further humiliation and embarrassment. "...I don't know; I guess you just have a cutesy nature about you. Pearl seems to like having you around, which means your entertaining enough to keep her attention off food, no small task."

"Oh...well..." Marc was at a loss to what to say in this situation. There was no doubting it now, Indrid, the massive moth woman who fed off the fear of her victims and was responsible for the demise of countless members of his species, was enthralled in his person. By some miracle of a higher power, he managed to entice this monstrous maiden by acting endearingly to her, something he wasn't even aware he was doing. What does someone possibly say in this scenario? "...I think you're cute, too, if I'm honest."

OH MY GOD YOU DON'T SAY THAT.

But it's too late; the words have already tumbled out from his mouth. Indrid retreated her head back to its original position, letting five seconds of uninterrupted silence pass by before she let out a giggle, or at least her throaty equivalent of one. And that one laugh was all it took to let the rest of the roaring laughter she was keeping in erupt into the air. At first, she tries covering her mouth, but then she decides to use her free hand to wrap it around her stomach as she gasps for air. "I'm... I'm sorry, Marc." She attempts to calm down. "I didn't mean to laugh. It's just...that was adorable."

"You're adorable," Marc corrects.

Please stop talking.

Indrid looked down at the little human in her open palm like it was the only good thing in the whole world, save Pearl, of course. If she might have been faking being attracted to Marc before, she wasn't faking it now.

1151.content:
Marc reached the suite of his new mistress and he was sweating heavily as he was about to open the door. He heard some bad things about Crumpet. She was a 26' 4" high and 5 ton wolf who was undefeated. You remember one match where she managed to devour a tapir who was twice her size. Of course, this undefeated streak made Crumpet really arrogant and she had something of a god complex. She expected her human slaves to outright worship her. Marc gave a gulp because he knew that this was going to be absolute hell.

As Marc entered the room, he looked in horror and even screamed at the huge golden-furred, blonde and bespectacled wolf, standing absolutely huge in front of him. But that wasn't the scariest part. Crumpet hadn't noticed Marc just yet, because from the looks of it, she was too busy swallowing her previous human slave. Marc could hear muffled screaming as a human arm was reaching out of the wolf giantess's mouth, trying to escape. It availed that poor sap not because Crumpet nonchalantly pushed the arm back into her mouth with her index finger. Marc then saw a human-sized bulge travel down the 5 ton wolf woman's throat and disappear into her stomach. The next thing Marc new, bumps appeared on the wolf's stomach in the shape of human hands and a face screaming in anguish. Crumpet just smiled evilly and tapped and shook her stomach, as if to hurry the digestion process.

Marc's face turned pale white just as Crumpet released an Earth-shattering belch. Marc saw exactly how massive she was. Her stomach looked big enough to contain 20 humans while her ass was even bigger and almost reached her neck. She was resting on a Roman-style that was too small to hold all that wolf booty. The wolf giantess picked her teeth before she looked down and finally noticed Marc. She gave an evil smirk.

"So," said Crumpet. "You're the new little bug they assigned to the unbeatable Crumpet are you? Good. It just so happens I'm in need of one of you humans." "M-My name is M-Mark, Ms. Crumpet, ma'am." Crumpet erupted in hysterical laughter and her belly fat jiggled as if she heard a hilarious joke. "Name?" asked the enormous wolf. "How very cute. Oh no, no. You don't get it. As long as you're serving me, your only name is "Slave". That's all humans are." Marc was about to lose his temper on that remark. "Now, see hear...!"

But then Crumpet's face looked huge in front of Marc and she gave a vicious grin, showing her monstrous teeth. "It's amazing how adorable humans are when they think they can defy their superiors. The halls in the Gold Division quarters were immaculate—not a stain on the walls or vaulted guilded ceiling, the carpet was some miracle imported fabric Marc couldn’t pronounce to save his life that everyone said was near-impossible to get dirty...but cleaning crews still scoured it for hours, purging any trace of dirt or odor. Up here, there was even perfume cycled through the vents to make the place smell as luxurious as it looked. Today, the ASL had chosen a floral scent: a hint of roses and saffron that he found relaxing despite the danger being a Gold Division fighter’s personal pet posed.

It was actually really nice. Marc made a mental note to get an air freshener with that scent. IF you survive, an unwelcome thought added.

He was still enjoying that flowery smell when he came upon one particular door, and a mat laid in front of it—rather than Welcome, it read Wipe your feet OR ELSE. Dirt means PAIN There was a sudden harsh chemical smell that made Marc's eyes water: it was like someone had sprayed bleach all over the door. So this anthro was a major neat-freak.

And the number on the door matched the note he'd been given. G-101.
This was where his new mistress stayed.

Well, time to get it over with. Steeling himself, Marc knocked on the door. "Service? This is Service for room G-101!"

“Is that my human?” A posh woman's voice answered. Thundering footsteps approached, and the door opened to release an elegant classical music piece playing in the room, and reveal a plump swan woman, her form wrapped in an elegant white silk dress and a black fur coat draped over her shoulders. A pearl necklace adorned her long avian neck. Beneath her expensive outfit, fat and muscle rippled. "Good, you've arrived. Taking your sweet time, of course," the bird giantess added, her British accent laying the arrogance of wealth on thick.

Marc suppressed a whistle. His new mistress was a bombshell. And a RICH bombshell, too, going by the swanky outfit.

"Are you going to serve me or ogle me? Don't tell me I have to eat you already..." she squawked. "Come in, and wipe your feet! They barely vacuum the hall out there; track dirt in and I'll sit on you for an hour."

Marc mentally groaned, obeying. Now he remembered who this was: Sapphire, the Gold Division's biggest prima donna. She was as prissy as she was brutal--she'd eaten almost all of her opponents, sometimes outside of Survival Matches; and demanded to be treated like royalty. He'd seen her gulp down a Jaguar woman who'd tapped out and waved to the crowd in graceful loss. He sometimes had nightmares where he tried and failed to save her from Sapphire's belly.

Sapphire was waddling back into her luxurious room (Marc just thought the expensive decorations were tacky), Marc following in the shadow of her looming feathery rump...and she suddenly spun around and grabbed him, holding him close to her beak.

"JESUS CHRIST, IT'S BEEN FIVE MINUTES!" Marc wailed, fighting Sapphire's grip. "WHY ARE YOU EATING ME?!"

Fuming (he took a shower this morning!), Marc got undressed and hopped in, running a shower. A quick scrub-down got the sweat off him, and it was nice--but as soon as he turned the water off...

"Don't get out yet, get PROPERLY clean!" Sapphire's voice came from behind the door. "Who knows what you picked up before coming in here. Scrub harder, too! Dirt can cake onto your skin, especially human skin. Feathers stay so much cleaner..." she added in a disgusted mumble.

Grumbling low enough to be drowned out by the running shower, Marc complied. This was still worth not getting sat on in the first day.

By the time Sapphire judged Marc clean enough--close to an hour of constant scrubbing--his skin was reddened and stung at a touch. He must have almost scrubbed the top layer of his skin off...thankfully he hadn't started bleeding. Toweling off and putting on his clean clothes hurt like hell.

"Good, now you're as presentable as you can be," Sapphire snipped, snobbish as ever.

To cut off his planned snark, Mac instead asked, "Who was that change of clothes for, Madam?"

"My last human. He displeased me, so I ate him. At least he was tasty. Lasted for three days in here, so was good for internal massages at least," Sapphire answered, patting her belly. She might have been talking about the weather.

Marc gulped and stepped back. For all her prissiness, Sapphire was still a killer.

Sapphire reached down for Marc again. "But as for what you'll be doing now..."
115331.title: Kewl!

1153312.content:
"You shall be my seat cushion for the next several hours."

"What?! Why?!"

"Because you entered my room so dirty, of course."

"B-b-b-but I'm clean now!"

"Yes. Barely," the swan said disdainfully. "Did you really think I'd dirty my clothes by sitting on you before you washed? Disgusting! Honestly, even a pathetic human such as yourself should've known better than to cross the threshold of my abode without being immaculate. This isn't a barn. It's the residence of a Gold Division fighter! If you're to survive more than a week in my employ, you must learn that cleanliness is next to godliness. And since I'm your new god, you'll be next to me for the rest of your life."

Marc gulped. "Don't you mean, for the rest of my contract?"

"Do I?"

The edges of her beak curved into a cruel smirk. Clearly she shared his thoughts on the odds of his survival. For the second time that day, the gigantic swan grabbed him, only this time, instead of raising him to her beak, she carried him to her bed and tossed him on top of it. It really was as soft as a cloud. It's funny. In any other scenario, a woman throwing him onto her bed would've been fulfilling one of his fantasies. Here, as Sapphire turned around exposing the mountainous backside of a near-thirty-foot tall, pear-shaped behemoth, it was pretty clearly a nightmare.

WHOOMF

Sapphire's ass came crashing down, enveloping him utterly and completely. The swan took a second to get herself situated, wiggling her ass back and forth to get comfortable, causing Marc to let out muffled shrieks from underneath her. When she was finally satisfied, she let out a small, "Ah," and leaned backwards to read the fashion magazine she had on her bedside table.

"Your usefulness as a servant remains to be seen, but apparently you're quite serviceable as a cushion." Marc could only offer more muffled protests which Sapphire ignored.

Although his hearing was dampened, Marc could make out the harsh tones of his mistress, crystal clear. This wasn't the first time he'd been sat on as part of his "career" in the ASL. If he was thinking about it objectively, it wasn't the worst time either. A few pachyderms had sat on him with skin so rough and heavy that it felt like having an actual mountain sit on him. Another afternoon spent under the behind of a pig woman had been repulsive because of how sweaty she'd been... that and the infrequent burst of flatulence.

Sapphire sitting on him on the other hand was about as "ideal" a situation as it could be. It was still humiliating, degrading and painful, but not as much as it had ever been in the past. For one thing, her ass was surprisingly soft. Almost as soft as her bed itself. And the pressure, while strong, didn't immobilize him like some others might. The smell wasn't bad either. It was actually... kind of nice. Thankfully her standards for cleanliness applied to herself as well. The scent of her body wash and perfume gave everything a pleasant, floral scent... It was when Marc realized that he was looking on the bright side of being under a bird's back side that he finally realized just how sad a point he'd reached in his life.

"I've been feeling some tension in my glutes since my last match," Sapphire said. "Perhaps if you put your pathetic squirms to good use in giving them a massage, I may reduce the number of hours for your punishment."

I wanted to be an astronaut when I grew up, Marc thought sadly as he reluctantly began carrying out Sapphire's instructions. He had enough freedom of movement to move his arms and he began searching for the tension his mistress had mentioned. He wasn't a professional masseuse, but he'd learned how to give massages fast in the ASL. If Sapphire's pleased moan was any indication, he was doing a good job.

Maybe I won't have to eat this one after all, Sapphire thought. He's certainly got magic fingers. Her behind being properly pampered, Sapphire turned back to the fashion magazine she was reading. She was on the cover, of course. Once again beating out the Glamor Gator. That cold-blooded Silver Division fighter would never be anything more than a wannabe runner-up. She gave a haughty laugh and kept reading. Every now and then Marc would grow tired and Sapphire would incentivize him with a quick clench of her cheeks. He got the message soon enough and worked through his pain.

=== Three Hours Later ===

Marc couldn't take it anymore. He'd been giving a massage for three hours straight. His arms felt like they would fall off! He needed a break, even if it meant risking the ire of his new mistress. He turned his head to the side, trying to ensure that he didn't get any of Sapphire's backside into his mouth when he spoke. It was less the indignity of it than fear of what she would do to him if he got drool on her dress.

"Msh Sphir?" Marc said as loudly as he could through his squished face. "May oo pwease geh off e? ... Msh Sphir?"

There was no response. Marc listened closely and realized he could hear something faintly... snoring. She was asleep! On the outside Sapphire was dozing peacefully, her magazine had fallen over her face. With Marc underneath her, she looked like she was trying to hatch an oversized egg.

Marc wondered what he should do. On the one hand, he was at the end of his rope. He wasn't sure he could take another few hours trapped underneath his new mistress, even if he wasn't massaging her. But what could he do? Wake her? How? Pinching or biting her seemed like a one-way ticket to pain for him. So what was left? Spending the next several hours trapped beneath her until she woke up on her own? Would she respect his obedience or be angry at him for letting her sleep?

What does Marc choose?
1153312.title: Ever had a goose feather mattress sleep on you?

choices: Sapphire wakes up shortly. Does Marc have her pegged or not?
Sapphire wakes but because she's really hungry!
There's a loud knock at the door...? Sapphire actually has friends?!
11533122.content:
For all the world, Marc was tempted to try and wake Sapphire up. He really was. He was sore, he was tired and just plain sick of being sat on! There was just one problem: he didn't know how to accomplish that without angering Sapphire.

He had tried squirming out from under her several times and actually made some progress but his limbs had started to cramp. Those three hours of massaging had not In his drained state, the effort combined with the pain had quickly dissuaded him from continuing. That and he was afraid that any pained gasps or yells would wake up Sapphire, whom he doubted would have appreciated such a rude wake up call. His ability to get out from under Sapphire were basically nil, he thought out doing something to gently wake the large swan up...and realized that even that was a bad idea.

Marc had not survived the ASL so far by being stupid. He'd quickly learned to start analyzing his mistress' behavior in order to better survive them. Right now, he actually had some quiet time and felt best to just

So far, from what little he'd seen, Sapphire was an arrogant diva with exacting standards and an obsession with cleanliness. She would do what she wanted, when she wanted and expect her servants to keep up. She was in charge and made damn sure to remind you of that fact. Given all of that, Marc deduced that she would not like him interrupting her rest, just because he was uncomfortable. He have to frame everything around her wants and needs if he'd hope to survive this...

If I survive this, maybe I should go into psychology, Marc mused. If she wakes up and questions me, I'll just say that I didn't want to inconvenience her and see how she takes it. That will give me a good indication of if I can actually deal with her or not. If she's even capable of being reasonable...cuz if she's not I gotta figure out how to get rid of her...
11533122.title: Staying put but not being unproductive.

115331223.content:
Marc's careful analysis of Sapphire's personality was cut short by a loud knock at the door.

"Sapphire! Sapphire, you there?"

The colossal swan woke with a startled honk. "What time is it?" She looked at the clock and let out another, smaller honk. "Damn it! The girls are here! Why didn't that stupid human wake me? Where is that useless fool anyway?"

Marc debated whether or not he should remind her where he was, before deciding to gently tap one ass cheek. She yelped, then stood up. Marc took a deep, grateful breath of fresh air as Sapphire got off him, his weakened body left in the crater-like impression of Sapphire's buttcheeks in the mattress.

"There you are you little fool! Why didn't you wake me?" she snapped.

Marc bit down his retorts. That 1) she hadn't told him she was expecting company, 2) she didn't tell him when to wake her, and 3) he had no way to know what time it was since her fat ass blocked the clock! Instead he said his prepared remark.

"I'm sorry, mistress, I didn't want to inconvenience you by waking you--"

"So you'd rather make a fool of me in front of my friends instead?" she demanded, bending over and craning her elongated neck down so her face was close to Marc's flattened form. "Imbecile! Next time think before you slack off! If there is a next time..."

Okay, Marc thought. So she's unreasonable... And a bitch. Got it. Guess I'll have to find a way to get rid of her after all.

More knocking came from the door.

"Sapphire? SAPPHIRE! You in there or what?"

"Just a moment, ladies!" Sapphire called, casting a nervous look at the door. To Marc she whispered, "Never mind. I'll deal with you later. First you'll help me salvage this mess by making the bed so my quarters are presentable. Then answer the door to receive my guests. Offer them anything they want while I get ready."

Marc wondered what the point was of her getting ready since she was just as well-dressed and dazzling as she'd been before her nap. Marc himself didn't look nearly as good. He looked like... well, he looked like he'd been used as a cushion by a fat, sleeping swan for several hours. He didn't argue though. He just got up and made the bed as she stomped off to the bathroom to get ready.

Once the bed was made, Marc went to the door. He didn't bother spending time worrying about who might be on the other side. The voice sounded familiar but not one Marc knew intimately. Whoever it was, Marc figured he'd find out who they were soon enough.

Marc opened the door and was met with the sight of two other bird women. The sight of the first one filled him with hope. It was Avery, a large roc who'd joined the ASL for the thrill of the fight. Marc had heard that she was pretty chill as far as anthro mistresses went, treating humans decently by anthro standards. Marc took heart that maybe her presence meant Sapphire wasn't so bad. That impression wasn't lasting, however, when Marc noticed the anthro standing next to her: Amaya the phoenix. Not only was she one of the best fighters in the ASL--a champion of the Gold Division--but she was fiery, prone to angry outbursts and had a taste for human meat.

Marc took one look at them and gulped. He didn't have time to do anything else, as Amaya pushed past the other women, said, "Out of the way, runt," and literally bowled Marc over in her impatience to get inside. Marc let out a squeaky wheeze like a chewtoy as the phoenix stepped on his stomach. Avery at least took the time to step over him and mouth, "Sorry."

"Sapphire!" Amaya said. "Are you here or what?"

"I'll be out in just a few moments, darling!" Sapphire called from the bathroom. "In the meantime, help yourself to whatever you like. My servant will do whatever you command!"

The grumpy phoenix plopped herself down on the couch. "I've waited for her "just a few moments" before. We'll be lucky if she comes out this century. All I can say is, we better not miss our reservation, I'm starving." The phoenix cast a hungry eye at Marc as she said this and he felt like someone was walking over his grave. "Hey, runt, get me something to eat!"

Marc jumped to obey, practically sprinting into Sapphire's kitchen. Avery sat in the lounge chair next to Amaya, looking far more relaxed than the phoenix did.

"Relax, Amaya," Avery said. "You'll scare the little fella."

"Good. The little punk should be thanking me. Fear keeps humans alive around here. Maybe if Sapphire's last slave was more afraid of her, he wouldn't have ended up on the menu. Looks like she's wasting no time in breaking this one in."

A few minutes later Marc emerged from the kitchen carrying a silver platter piled high with fresh fruit.

"What is this?" Amaya demanded. "A mid-day snack? Get me some real food! I want meat--Hey wait a minute! Did I tell you to take the platter with you? Leave it. Now run. GO!"

Marc scampered away and Avery chuckled as Amaya began digging into the small mountain of fruit. "I swear, I'll never understand this obsession some of you girls here have with torturing humans. They're small, they're weak, they're pathetic. Why bother? It's pointless, like burning ants with a magnifying glass."

Amaya shrugged with her mouth full of chewed apples. "Girl's gotta take her fun where she can have it."

Marc soon returned again, this time with a platter filled with fresh cuts of ham, pepperoni, sausage, turkey, chicken and roast beef. Marc only wondered now if Amaya and Avery would perceive being served poultry as some kind of cannibalism, but they didn't complain as they both dug into the meat with reckless abandon. Marc didn't content himself with letting out a sigh of relief though. Instead he just waited for his next order... and pondered about the ways someone like Sapphire could meet her gruesome demise. In the ring maybe? A Survival Match against a deadly opponent? How nice would that be.

"Fear not, darlings! Your hostess has arrived!" Sapphire called out as she emerged from the bathroom. She wore a sparkly red dress with a gold scarf through around her long neck.

"Took you long enough, Saph," Amaya said, as she polished off the last bite of turkey.

The swan blushed. "I'm terribly sorry, dear," Sapphire said, shooting a deathly glare at Marc, who squirmed under her gaze. "This little fool was supposed to wake me up."

"Say no more," Amaya said reasonably. "Just be sure to kick his ass later."

"With pleasure," Sapphire crooned.

"Anyway, you look nice," Amaya said. Sapphire smiled and opened her beak to respond when Amaya checked her watch and cut her off. "Damn it. The place is gonna be packed! We'll never get in!"

"No worries there, darling," Sapphire said with a rich laugh. "The owner owes me a favor. She'll let us in at any time."

"Great!" Avery said. "Thanks, Sapphire. It was really nice of you to invite us along."

Sapphire laughed again but this time it sounded false. "Yes. Well, when Amaya told me she'd invited you along, how could I refuse?"

Avery hadn't caught the tension in Sapphire's voice but Marc did.

Interesting, Marc thought. Sapphire doesn't want Avery here... And the colors of Sapphire's outfit match Amaya... is that intentional? Is she trying to suck up to the phoenix to learn her techniques to surpass her as champion? Or... could Sapphire want a little alone time with Amaya for other (winkwinknudgenudge) reasons? Nah, I'm probably imagining things... Probably.

"Slave!" Sapphire squawked. "Make yourself useful and carry my purse!" She pointed a winged father at a black purse the size of a large suitcase. Marc ran over and gave a strained grunt as he lifted it up. It felt twice as heavy as himself. He had no time to catch his breath though as Sapphire was already directing her guests out the door, Marc following on weak legs. They made their way outside to Sapphire's private car that would take them to the other end of the ASL compound, which contained all the restaurants and entertainment used by ASL fighters, and guests willing to pay for the privilege of hobnobbing with their favorite fighters.

It was only then that Marc wondered just where the hell they were going. Where would someone like Sapphire take her friends for a good time?

1) The Golden Platter - The fanciest restaurant in the ASL, reserved for only current Gold Division fighters, former fighters, their guests, and technically their slaves.

2) Club Sumo - The hippest, most happening dance club in the entire ASL compound.
115331223.title: Birds of a Feather?

choices: Grab some drinks at the bar?
1153312232.content:
Marc got his answer when the car came to a stop in front of a large, two story building with a line of anthros along the front and circling all the way around the corner. Different colored lights flashed in the windows in a sequence: purple, green, blue, gold, red. Some kind of techno music was booming inside, the sound loud enough to carry outside and make the car gently shake. Neon lights depicted a golden phoenix fighting an indigo hippo, while, below, written in white lights, were the words: CLUB SUMO!

"Look at the size of that line," Avery said. "How on earth are we going to get in there?"

Sapphire laughed condescendingly. "Watch and learn, dear." She snapped her feathered fingers. "Slave. Door. And don't forget my purse."

Marc kept his annoyed groan to himself. He heaved her two-ton purse and stepped out of the car, circled around and opened the door facing the club. Sapphire got out first, followed by Amaya and Avery. With each anthro who exited, the car would raise a few inches off the ground. Marc hadn't realized how close the underside of the car had come to scraping along the road.

Independent of the line that seemed to go on forever was a red carpet that led to the entrance, two angry-looking pit-bull anthros wearing sunglasses and black t-shirts stood guard. When they saw Sapphire approaching, they bowed and opened the door for her and her retinue without a word.

Sapphire noticed the shocked looks on the rest of them and laughed richly. "It's like I said, the owner owes me a favor."

Amaya chuckled. "Unquestioning obedience. I like it!"

A slight flush came to Sapphire's cheeks. "Thank you, darling. I do what I can."

The inside of the club was just as packed as the outside and the music was so loud it rattled Marc's entire body. Marc saw a dance floor made of multi-colored, flashing tiles that stretched on and on the size of several football fields, and dancing on it were every kind of anthro under the sun. Most of them had the body type that lent itself to a place called "Club Sumo" but there were also lithe and muscular anthros dancing as well. Looking out over the sea of bouncing bosoms, jiggling booties and gyrating bodies, Marc recognized many fighters from the ASL. There was Claudine, dancing with all the grace and elegance one could expect from a unicorn, dancing with Gloria the Glamor Gator, who was keeping pace just as well. One would almost think they were competing instead of enjoying themselves. He also spied the farm girl pig, Daisy, dancing like a maniac, swinging her latest, poor human servant along with her like a doll, oblivious to his obvious sickness and pain as he slammed into other dancers like a ping pong ball. He even recognized Dominique twerking on the dance floor and felt a twinge of pity as he saw the back of her thong was comprised of a human male. His hands and legs were tied with tight leather and his face was buried deep in the hippo's asscrack. Having just spent several hours in a similar position, Marc's heart went out to him.

Bars encircled the entirety of the dance floor, where anthros sat on reinforced stools and laughed and drank. The first three drinks were free for fighters and everyone present was more than willing to take advantage of that fact.

"Hell yeah!" Avery said, taking in the excitement around her. "This place is popping! I don't know where to start, if I should get my groove on or my drink on. What do you think, Amaya?"

"You kidding me?" Amaya said. "Remember what happened the last time you got one too many drinks in you? I'm amazed anyone still serves you alcohol."

"What's that supposed to mean?" Avery demanded.

"It means--"

But Marc didn't hear what it meant as he was suddenly yanked away from the phoenix and the roc and found himself face-to-beak with Sapphire.

"Now you listen to me, slave," Sapphire whispered so the other two couldn't hear. "It is imperative that this night go off perfectly. In order for that to happen, it means I need that overgrown chicken, Avery, out of my feathers, so I can spend some time with Amaya alone."

"Why do you need to be alone with Amaya?" Marc asked, feigning innocent ignorance.

"Never you mind why!" Sapphire snapped, blushing furiously. "I just need you to keep that dumb roc distracted for a few hours. That's where you come in. Keep her busy, keep her distracted, but, most of all, keep her the hell away from Amaya and me. Do this well and I'll let your earlier failures slide. Fail me..."

She let his imagination complete the thought for him. Marc gulped. Personally he still didn't think he'd failed her at all so far, but there was no use arguing that with someone like Sapphire. Marc nodded in understanding.

"Good," Sapphire said. "Now get to work."

Marc approached the two colossal bird women warily. They kept talking, oblivious to his presence, but he could feel Sapphire's stare on him. He gulped again. How on earth could he keep Avery occupied for a few hours? She seemed friendly to humans--at least by anthro standards--but he doubted that meant she'd want to spend all her time with one instead of her friends while in the best club for anthros around.

One step at a time, Marc thought to himself. He cleared his throat to get their attention. Then did so again--louder--when the two's conversation didn't stop. Finally he just shyly tapped Avery on the arm. The roc broke off and looked at him. "What's up, little man?"

"Yeah, what the hell do you want?" Amaya said, clearly not pleased to have her talk interrupted. Avery, however, was looking at Marc with curiosity instead of hostility. He took that as a good a sign as any.

Marc cleared his throat. "Um, Ms. Avery, w-would you like to... um..."
1153312232.title: Club Sumo

choices: Someone else sits on Marc's stool
11533122322.content:
"Grab some drinks at the bar?" Marc said.

The two gigantic birds stared at him, blinking.

"You... want to drink... with me?" Avery repeated slowly, like Marc was speaking a foreign language.

"Yes, Mam," Marc replied, cringing as if expecting to be hit.

"Oh I get it," Amaya said to Avery. "One anthro-sized drink will last him the entire night. And he knows fighters get three free drinks before they have to pay." Amaya turned her narrow gaze to Marc and he felt his blood run cold. "You little runt, you just want to mooch off Avery so you can get hammered!"

"No!" Marc yelped. "That's not it at all!"

"Yeah right. Do you have any idea how much drinks here cost? How's an ASL slave gonna be able to afford Avery's drinks?"

Marc gulped. Everything had happened so fast and he'd just blurted out the first thing that came to mind to get Avery away from Amaya. He hadn't actually thought of how he'd manage to pay for the drinks. His salary was pocket change compared to what the fighters made. He tried to come up with an answer but just opened and closed his mouth, no sound coming out, like a fish yanked out of the water.

"That's what I thought," Amaya growled.

She took a threatening step towards him only to be stopped by Avery putting a firm, feathered hand on her friend's shoulder. "Easy there, girl. We're all here to have a good time. You're getting yourself worked up over nothing."

"Like hell I am! This pipsqueak's trying to take advantage of you!"

"Is there a problem, darling?"

Sapphire appeared out of the crowd, taking in the sight of her servant cowering in front of the enraged phoenix and the roc trying to keep things peaceful.

"Sapphire, good, you're here," Amaya said. "I was just gonna look for you. I need your permission so I can light a fire under your slave's ass!" She punctuated her statement by igniting a fireball in her hand. Marc yelped while Avery let out a loud sound of protest which Amaya ignored.

"Hmm, I hate to deny you anything, darling, but I did just get this one today. May I ask why you wish to incinerate him so badly?"

"He's trying to take advantage of Avery for free drinks!"

"Amaya, come on!" Avery argued. "You're jumping to conclusions!"

"I'm afraid Avery's right, darling," Sapphire said in her calm, refined manner. "This is a simple miscommunication. I'm afraid this slave isn't as eloquent as us. You know how humans are. A few moments ago, Mr... Err... Um... Well his name's not important. Anyway, a few moments ago he pulled me away and told me how much he admired Avery. Turns out he's a real super fan. He'd even admitted to hoping to be assigned as her slave. Naturally I'm too gracious to be offended by such a careless remark, but I did take pity on him and graciously granted him permission to buy Avery a few drinks so that he could finally meet his hero. All of these drinks will, of course, be put on my bill."

Marc was frankly amazed that Sapphire had managed to conjure such a massive torrent of bullcrap in just a few seconds, and even more amazed when that lie seemingly did the trick.

"Awww," Avery cooed. "You're a fan of mine, little guy? Well why didn't you just say so?"

"Yeah dumbass," Amaya said. "You should've told us Sapphire was paying for everything. That's really generous of you, Saph."

Sapphire beamed. "Thank you, darling. I try."

"I'm really impressed you didn't squash the runt the second he told you he wished he was assigned to another fighter. Any slave of mine ever said that to me and I'd roast him on the spot. You though? You're different. You got class."

"Really, darling, it's nothing!" Sapphire said while blushing furiously. "But don't downplay you're own virtues, darling! You're the strongest person I've ever met."

"Meh, it's nothing," Amaya grunted. "There's a few moves I can teach you if you're interested in a private session."

Sapphire somehow turned an even deeper shade of red and let out a nervous laugh, complete with an involuntary, highly unclassy honk. Whether or not Amaya meant the double entendre, Marc never found out, as it was then that Avery lifted him off the ground in a bridal carry and began carrying him towards the bar.

"Come on, you heard the swan! Free drinks! I'm gonna show you how to party and you can tell me all about how much you admire me, Super Fan."

"Oh! Right... um..."

Despite working for the ASL, he rarely got the opportunity to watch any matches that didn't involve his current owner at the time. He wracked his brain trying to think of one he'd ever seen with Avery and was drawing a blank.

"Ah, I see what's going on," Avery said knowingly. "You're shy! No wonder you've been acting so nervous around me all night! Don't worry, we'll have some drinks and loosen you up a bit first."

Marc let out a sigh of relief at the temporary reprieve. As Avery navigated the occupied dance floor to the closest two available seats at the bar, Marc was grateful that she was carrying him instead of making him walk. Seeing all those anthros carelessly stomping and jumping along to the music made Marc aware of just how easily he could be crushed like a bug by an errant dance move.

When they arrived at the bar, Avery plopped Marc down on one of the stools clearly meant for an anthro. He was so high off the ground and his feet dangled just past the cushion, making him feel like he was sitting in a highchair. Even though the stools were reinforced, Avery's still screeched as she plopped her bulk down onto her seat.

"Maybe it'd be better if I sat on the bar instead, so someone else can sit on the stool? I don't take up much space after all."

Truth was Marc was just acutely aware of the inevitable consequences of sitting on a seat meant for anthros. Either way, the bartender--a plump, brown minotaur woman in a red tank top--shut that idea down.

"No humans on the bar. Either sit on the stool or stand."

STOMP STOMP STOMP went the dancers all around him.

"I'll sit," Marc said.

"Don't worry, Super Fan," Avery said. "I'll protect you!" Her point was somewhat undercut when she gave Marc a playful slap on the back that was hard enough to send him lurching forward, only barely grabbing onto the counter to prevent himself from falling to the ground.

"Hey! What did I just say?" the minotaur said. "No humans on the bar!" She twisted her towel she was using to clean glasses with and whipped it at Marc's hands, causing him to push himself back to the relative safety of his stool. "Now, what'll you be having Avery?"

"Two Sumo Slammers to start, Rosa!" Avery said. "And just so you know, everything after the freebies are going on Sapphire's tab."

"Right," the minotaur said. "Boss said Sapphire was coming. Told me to make sure everything was available to her friends." Rosa hesitated as she looked at Avery. "You sure you want Sumo Slammers? They're strong stuff. And after the last time you were drunk--"

"Rosa!" Avery whined. "Don't embarrass me in front of my number one fan! I don't get why everyone's so concerned. I'm a big girl. I can handle my alcohol."

Rosa gave her a skeptical look but shrugged her shoulders and filled two shot glasses from a bottle with an ass overlapping with a skull and crossbones. Mercifully, they had human-sized shot glasses so Marc could take a normal drink, but Avery's was the size of a pitcher of beer.

"Cheers, Super Fan!" Avery said with a wink. She raised the drink to her beak and threw it back easily. Marc tried to do the same and ended up coughing as the burning liquid filled his mouth and went down his throat, setting his insides on fire in the process. He pounded the bar with a fist.

"WHOO!" Avery said. "Two more!" Rosa sighed as she poured a refill for them. "Now you, Super Fan. Quit being so quiet. Which one of my matches was your favorite?"

"Um... well... Oh!" Marc exclaimed, finally remembering a match he'd seen of Avery with an old mistress of his. "That Tag Match where you and Athene faced off against Dominique and Mega Molly the Mole!"

"Wow, that's an obscure one. An oldie but a goodie!"

"I remember when Molly had Athene on the ropes and you used your Talon Strike to send her flying out of the ring! That was incredible!" Marc wasn't lying there either. He'd hated Molly. Seeing a cruel mistress kicked in the face was always good for a laugh.

"Yeah, Molly was a tough one. Kind of a bitch too... Still... it was a shame to see her challenge Pearl to a Survival Match."

Shame for Molly, maybe. It'd been one of the best days of Marc's life. He still had a scar from one of her punishments. Rosa laid down two more shots and Avery picked hers up.

"I hate Survival Matches. Seems like a waste of good fighters if you ask me. That's why I never take them." She raised her glass. "RIP, Molly." She and Marc drank again, the second shot going down no smoother for Marc than the first one did. "Two more!" Avery said, while Marc was still coughing. "And you, Super Fan, keep talking. I don't get to interact with human fans often."

Marc talked on and on, scourging his brain for all memories of Avery's previous fights. Avery meanwhile, kept drinking more and more, long after Marc stopped. After an hour however...
11533122322.title: Grab some drinks at the bar?

115331223221.content:
Drink after drink had disappeared down Avery's gullet over the course of the hour. Rosa had firmly cut her off after her fifth shot but Avery had easily made the transition to beer, putting away ten anthro-sized bottles so far. Two shots had been enough to make Marc tipsy, so he'd only been sipping on a single human-sized bottle of beer, but he'd watched in something close to awe as Avery managed to keep putting one away after the other. He'd never seen an anthro drink so much in his life.

He didn't know why Amaya and Rosa had sounded so nervous about Avery drinking earlier. She seemed fine... albeit totally hammered. He'd made a few suggestions that she should take things slower, but each time Avery brushed him off and encouraged him to keep telling her stories about herself.

"HA! That wash a good one--hic! I tell ya, sometimes I mish the Silver Decision... Tell me--urp--tell me anudder one, Super F--HIC!"

Marc's catalogue of past matches he'd witnessed had been exhausted. He was tempted to just take his chances making things up. She was so wasted by this point that he doubted she'd notice.

"Come on, come on, I'm waiting!" Avery said, banging the counter with a fist and making Marc jump.

"Um, well... let's see... um... there was... er..."

"Y--you--you gonna finish that?"

"What?"

Avery didn't bother to answer, she just nabbed the beer bottle out of his hand. The contents were comparatively a thimbleful for her, but she open her beak and drank the beer down greedily. Once it was gone she winced.

"That stuff is weak! What're you schum kinda li--lightweight?"

"I'm not a big drinker," Marc said.

"Rosa! I need another! HEY! ROSA! I SAID I NEED ANOTHER! WHERE ARE YOU?"

'That's a good question,' Marc thought. The minotaur was nowhere in sight. She'd done her best to curtail Avery's drinking but she'd had no choice but to follow her boss's orders and keep serving the roc. The last time Marc had seen her had been fifteen minutes ago when she'd given Avery a six-pack then said she needed to help another customer. As he took a look around to try to find the bartender Marc noticed something. Something that sent a shiver down his spine.

'Wait... Where are the other customers?'

Marc hadn't noticed until now that a huge space had opened up between him and Avery and the rest of the club. The closest dancers were several car lengths away. The bar was completely deserted, like some radioactive wasteland where no one dared to tread. Every now and then someone would look over to where he and Avery were sitting and would take a few nervous steps away. Or shake their head sadly at Marc as if he was a dead man walking.

"Where the hell is Rosa?" Avery grumbled. "You got a payin' cushtomer here who's THIRSTY!"

'Oh shit. Maybe I should've paid more attention to the others' warnings.'

"Oh Rosa!" Avery called in a singsong voice. "ROSA! ROSA! ROOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA! If you don't come back I'm just gonna start drinkin right from the tap!"

It wasn't a bluff. Avery started leaning over the counter to grab the nozzle where her beer came from when Marc stood up and gently put his hands on hers.

"Um, Ms. Avery, maybe more alcohol isn't such a good idea. I know Ms. Sapphire said she'd pay for the drinks but maybe you've... had... too... much?" Marc trailed off under the intensity of Avery's drunken gaze.

"You sayin' I don't know when enuff 's enuff?" Avery asked quietly.

"No, I'm not saying that," Marc said slowly and carefully. "It's just... you don't want to drink the entire night, do you? Why don't we do something else?"

The silence that followed felt like a lifetime to Marc. Avery had seemed so calm and easygoing. A bit overconfident, a bit competitive, but a friendly person overall. She was one of the only fighters to treat humans decently. She was practically a Saint... when she was sober. He had no idea what kind of person she was like while drunk.

What kind of drunk is Avery?

1) Party Animal: Avery becomes wild and uninhibited while drunk. Concerned with only having a good time, her hedonism and lack of restraint makes her a danger to everyone around her. Particularly to those smaller and weaker than her.

2) Angry Drunk: Avery does a complete 180 while drunk, becoming mean and abrasive to everyone. She perceives almost everything as an insult, hates being told what to do and will lash out violently as a result. In effect, she becomes exactly the kind of anthro Marc lives in terror of.

1153322.title: She's too busy, so she's not here

11533221.content:
Marc gulped as he took in the door before him. He looked down at the piece of paper assigning him to his new owner, then looked back at the door with the large number on it. There was no mistaking it. This was the home of his new mistress.

Bast.

The name was familiar. He'd heard that she was undefeated, but not much else. The ASL had so many fighters and it's not like his job gave Marc a lot of time to search the internet or catch up on the news. As a servant, he was at his mistress's beck-and-call twenty-four-seven. Any free time he got to himself he was usually so exhausted after narrowly surviving his day's work that he'd just plop into bed. No one could fault him for not having an encyclopedic knowledge of every person in the ASL... well, no one could reasonably fault him, but that hadn't stopped a few of his previous owners puffed up on their own hype to feel insulted when Marc hadn't recognized them immediately. Punishment usually followed. Luckily, these fighters tended to overestimate themselves and found themselves on the unlucky end of a Survival Match before too long.

This was different though. This was a Gold Division Fighter. And not just any fighter, but one who, if the size of her door was any indication, must've been ten times his size! The towering golden door was sixty-feet high and looked like the gate to some secret paradise. For its owner, no doubt it was. For Marc, that remained to be seen.

He'd never been "owned" by a fighter big enough to easily rampage through a human city before. He'd had to watch his step around anthros who were "just" ten-feet-tall in case they accidentally squished him. This'd be even harder now that he was roughly the size of a bug compared to his new mistress.

"I can't believe they let anthros this big fight. Where do they get the money?" Marc wondered out loud. Though if he put much thought into the logic of anything that went on around here, he knew it wouldn't hold up to scrutiny. He'd just accepted that the world was crazy and he had no choice but to live in it.

There was a small door set in the larger one, a roughly human-sized one in the shape of a pyramid. It almost looked like a cat flap. There was no knob on it so Marc knocked. It sprang open soundlessly at his touch.

"Ugh, not even a minute in and it starts with the foreboding," Marc grumbled. "It's not like someone this tall needs to try to be intimidating." He was hoping to get all of his annoyed sarcasm out of his system now, before meeting Bast. His mouth had gotten him into trouble before, and more than once he'd only survived by the skin of his teeth when prodding a new owner too far. He was hoping Bast's size alone would be enough incentive to keep his mouth shut, but sometimes it felt like his mouth had a mind of its own.

"Hello," Marc called. "Ms. Bast? It's Marc Youngblood, your new human... Are you here?" There was no answer. "Can I come inside?" Still no answer. "If yes, say absolutely nothing and give no sign of life." Marc cringed at his own words but still no one answered. He wondered if someone that tall could even hear him at his size. "Screw it, let's get this over with," Marc said and walked inside.

The inside of Bast's home was as opulent as Marc imagined. A living room built to accommodate someone the size of a kaiju, all in gold and black with an Egyptian theme. There was no TV, but that was no surprise since shelves of books lined the walls. Bast was obviously a big reader. Maybe an academic? What surprised Marc more, however, was that there were several sets of furniture, all at varying sizes, at various points in the room. Most sets of furniture were big enough for several of his old mistresses, but other sets had been clearly built for humans. It looked like Bast might be an accommodating host after all.

"So you're the new boy, are you?" a husky, droll voice asked.

Marc was so startled that he nearly jumped out of his skin. The voice had seemingly come from nowhere. He looked around the room but there was no sign of a fifty-foot anthro anywhere. How could she be hard to miss?

"The last human they sent me was ever so dull," the voice continued. "I wonder if he'd been dropped on his head at some point. I gave him oh-so-many chances to change my opinion of him. He was nice but just... so... slow... It was almost a relief when I stepped on him yesterday. It was an accident, of course, but he should've been watching where I was going. It did have the good fortune to be lunchtime when it happened, and, well, waste not..."

The more she talked, the more creeped out Marc became. He didn't know if it was better or worse that she hadn't intended to kill her last human what with the casual way she talked about it.

"I'll... I'll be quicker than him," Marc said.

"Hmph. We'll see. Now come closer so I can have a better look at you."

Marc felt embarrassed that he still had no idea where she was, especially after he'd just told her he'd be smarter.

"I... I can't see you," he admitted.

"Hmmmmm," she said, unimpressed. "I hope you have a keener mind than eye, boy. I'm right here. Yoo-hoo!"

There was a flicker of motion and Marc finally spotted something on top of the red, leather couch that took up the majority of the room. A sphinx. Even though the couch was built for someone colossal, the anthro lounging upon it was the size of a housecat in comparison. She waved at him with one paw, while holding a book in the other. Marc was struck with her beauty the moment he saw her. She may have some animal attributes, but her face and torso was undeniably that of a human woman. How long had it been since Marc had come in contact with someone that even remotely reminded him of his own species? Months?

"Cat got your tongue," Bast asked dryly. Marc blushed and shut his gaping mouth. He realized she must get attention like this all the time from humans.

"Get it together, Youngblood," Marc thought to himself. "She may look human but she just admitted to squishing and eating her last slave! You could be next if your not careful."

"I'm sorry," Marc said, trying to recover, "I was just expecting someone taller."

"Oh? This tall, perhaps?" And without another word her form began to grow. Suddenly the various sets of furniture in different sizes made more sense. Marc watched in fascination and horror as the sphinx went from the size of a lion to the titaness he'd expected. By the time she was done growing she easily filled up the couch. Marc was so surprised at the display, he didn't realize she was reaching for him until her paw was practically upon him. He gave out a frightened squeak and turned to run, but was snatched up in an instant. Marc flailed as she brought him up to the amber slits that were her eyes. She worked him between each furry finger like a coin, inspecting him with obvious contempt. "I thought you said you'd be quicker than the other one," she said. "If this is your idea of quickness, I suggest you pick up the pace."

"Now wait just a minute," Marc said. "It's not like this is an everyday occurrence for me! You can't expect me to just--"

"What do you put in a barrel to make it lighter?"

Marc blinked. "What?"

Bast gave a long-suffering sigh, as if he was the stupidest thing to ever crawl out of the primordial soup. "You say you're quick," Bast said as if talking to an utter imbecile, "I'm giving you a chance to prove it. Answer my riddle. What do you put in a barrel to make it lighter?"

Marc knew the answer was a hole, but the way she spoke to him made him so angry that his mouth moved before he could stop himself. "A man?" he suggested sarcastically.

Bast's eyes narrowed. "If there's one thing that annoys me more than idiots, it's fools. Idiots at least can't help themselves. I put up with my last slave far past the point of reason because he at least tried. Now, your time with me can be a very painful experience or a tolerable one. I have had slaves in the past who survived their time with me until their contract expired and they could go home. I'm still in correspondence with some of the more clever ones. The ones who angered me, however? They had a very different experience. Now, if you have a modicum of intelligence, I suggest you take my next riddle seriously."

"Fine," Marc snapped, "I will."

"Good," Bast said. "We hurt without moving. We poison without touching. We bear the truth and the lies. We are not to be judged by our size. What am I?"

A long stretch of silence went on as Bast waited.

"Well?"

"... could you repeat it?"

Bast groaned loudly. "We... hurt... without... moving," Bast said slowly and loudly. "We poison without touching... We bear the truth and the lies. We are not to be judged by our size... What... am... I?"

Marc listened to the whole thing growing redder and redder in the face, angered and embarrassed to be treated this way. A giantess or not, who the hell did she think she was treating him this way? He'd figured out the answer to her stupid riddle but why should he give her the satisfaction of playing her game? He didn't need to impress her. She was just another bully, the same kind he'd been dealing with ever since he'd been roped in the ASL. Already he was preparing his insult. "Easy," the rational part of his mind said. "Be the bigger person. The answer is Words. Just give her the answer she wants."

"Well?" Bast snapped. "What am I?!"

Marc's temper flared. He opened his mouth and answered...

115332211.content:
“Words!” Marc called out, just barely keeping the frustrated anger out of his voice. “The answer is words!”

Bast stared at him, stonily, giving away nothing as to what she thought. However, she gave him a nod.

“Correct. Good to see that something is rattling around that tiny head of yours.” She commented, idly. “But anyone get something right at least once. Show me that your flash of insight isn’t just a fluke.”

Marc took a deep breath, doing his best to allow his anger to drain out with it. He gave her a nod in acknowledgment, his gaze never leaving Bast’s.

‘Of course. Nothing’s ever that easy...’ Marc inwardly sighed. At least, he’d be prepared this time.

“Only one color, but not one size. Stuck at the bottom, yet easily flies. Present in sun, but not in rain. Doing no harm, and feeling no pain. What is it?” Bast intoned.

Marc took a second to think. “A shadow.”

Once again, Bast nodded. “True. Who is that with a neck and no head, two arms and no hands? What is it?”

“A shirt.”

“What word starts with E and ends with E but only has one letter in it?”

“An envelope.”

“Good, good. You see a boat filled with people. You look again, but this time you don’t see a single person on the boat. Why?”

“The boat hasn’t sunk. It’s just that everyone on it is married.”

And so it went. Bast asked a riddle, Marc answered. He couldn't have said how long it went on. Half an hour. One hour? Two? He had no clue. What he did know, was that he didn’t get a single on of Bast’s riddles wrong. Some had forced him to rack his brain for a second or three. Others, he’d known since childhood. Some, he just winged! But in the end, he got them all and all throughout, his gaze never left Bast’s, who returned the stare.

If he was being honest, Marc felt surprisingly liberated by the whole experience. Oh, he never forgot that he was being judged. The mere thought almost set his teeth on edge. However, this was the closest he’d come to something mentally stimulating in quite sometime. He’d gotten used to the rather straightforward routine of being abused by the his ‘betters’ and really hadn’t gotten much in the way of conversation. Not that any of those self-obsessed prima donnas had anything worth talking about, but still. Even as Bast drilled him, he felt quite more energized as he continued to rise to every challenge she set.

As he stared into Bast’s eyes, he swore he saw a flicker of emotion. Just a little. But what was it?
115332211.title: Words!

1153322114.content:
The flicker of emotion in her eyes was one Mark thought he recognized. He identified it so quickly because he'd felt something similar when he'd first laid eyes on Bast's beautiful human features.

'Was that... attraction?'

Before he could know for sure, the sphinx broke eye contact. "Impressive," she said softly. "You got every single riddle correct. None of my previous servants have ever managed to do that before. The smartest one only got 75% correct... some of those riddles stumped even some of my fellow sphinxes. I'll confess... I had not expected you to be so intelligent." Her eyes met Marc's again and this time a slight blush came to her cheeks. She quickly looked away, staring at nothing in particular, a slight frown on her face. "For a human, I mean."

She said it haughtily, trying to downplay it, but she couldn't hide what she was feeling from Marc. She was tugging at her collar, like the room was getting too hot for her, and she was fidgeting in her seat. All the signs were clear. She was attracted to him!

"Brainteasers for the win," Marc murmured idly.

"What?"

"Nothing!" Marc said quickly. A long, awkward silence followed.

Truthfully, he had no idea how to feel about this. She was brilliant, which was a turn-on for Marc... but also arrogant. She looked down on idiots and he'd had to prove himself before she'd even deigned to give him the slightest compliment. That attitude coupled with his own temper could prove a bad combination. Although... Marc couldn't deny how beautiful she was. He'd noticed it from the second he saw her, and the fact that she looked human was definitely a bonus. But no matter her looks, she wasn't human. In addition to her lioness traits and size-changing abilities, she thought like an anthro. She'd confessed to casually stepping on and eating her last human and had threatened him when he'd shown defiance.

'Plus she's my boss,' Marc reminded himself as an afterthought. Office relationships had always been a minefield for him, and that was back when his partners couldn't make themselves the size of a mountain when they were ticked off at him. 'This whole situation has the potential to blow up in my face,' Marc thought, feeling a little hot under the collar himself. 'Maybe I should've gotten some of her questions wrong on purpose.'

"Ahem."

Marc was brought out of his thoughts by the sound of Bast clearing her throat.

"Now that the riddle of your intelligence has been solved," she said, "I have a list of chores prepared for you to do for your first day." Bast reached into her pocket with her other paw and pulled out a folded sheet of paper. But she didn't open it. She was eying Marc up, one fang biting her lower lip. "But... since you've proven how smart you are..."

Marc smiled at the sphinx and her hesitation. 'Hey, this might be a good thing after all! This little crush might get me out of being treated like a slave for once!'

Does it?

1) Yes: Bast is open with her affection and treats Marc more like a professional assistant than a common servant.

2) No: Bast is a total tsundere in denial of her attraction to a mere human. She hides her feelings for Marc by working him even harder as a slave.
