11533221141.content:
If someone had told Marc that he'd eventually meet a fighter who wouldn't treat him like dirt, he'd would have laughed in their face without a regret. Now, however...

Ever since he had utterly blown Bast's expectations out of the water, things had proceeded rather smoothly. Marc had been given his own apartment within Bast's quarters. It was...rather nice. A small but cozy and private place. It had a living room, a bathroom with a tub, kitchen and bedroom. It was rather spartan, what with the last occupants things thrown out. His new apartment may not have been the highest standard of living like Bast's own dwelling but it was nice and a definite step up.

Marc's things had been moved in immediately, along with a series of nice collared shirts bearing a stylized Eye of Horus. As Bast's servant, it was her own way of marking him and letting others know just who he served. On some level, Marc figured that he should have been insulted, what with being claimed like property. Yet, the way Bast had gone about it made him feel more like an employee. Seriously, as far claiming went, Marc was perfectly fine with wearing nice shirts. Better that than being sat on or forced to wear a dog collar tied to a leash.

As for Bast, herself, she was a serious but reasonable mistress. She didn't have him do things like her laundry or order her food. No, Bast was far more practical than that. Her first order of business was to have him review videos of some of her old matches. She wanted him to observe and take notes which she would then review. Marc had done what she asked without complaint. Truth be told, he was curious as to Bast's behavior in the ring.

What he had seen had been amazing.

Bast wasn't just capable of altering her size. She could alter her body's proportions and ratio of fat and muscle. He had seen her shrink herself in the middle of a fight to avoid a hit, only to retaliate by suddenly overloading her arms with muscle and striking back with a blow powerful enough to knock her opponent out. Or take to the air above her foe, expand herself with fat and then dive in on them like a wrecking ball. Every video he watched, Marc got to see something different and all the while he took notes. He'd gotten to see quite a few different kind of fighters at the ASL, but none of them were on the level that Bast was displaying. Not just her size changing but how she used it. She didn't repeat maneuvers or tactics, seemingly on purpose. Marc figured that she didn't wish to become predictable, so she went out of her way to become predictable. He also noticed that Bast didn't like to meet opponents on their terms. If she was fighting an extremely large foe, she tended to keep herself smaller as to make them work at getting her or if the opponent was small, she assumed a larger form and used it to dictate the nature of the fight. These were just a handful of the things he noticed and jotted down.

Marc had been so engrossed in the viewing and his own note taking that he never noticed Bast, shrunk down to the size of a normal lion, come up behind him. He never noticed her seat herself behind him. He never noticed her presence as she peered over his shoulder to see what he was writing. He most certainly never noticed the smile she gave him after reading over his detailed observations. He absolutely did not notice as she slowly had her form expand with fat, becoming bigger and softer.

What he finally did notice was when leaned back and met Bast's soft furred girth. Marc snapped around in surprise, eyes wide. He was now leaning on Bast's expanded belly with the sphinx curled around him, her face bearing a large smile that revealed her fangs. She looked utterly amused.

"O-Oh, hi there, milady." Marc stuttered out. "Can I-I help you with anything?"

"No, no." Bast gave a small giggle. "I've just been watching you work for a while now and thought that you might need something soft to lay against. Besides you seem very taken with ability to change my body. I thought you might enjoy seeing it first hand."

Marc composed himself. "Well, yeah. Definitely. It's amazing. All the avenues of attack, defense or avoidance...it's just something I haven't seen since I came here."

Bast nodded, her chest puffing out in pride. "It is an ability that I've spent a long time cultivating. That said..."

Never was losing a mistress a complete victory for Marc. Yes, there was some admittedly cruel satisfaction to be had in witnessing another bitchy diva he’d spent weeks slaving after get dragged kicking and screaming to a slow death in another fighter’s belly, but then came the power vacuum for another evil, possibly an even worse one to stomp in to take the mantle as his caretaker, and the prospect of being the next slave for the likes of Dominique or Gloria Gator was allowed to step up as an actual threat.

At least there was always the note to look forward to, that machine-produced strip of paper that would lay down his next mistress’ name with promises of fun and excitement taped on top of the thrashings that’d be in store for him. Not enough to totally quell over his fears, but to at least give him a remote sense of closure. No slip was there for him that day, taking away from him that cruel relief. In its place two figures known well by the staff, carrying something that shook up his already unsteady emotions.

“Ah, Mister Youngblood, hello! I take you’re ready for your next mistress?”

Smiles.

“Mister Talon.” Marc greeted, giving the prim-dressed velociraptor a stiff nod that he repeated for the figure to his side, a business-y cat woman of equal size and stature. “Miss Pierce.”

Sure, Dante Talon smiled all the time. As did car salesman when they were squeezing extra payment for a van with no seat belts, but as often as Nicole Pierce appeared to keep up to date on Marc’s job performance, he had never, ever seen her smile before. The closest was when her mother had been reinstated to the ASL, but it was just a half-hidden smirk then, hiding her joy from the reporters so Mommy could eat up the limelight once more. Here before him was a warm grin that seemed like she was catching up with a dear friend of hers, something she’d made sure to be clear Marc would find rare to make in the facility.

“Sorry about the lack of your slip, but we had news for you that had to be spoken of in person.” Miss Pierce elaborated, aware of the edge Marc was on, but made no effort to give him total answers.

“I take it my contract’s been shredded by accident, and I can go?” Came the monkeys-on-typewriter’s fantasy Marc had always pined for.

A round of laughter came from the two, conspicuously not the smack on the head with a tail for joking about losing his occupation. “Even better!” Miss Pierce insisted. “You’ve been assigned to Avery Etherglades!”

Not a deal to take for granted. A tough fighter who never took survival matches, very unlikely to see die, but known to be amiable with her servants. But all said, “why would you guys be here to tell me, instead of the note?”

“Printing malfunction.” Their voices blended in harmony their bodies flexing in tandem to step aside and offer Marc to be lead. “Shall we?” Dante offered.

“Alright, how about first I”

“Splendid!” Dante intruded, mirroring Nicole’s movements in stooping down to take Marc by the shoulders, whose feet briefly jittered to keep up as he was forced to march off to his mistress’ division.


.....



“Alright, what the hell is going on here?!”

Despite standing right in front of “Avery’s” room, Marc was still in the dark as to who he was being assigned to. Instead of her residence in the gold division, it was the white-walled corridors of the silver, at a room whose number was scratched off, unidentifiable outside of a multitude of locks keeping it shut. Not uncommon, considering how paranoid many fighters were for spies, but not the least bit comforting to Marc and all his questions.

The two superiors at last quit the cheery act, Dante turning the other way as Nicole stood next to the door’s locks, laying a hand against the wall in thought, but Marc sought his own answers and gave a running start to leap up to the keyhole. His fingers hooked onto its rim, enough to pull himself upwards to peer inside, and he saw...red. A solid field of red with no room to look into, no sound inside to determine its owners movements, or even air blowing back in his face.

Marc let himself fall, marching up to Dante’s legs. “Listen, I know I’m nothing but toilet paper to you guys, but you could at least stop lying to me and just get on with...”

Then Dante turned around. Marc flinched, observing his boss’ new expression with equal shock, but then it all added up upon realizing a superior was giving him something to fear far more than a smile.

Guilt.

“...no.”

Marc’s single plea was heard by the rapid-fire of the door’s locks being unlatched, his head spinning over to see Miss pierce unlocking them with frantic eyes. When Dante saw the distraction and dove to snatchuyjh- him off the floor, Marc lost whatever will towards his contract he had left and bit his boss in the arms, legs flailing to catch a few good blows at his kneecaps, but only ached his teeth at the scales under his suit’s sleeve.

“Sorry, kid.” Dante listed in a low voice. “It’s just the job.”

“Mister Talon, for the love of god, just give me to Dominique!” Marc squealed, his screams inviting a few doors in the hallway to crack open. Upon seeing that it was a human to be tossed into his next mistress’ room, most just slinked back into their rooms, but the rest kept their heads poked out of their doorways when they saw to whose he was being transferred, some in curiosity, some in pity. “Hell, give me to Gloria! Pearl, Sapphire, Roxanne, Carly, Crumpet, Sasha, ANYBODY BUT INDRID!!!”

It was with a final click that Nicole yanked the door open, leaving intact a chain that prevented it from being opened farther than needed for a human to be tossed in, and Dante came through and lobbed Marc into the dark room, the two only assuring he’d landed in entirely before slamming it shut.

Wide, spanning shoulders addled with paunch and bulk hoisted a bosom putting immense pressure on the very crux of her shirt, her breasts billowing outwards beyond the limits of what her pillowy arms could extend to, but both were merely the mushroom’s cap to everything from the chest down, her predominate immensity avalanching past her bustling from below and onto the floor in her stomach, a spheric mass of chitin expanded to such ludicrous proportions that even standing still couldn’t be done without the all-encompassing distance of floorboards it coated erupting into loud flexing sounds under its indomitable weight, as her legs, as cumbersome as they were, sat obscured from behind save for the very slivers of either hip, too little in such little light for him to tell if her lower half was clothed, or even if she was wearing any underwear.

Again, while at a size advantage where she’d be able to bloodily end his life with an act no harder than pushing a pinkie finger through his chest...progress. She was a being of flesh and blood, not some cosmic monstrosity of some different realm, which meant she could be studied and understood. Perhaps, if given a heavy dosage of optimism, reasoned with.

“So...you’re Indrid.” Marc jabbed his fingernails in his own palm, the pain preventing him from letting a ‘duh’ spill out by accident. “My name’s Ma-“

“...Marcus...Waldreignewizch...Youngblood.”

Indrid’s antennae twitched, sensing the initial spark of fear she’d earned out of Marc. That damn middle name...the one that had subjected him to so many mispronunciations and teasing that he’d sworn it off by middle school, writing it as a shameful “W” unless he absolutely had to, never saying it outright.

Indrid not only knew every letter by heart, but pronounced it as well as his own grandparents would.

“You’ve...you’ve read my application, then?” He insisted. Maybe to Indrid, maybe to himself, maybe to the hands of fate who’d dealt him this hand to begin with, who were no doubt still laughing their asses off. “That’s mighty kind of you t-“

“...Born under June and Miles Youngblood.” She prattled on. “Latter died when you were age four. Earliest...only memory of him the county fair, riding the roller coaster with him.”

Her antennae twitched again, but she was able to see the terror firsthand as Marc curled up into a ball with his back to the door, inching towards the corner to achieve what little distance from the titanic moth it could supply him. “H...How did...”

Indrid’s eyes honed in on him, thirsty for the sweet, tangy fear that he carried, and she stepped forward, entering the same patch of shadow that Marc resided in. Her wings fluttered open and flared over her back, blocking off more of the light, and with less of her form to see, her motions seemed all the more liquid as she approached him like the darkness trapped in the most repressed part of his mind were leaking out and entering the room in a tidal wave of sapient abyss.

“Y-You know what?” Marc reasoned, willing to cut his losses to get out of hearing Indrid ramble off his childhood memories. “You want me to fear you? Fine. I’m scared. Hell, you want me to piss my pants? I can just...”

Indrid instead rolled forward against her own belly so she could shove her head right into the air he was breathing, more of the bulb’s light vanishing behind her titanic butt. He skittered into the corner, with Indrid following suit so he couldn’t increase the gap between him and her eyes, no further than what allowed him to see his own reflection in them. He was more gaunt, maybe just as terrified as what he was staring back at, but maybe not as distorted as her eyes made him out to be, his eyes rolling back and jaw twisted around as the corpse to one who was literally scared to death would be.

Just enough to keep him from reacting too early to a fatty, three-fingered hand to enter the red glow and snap around his neck. Her thumb prodded onto his windpipe, keeping him plenty silent as she opened her maw and lulled her tongue out, a fat, oil-slick black tentacle that painted his face with saliva, eyes flittering in the first traces of emotion he could feel off her as she relished in his strangled attempts to scream, the squirming under her thumb to release the pressure binding him to the wall.

“Fear...’ She observed aloud, inviting her tongue back so she could stare at him with perhaps the only other emotion he thought she could feel: hunger. “Need...more...”


Choice 1: Indrid goes for all the physical fears. Crushing, squashing, all that phun stuff.

Choice 2: Indrid casts her magic, resorting to more otherworldly means to extract fear from Marc!

Choice 3: Indrid forces Marc to watch bad movies, or some other spoofy route.

Choice 4: Whatever worse things you can come up with.
1233411.title: “Y’all got any uhhhh...feär?”

12334111.content:
Marc beat his hands futilely at Indrid's fat hand. She'd been holding him by his throat for nearly a minute and he hadn't even been able to take a breath before she seized him. His struggles were useless. Not only was she at a level of strength he couldn't hope to reach in his lifetime, but from the way her antennae twitched, he was positive his fear was just more fuel for her. He'd stop if he could but his reaction was involuntary. It was animal instinct, something humans had been unable to break free of no matter how much they thought they were different from anthros.

As he struggled, the oil-black tongue ran over his face again and again, sampling him like a lollipop. Marc was too terrified to even be disgusted. His vision was almost gone when the tongue retreated suddenly and something like disappointment registered in her hellish red eyes. Only now did it seem to dawn on her that whatever fear she was busy slurping down off him like a milkshake was running low as the life left his body. She released her hold on his neck and Marc was finally able to take a deep breath. He'd been so convinced he'd been about to meet his loved ones at the pearly gates that he felt a wave of relief wash over him as he realized he wouldn't be shuffling off his mortal coil quite yet.

That was the good news. The bad news was that relief was the opposite of what Indred wanted to get from him. She stood to her full height and lifted him by the scruff of his shirt so that his face was still inches from hers. She sniffed.

"Need... more... fear," she whispered.

"I'm afraid!" Marc choked out, gasping for air, his heart rate starting to go up again in dread anticipation of what would happen next. "I swear I'm afraid! I'm the fraidiest human you'll ever see, I swear!"

Indred gave no sign she was listening to him. Guess she only cared what her food felt, not what it said. Her antennae gave another twitch and Marc knew what that meant. He tried not to think of anything as she delved into his mind, but he suspected it had no impact on her telepathic abilities.

"Six years ago..." she said. "You were on the bus to visit your great-aunt... A man was sleeping in the seat across from you..."

No, not that! Marc thought, the memory coming back to him as she spoke.

The bus was for humans and anthros. A mammoth woman had boarded. She was one of the fattest anthros Marc had ever seen. She had massive headphones on over her massive ears, and was singing along badly to the crappy pop music she was listening to. She didn't see the man who'd slumped down asleep in his seat. She didn't hear Marc as he yelled to stop her.

"Ooh, baby, we've got a bond no one can sever! You'll see boy, you belong to me forever!" the mammoth sang horribly...

She sat down and the man vanished. Marc leapt to his feet and pulled on her arm, trying to get her to get up, like a little kid trying to get an adult's attention. The mammoth woman opened an eye at his touch and gave him an annoyed look. She still couldn't hear him over the music. The exact science of human durability was still being researched in this crazy world of giant, humanoid animals living alongside humans. Some humans could take extreme amounts of punishment without breaking. Others...

CRUNCH!

The mammoth sank a few inches down into her seat, as if the chair had collapsed inward, then leapt to her feet.

"EW!" she shrieked. "Who left something wet in my seat?"

"His body," Indred said in the present. "So red... pulverized... face twisted in pain. The first human you'd ever seen crushed--"

"SHUT UP!" Marc screamed. "JUST SHUT UP! I DON'T WANT TO HEAR ANYMORE!"

"Yessssssssssss," Indred hissed, antennae twitching again. "Won't hear anymore. Actions, speak louder, after all..."

"No," Marc whimpered. "Please, you can't--"

Indred didn't bother to respond. She carried Marc as effortlessly as a kitten. The room shook with her four footsteps, the floor groaning under the weight of her massive gut as it dragged over the floor. She approached the bed, with its rusted metal frame looking like a prime delivery system for lockjaw, its filthy mattress looking like something from a crime scene. She dropped him on it without a word. He tried to scramble off but the red eyes glowed all the brighter against the shadowy face and Marc was frozen in fear. He didn't move even as she turned around and displayed an ass the size of a small planet. Something so massive that surely he stood no chance against it.

Her ass descended. Marc screamed but when she landed the wind was knocked out of him. Only his bottom half was underneath her, pinned helpless beneath her backside. The mattress creaked under her weight, the bedframe sagging, the springs poking into Marc's back like instruments of torture from the Dark Ages. His upper half was forced up into her ass crack. The pain was excruciating. About the only mercy she gave him was that she didn't sit on him with her full-weight, her front legs still holding up some of her though her back legs hung limp. Even then, Marc knew it wasn't true mercy. It was just a way to prolong his suffering. He pushed against the wall of insect abdomen covered in grass-like fur, trying to open some space so he could wiggle free of the unbearable pain but it was impossible. As he struggled, Indred spoke softly, but he could hear her crystal-clear.

"You've often pondered what the man's final thoughts were. You hope he slept through the whole thing... but you know that's not true. He was awake just long enough to know what was happening, to feel his bones rendered to powder, to feel his flesh burst apart at the seems like a water balloon. He had enough time to scream for help that would never come. You know what's like, don't you? Screaming for help and being ignored. I heard it as your employers delivered you to me. I promise you'll know the rest of what that man felt soon enough."

As she spoke she steadily increased her weight on him, taking it off her front legs and leaning back more and more. Marc swore she was telling the truth. His legs felt like they were breaking, his stomach and chest felt like they were caving in, making it next to impossible to breath, only getting short gasps as his face dug into her fur. He knew his bones and organs must've been turning to a flat paste inside him, and as she worked her ass further and further back, they would eventually pop up out of the top of his head like someone trying to get every last bit out of a container of toothpaste.

"You'll see boy, you belong to me forever," Indred sang tunelessly.

The verse elicited another surge of fear. Marc gave another scream of pain and horror as Indred scooched back, causing him to vanish completely, his entire body devoured by her crack. Though he was completely invisible to the outside world, and far from her pitch black mouth, Indred still salivated as she savored his delicious fear. Technically she hadn't needed to lick him earlier. She fed off fear in a more abstract way. However, it was a good intimidation tact, and human flavor was still enjoyable in its own way, just as the squirms and struggles of his panicked body beneath her were similarly enjoyable, not just for the fear it elicited.

For all his panic, she hadn't broken anything inside him... yet... but it was so easy for her to go inside his mind and plant a small idea inside. The irrationality of it, his conviction that he was dying, it made his fear all the sweeter. Pain was always something she enjoyed inflicting on others, whether physical or mental, but she often found mental anguish to be more beneficial in the long-term. Why let a good source of food go to waste by breaking it too quickly? Besides, she knew how to doll out physical pain even while restraining herself. She proved it to herself by clenching her cheeks a few time, mangling Marc further and eliciting more sweet struggles and even sweeter terror.

As she gorged herself for the next hour, she also spent her time looking through his memories. It turned out Marc had seen and survived a lot in the past. This was good. Not only did it mean she could run the gauntlet in utilizing her favorite methods of torture on someone who could live through it, it also gave him such sweet phobias for her to indulge in.

She had so many choices... which should she choose next?
12334111.title: The only thing he has to fear... is everything

choices: Marc plops into Indrid’s gut, doomed to digestion.
Indrid spits him up; she’s letting him live?!
123341111.content:
True, Marc’s traumatized teen memories couldn’t cover every grisly detail of that poor bastard’s demise, but thanks to the right mix of some mental surgery, creative thinking, and free time, Indrid had an abundant enough canvas to ensure that a little bit of every nightmare that Marc’d recurred of that night was in every clenching of her asscheeks. Much the same as the ones where he was in that man’s skin, feeling his skeleton be twisted from its joints before mashing into bony spines, his innards shredding into marinara before the endorphins could save him from the incomprehensible agony that preluded death. Her antennae swayed about to conduct his memories so all the ‘could-of-dones’ and what-ifs’ he’d buried in his mind’s sewers flooded over and came to the surface, capsizing his thoughts so the rocking of the bed frame were the bumps on the road that that man innocently felt before seeing the wide, hairy face of his demise, his own wails of misery and agony distorted to split apart into the mourning sobs of the family that he’d no doubt left behind. Hell, that the mammoth lady just farted on him when he was still alive to smell it.

All of which she dealt with no satisfaction or remorse worse than shopping for her groceries. That is, sparing the ravenous pride of getting home, seating at the table with all her purchases, and downing them all in but minutes. The points of a smile poked up along the edge of Indrid’s jaw as she massaged the growing excess hanging off her middle, a pert fear-baby expanding within her belly that she drummed at with the same adoration of a mother massaging kin growing inside of her...such love that rapidly eluded her grasp as its surface was absorbed past where she could feel it, her hands pushed away from reaching in any further by the paunch that puffed outwards to take its place.

Such was the price of an all-fear diet. Nourishing, untamable addictive fear...but so short-lived in her stomach for it to fill her up before dissolving into calories to bloat her up even further, more bodily mass to feed and sustain. Those hissing breaths became damp with slobber as her cheeks obtained more volume, tainted by winces of strain as her stomach and breasts adopted further tonnage for her shoulders to lug about, the floor’s constant groaning rising to even louder roars of stress as the mass and footprint of her leviathan of a belly extended from her. There was at least that extra little squeeze of terror from Marc as her behind grew around him, the rusty bed frame flattening as its ability to contain its weight and girth were surpassed, but all that lasted in his mind afterward were the pain of the situation, but the bones to the real meat of fear.

Indrid shut her legs one last time, keeping Marc from witnessing her unleash an unintimidating belch of gas, then released her posture and enabled Marc to tumble free, alive and unbroken, but awake only in the physical sense. None of his bones were broken; important, if she wanted him to keep on giving her meals, she’d need him to have at least some integrity to know the horrors he was being inflicted by, but his limbs remained trapped in contorted mock-ups of his own crushed, bloodied remains, eyes rolled to their whites and jaw hanging crooked, ejecting an occasional husky croak. She let him lay twitching on the mattress for several minutes, his mind sampling that his limbs weren’t actually smashed beyond repair and were still able to move, gradually flexing more and more as his eyes opened and shut, softening to the natural (lack of?) light of Indrid’s apartment.

When he could finally flex his fingers, his body went limp at relief that the deaths he’d lived and relived were all a nightmare, but then curled in the fetal position, shivering. Indrid just stared ahead, content that he wouldn’t escape. The only way out was his means of entrance, locked so generously by their employers, but such was also the key to great torture; to compose great music was knowing that the silence between the notes could be just as important as the notes themselves, and farming for terror was no different in that it needed those occasional allowances for their anguish to still, giving hope for the sole purpose of snatching it away.

After a few dainty sobs were emitted from behind, Indrid cricked her head enough to observe Marc with his head wrapped in his arms, his shoulders occasionally trembling in tandem with his weeping. Swiveling her mountainous bulk around, she lay seated along the side and leaned over with an arm extended, something semblant of a comforting act that Marc understandably skittered away from when her claw tenderly lowered onto his back, but with too little fight in him to go far for her to struggle and reach him again, the hairs on her nubby digits sharp enough to cut his skin as her fingers draped onto his back, only to clamp around him and craned him off the bed.

Marc’s legs dropped from her grasp like he was a dead animal, carrying none of the morale needed to even try and inflict any pain on her, or any form of protest as he was once again brought to the tip of Indrid’s nostrilless snout, eyes glowing red light onto his body. Content by his submission, Indrid merely pointed her antennae at him to test his scent, also casting a silent spell or two to wash any germs from his body, then let him go, save for the very back of his collar that remained caught between her claw’s very tip.

Dangling him above her, Indrid pulled back and allow her head to unhinge by the mouth, her hair, face, and even eyes disappearing underneath her maw so he was only hung above a wet pit leading straight into her belly...her immediate top priority when she leafed through the very first time his mother taught him of what life could be like for a human in a world of anthros. The very fate she always swore never befell his dad whenever he asked, but couldn’t avoid saying ‘no’ without a crack in her voice.

“...d...don’t...” He sniffled, but lacked the fight to resist any further. “...please...”

SNAP

Indrid’s maw engulfed him, her lips sucking him free of the points of her claws. Her tongue lashed about against her jaw and the roof of her mouth, effectively sobering Marc up to the reality of his demise, but too slow to really strategize anything past fighting her tongue like it were an alligator, his clawing at the black appendage mollified as he was twisted around, robbing him the dignity of seeing the outside world as her throat muscles clenched and pulled him down head-first

“HELP ME!!!” He shrieked, crying as the darkness deepened past that of his closed eyes. “SOMEBODY, PLEASE HELP ME!!! I’M SORRY, MOM!!!”
123341111.title: Reader's Choice

choices: Bed Time: Indred Invades Marc's Dreams
1233411112.content:
There was no answer to his screams, no last minute reprieve from his executioner. His head was already in her throat and with another audible gulp she sent his shoulders following. Marc felt her slime-covered esophagus constrict around him and pull him down deeper. He knew Indrid was purposefully drawing it out. He'd seen anthros down fully grown men in a single gulp, and given Indrid's strength and girth, he knew she could've done the same to him easily. But she didn't want this to be easy. She wanted this to be fun. She wanted him to kick and scream and beg for mercy and Marc, hating himself, did just that. He knew he was playing right into her hands, but he would take any chance at all to survive, debase himself in any way if it meant living to see another day. If she loved fear so much, he would show her that he was the best source of it in the ASL.

Fear kept Indred fat and happy. Fear kept her strong and powerful. Fear kept her alive and well and her enemies dead and gone. But despite her preference for fear, despite her love of it, despite her ceaseless overindulgence of it, apparently that didn't mean Indred wouldn't indulge in warm blood and squirming flesh if the inclination took her. And, unfortunately for Marc, his blood was warm enough and his flesh was squirming enough to satisfy her. He felt her four claws running along her neck, gently caressing the spot where her meal had already begun its travel to its final resting place.

Another swallow and his arms were inside, free to claw at her throat to try to stop his descent, but it was just as futile as anything else he'd attempted. His hands made contact with a slimy surface and slipped off easily, unable to gain purchase. Another swallow and his torso followed. His legs were still in her mouth, kicking uselessly. Her monstrosity of a tongue reared up like a great wave and his legs began to slide further down.

"DON'T!"

Indred only had one response.

Gulp

Gravity took hold and Marc's gradual descent turned to a full-on plummet. Indred's throat conformed to his wriggling body easily. A brief fall and then he came into contact with a lake of stomach acid. He thrashed wildly before breaking through the surface. He took in a lungful of damp air. He heard the wet, squelching, pulsating sounds of Indred's innards. The liquid he soaked in was sour-smelling and tingled at his skin, already trying to break him down into basic nutrients. Darkness was all around him. Her insides were as black as night. It was like he'd been swallowed by a shadow.

The foul liquid came up to his waist. He waded his way to the slimy wall of her stomach. He pressed at it but it was taut instead of stretchy. He'd seen humans form screaming bulges from the inside of anthro guts before, but Indred's were unyielding. He wondered how many other humans had been in his situation, trapped in the stomach of an anthro that was so tough that they couldn't even make their presence known to the outside world.

"Let me out!" he screamed. "LET ME OUT!"

The words rang through the cavern of her stomach, echoing over and over again. The moth gave no answer. Maybe she couldn't hear him. Or maybe she had nothing to say to her food.

The thought brought up a fresh new wave of fear and suddenly Marc was punching at the damp walls. "Let me out! Let me out! LET ME OUT!"

"OUT... Out... out... o.u..t..."

Echoes were his only answer. The walls of Indred's stomach were as strong as flesh-covered stone and it wasn't long before he stopped punching at them, terrified he'd break his hands if he did.

"Throat," he murmured, trying to calm his pounding heart. "I can climb up through the throat."

But where was the entrance to the throat? He looked up and could see nothing. Minutes had passed and his eyes hadn't adjusted to the darkness.

"Okay," he murmured, "it's okay. It's probably in the center," he guessed, not having a passing knowledge of human anatomy, let alone anthro anatomy. "I just need to adjust to my surroundings. I'll count the steps to the other side of her stomach and grab any food I come across to make a pile to climb. Easy. Real easy."

Marc wasn't usually the type to talk to himself but he knew if he didn't hear another voice his terror would just overwhelm him again, and when dealing with Indred, that was the equivalent of putting whipped cream and a cherry on top of your head. He waded through the stomach with his arms outstretched to gather up all the food he found...

But there was no food to be found. Minutes passed sloshing through the darkness and Marc didn't come across anything else occupying his living prison. There wasn't a scrap of food, not a crumb, not even the human bones he'd been dreading to find but now prayed for. He realized that he was completely and utterly alone.

A second later he realized something else. He'd been walking in a straight line for the past ten minutes and hadn't come to the opposite end of Indred's stomach. She was obscenely obese, yes, and over 28 ft tall, but she wasn't endless! Her stomach didn't go on forever! Did it?

Marc ran. He picked up his legs and moved as fast as he could, splashing through the disgusting void, not even caring if he ran smack into the wall of her stomach just so long as he ran into something!

He tripped over his own two feet and fell into the tingling acid. He tried to get up, but only got to his knees before giving up and crying. His wails echoed through his mistress's never-ending stomach.

This was it. The end had come at last. The same end he'd always dreaded since he was young enough and smart enough to question his place in the food chain in a world where humanoid animals were the dominant species on the planet. The same end that had--

Don't think about it, Marc told himself. Indred had taken everything else from him, his dignity, his sanity, and, whether in a few hours or a few days depending on her metabolism, his life, but that was one fear he'd keep repressed. One he wouldn't force himself to contemplate.

"Marc..."

A quiet voice hissed from the depths of Indred's stomach and Marc's head snapped up. He couldn't believe it. Had someone else survived down here?

"Hello! Is anyone there?"

No answer.

"They must be weak. Who knows how long they've been down here?" Marc said desperately, praying it wasn't a hallucination. "HOLD ON! I'LL COME TO YOU!"

He began wading again through the tingling, foul-smelling stomach acid.

"Marc," the voice hissed again. It was closer now! But... it sounded different from before. He thought the speaker was a man, now he wondered if they were a woman. Either way, he didn't care, he'd take what help he could get.

"I'm here! You have no idea how glad I am to see someone el--"

"Maaaaaarrrrrrrrrrrccccccc..."

Marc froze where he stood. This was a new voice entirely. It was cold and cruel and hearing it felt like a knife was being run along his spine.

"Who's there?" Marc asked, hope curdling like week-old milk. "Answer--OW!" The tingling liquid was becoming hotter and now it burned Marc's skin. It took him a second to realize what it meant: Digestion.

"Embrace it, Marc. Join us... Join usssss..."

It wasn't just one voice speaking now, it was many voices, speaking in unison. They were louder, only a few feet away.

"Get away from me!" Marc turned and ran, the acid growing hotter around him.

"Where are you going, Marc? There's nowhere to go. You're dead, Marc. Just like us. Food for the Mistress. You'll stay here, Marc. Stay here forever."

"SHUT THE HELL UP!"

It was then the slimy "floor" dropped out from under Marc's feet and he was left flailing and thrashing in stomach acid that only grew hotter, hot enough to melt the flesh from his bones, but somehow still alive so he could drown instead. And now the voices were all around him.

"There is no rest for us, Marc. When we die, we stay within the Mistress forever. She owns us. She owns your soul, Marc. You'll stay here forever. FOREVER!"

Marc opened his mouth to scream and was pulled down into the hot depths of stomach acid, the voices still screaming in his ears even as he sank down, down, down... and then, suddenly, up.

Marc's world turned upside down and he was sent jettisoned up and out of Indred's stomach, back up through her throat and then unceremoniously hacked up on the floor amidst a puddle of black bile. Indred loomed over him, all 28 ft of her, looking only mildly interested. She wiped some drool away from her mouth, now concealed again by her flab.

Marc was shivering so badly he couldn't make words, but when he could, his voice was high and shrill. "W-w-what was that?"

"Your home," Indred said emotionlessly. "Eventually. When the taste of your fear begins to grow dull and lifeless. When your screams no longer sound like music, your squirms no longer pleasing. On that day I'll swallow you down again and you'll never come back out."

"T-t-those v-v-voices," Marc panted. "T-t-they w-w-weren't r-r-real!"

"Weren't they?" Indred asked. "The longer you feed me, the longer it'll be until you find out."

Marc didn't know what else to say. The souls of all her victims, every schmuck who'd been drafted by the ASL, every fighter she'd devoured in the ring, all the countless people she'd eaten over the course of her life. They couldn't all be trapped in there, within her stomach, digesting forever. It was impossible, wasn't it? Indred could do some magic, to be sure, but having that power over life and death, she couldn't... she couldn't!

Marc cried for a long time. Indred watched him without blinking, antennae quivering.

What next?
1233411112.title: In the Moth of Madness

12334111121.content:
...and Marc continued sobbing. Past, present, future, there was nothing in the world left for him but a few cruel happy memories to remind him that he could never say he didn’t have a choice, that Dante, Nicole, and even Indrid had no more blame, none, even, than what he had. He cried till he’d simply bled out of his ability to feel, and the vacuum was replaced by anger. The tears came to a steamy boil, and he bashed his fist at the floor, then brought his knuckles down again, again and again till even Indrid herself was interested by the show.

The peace ended by another bodily need, its presence entering and exiting her as a stray thought. “Bedtime.”

You wanna nod off, fatass, go ahead. I’ll stick with the floor. Marc so, so wanted to say aloud.

“Bedtime for both of us.” Indrid continued, and remembering her abilities, Marc could easily find some tease in her voice.

Unfolding her arm, Indrid held a palm open above Marc and introduced a spell that summoned the human into its grasp, but with such speed that Marc didn’t know if she hadn’t just used her poweres to shift all of reality but him downwards. She took deep, echoing footsteps that once again brought her and Marc to her emaciated bed, but a squashing session wasn’t on her mind as she laid down so their roles were swapped, her backside flattening the mattress into the floor while keeping Marc held against her fuzzy bosom.

Laying on top of her, the watchful eyes of his mistress scrutinizing him in wait of him to catch the sleep train, Marc had no lack of excuse to stay awake. Her lurid scent, which was much more visible up close, the glare of her line of sight, the burning of his acid-soaked skin and his joints from the near-disintegration he’d been subjected to underneath her...

...but apparently excuses held no strength to the actual need itself. All the above in account, even beneath the matted locks of her bosom’s coat, Indrid was soft. His heart new the voracious, fear-eating psychopath that’d kill him as she had so many others, but his brain knew his form lay on a soft, comfy surface and that his glands were filled with sleep juice that needed to be deployed.

Then came something else that it knew.

Hmmm-mmm...hmm hmm-mmm, mmm-mmm...

Smartly, her fingers curled about Marc, preventing him from covering his ears. That tune...Indrid shut her eyes, abandoning him to darkness that left him alone with a soothing tune that he’d been raised to know since he was a baby, when he was also learning how to breathe and love. Indrid could leap such mental hurdles to deal cold-blooded death and depravity on strangers, but hearing her spin that very same tune, almost the exact same humming her mother would do to help him sleep...

“Don’t fall asleep.” He whimpered, shivering when her fur was warm as could be.. “Don’t fall asleep.”

hmm hmm hmmmm, hmmm-mmm-mmm...

“Don’t fall asleep.”

...

“Don’t fall asleep.”

...

“Don’t fall asleep.”

123341111211.content:
Three Hours Later...



“Don’t fall asleep.”

...

“Don’t fall asleep.”

...

“Don’t fall asleep.”

“Too late.”

Indrid’s grip laid off, and Marc bounced off her prone body to freedom, or as free as his new entrapments were. Landing feet-first gave yield to a floor more rubbery and clean than Indrid’s apartment. In place of its walls were metal bars welded together in a cage, the ceiling above replaced by the marque of a fighting ring floating in the black, hypnagogic shapes that kept their world encased.

Speaking of his other, a series of heavy grunting and rolling came with his master’s attempts to reclaim her footing. Standing at full stature, Marc could notice a definite lack of height from her. Her body exactly the same as she looked in the real world, of course, still as round and imposing as normal, only now scaled down at a ‘mere’ ten feet.

“...what the hell is this?” Marc asked, observing his surroundings a second and third time.

“Training.” Indrid performed a few stretches with her legs, weaving her fingers together and cracking her knuckles. “I have my promotional match tomorrow, and I refuse to go into the ring unprepared. As such, I expect a fight out of you.”

“Really? Well, you just picked the wrong goddamned brain to sneak into.”

If it meant even worse torture would come tomorrow morning, Marc grabbed the opportunity by the neck and proceeded towards Indrid in a marathon of expert kick, flips and cartwheels that settled on him hitting the floor with both feet, hands gathering at his side as he focused his brainpower at his fingertips, throwing them ahead of himself to fire a beam of lightning at his slaver.

Indrid’s eyelash shivered at the movement of air that glanced her eye.

“I guess I should have said this was my dream space.” She corrected. “For an even match, your reflexes and agility are improved considerably, but any laws of reality out there shall apply as well.”

“Feh. Still worth it.”

Faster than what Indrid’s eye could see, Marc spun with a leg extended that delivered a swift kick to the crux of Indrid’s stomach, followed by him kicking off her abdomen, throwing a punch right at her face...

...but all he hit was a total cease in momentum that nearly broke every bone in his arm when Indrid caught his fist instead, her other arm bending at the elbow and coming down with a seismic force that shattered his limb.

Literally.

The impact registered with the sound of a vase being dropped, his eyes stinging from dozens of shrapnelized glassy bits exploding from where was once a human arm. Marc fell back onto his ass, too much shock and too little pain in him to react outside of holding his amputated stump, the jagged-porcelain like shards of his shoulder poking at his palm.

Too much and too little to react when Indrid spin onto her side, shooting out both of her legs to connect to him with her feet, obliterating his form in just as visceral a demise.

Indrid righted her incredible bulk up again, observing the various pieces and colors to her servant that’d be a century of free time and boredom to match up and repair. His brain, too, was utterly disintegrated, but his mind lay amongst the chunks like a terrified spirit, lost in a realm between life and death that tasted with such tender fear, which Indrid never refused a sample of, but no more. He was here for training, to enter her into the real fear buffet.

A snap of her claw. A few pieces jitters in place, the rest following suit as they all flew together, the glassy shatter playing in reverse and merging into a prone Marc all at once, his being springing to life and catapulting from the floor like he’d returned from a bad dream, frantic, deep breaths heaving in and out of his chest.

“Consider tonight your last of freedom.” She offered. “Punch and kick me as much as you are able, but expect a fight in turn. Mayhaps you may see some mercy when I at last enter the gold division.” At the forethought of food, Indrid’s belly cried in hunger, eyes narrowing blissfully at the image. “A realm of fear. So, so much fear, more than anyplace in the facility. Even the humans’ apartments.”

Marc spat at the floor in front of her stomach. “Sorry if my French is rusty, but that’s horseshit.”

“Oh, quite contrary, boy, it’s true.” She corrected. “Why do you think they bully your kind in an hourly basis, day by day, yet fight one another only once a month? Why do they float how little fear they show, yet feel the need to constantly?”

“Yeah? Well, what do they have to be afraid of?!” Marc snapped, pointing to the abyss surrounding the ring. “When my kind gets stomped under them like litter, what fear do they have in a place like the ASL?!”

“Me, of course. Well, me and the truth.” She offered. “The fact that all that pathetic ‘fame’ and ‘fortune’ of theirs is totally useless when they remember that they all cry, bleed, and perish as any animal can. That the last semblance of comfort and control over their lives that this world has left for them balances at a needle’s point at the end of a canyon, but a gust of air from being taken away from them.

“And tomorrow? I will win. I will promote, and their fear will be mine. Invading their dreams...hearing their screams for surrender as I bite their faces in the ring...” Indrid had no resolve to keep from licking her lips, her wings buzzing happily. “Becoming bigger. More fearsome. More to grow...” With that line of though came her grip of the dream world slackening. Her claws massaged the face of her massive stomach, but even more excess of mothy paunch pushes through the gap between her hands, more stomach fat swelling off of her to droop and smush against the floor naked. Each thought she rallied through have another surge in height, higher and higher, to her real height and beyond, but everything below continuously erupted like a volcano of chitin and blubber, fatter, rounder, wider, bigger.

Watching her explosion and her train of thought keep running, Marc saw the oncoming tidal wave of lard and ran to the bars of their cage, willing to shatter himself once again if it meant escaping through the bars, but then the tips of her fur’s hairs combed his neck.

“Bigger than this bed. Then this room. Bigger than any room. Bigger than Marlene. Big enough to EAT Marlene. Bigger than the whole FACILITY.And THEN...”

Indrid’s tangent ended at a sudden pressure on her from all sides, four metal walls squeezing her in from hip to hip, belly to back. Judging her size, towering some eighty feet and weighing some nine thousand tons, Indrid tilted her head down to observe a certain lump jammed into her very front, fighting against her with a few suffocated wriggles.

Inviting a hand out, Indrid focused once again and dislodged Marc from his confines, dangling him by the name of his shirt. “...and you will help me.”

“What if I don’t?” Marc asked in a mocking tone. “What if I just stood still, staring at my own shoelaces instead of anything as you punch me and bring me back, over and over?”

“Because if I do not win tomorrow, if I’m denied of what’s i so rightfully deserve,” Indrid carried Marc close to the center of her face. “I will need to comfort feed.”


Choice 1: Indrid bends the flow of time in the dream world. What’s really hours of sleep feels like weeks!

Choice 2: Eventually, Indrid has enough of training. Time for fun...

Choice 3: Skip to the next morning, when Indrid wakes up for her promotional match!

Choice 4: Maybe cut to the gold division’s fighters, who are quarreling over who has to be the one to fight Indrid?

Five slips of paper entered the cap.

“Alright, I’m going to draw one name.” Sapphire shook the hat about, mixing its contents. “Whomever I draw will be the one to enter the ring, no questions asked, and no ‘best two out of threes.’ Can we all agree on that?”

“Bullshit. I’ve got a few questions...”

Sapphire threw a rather sour look Crumpet’s way, the fat wolfess approaching with a leer of her own. “Since when does miss ‘I’m too good for cotton’ own a baseball cap?”

Crumpet’s desired answer came with a few sputtered honks. Grabbing Sapphire’s wrist, Crumpet accepted a few smacks and blows from the other wing in ripping the hat from Sapphire’s fingers and, as per her suspicion, tore it apart to reveal a hidden pouch.

“I knew it! It’s a goddamn magic prop! And...huh.” Crumpet shook out five extra slips from the secret pocket, examining their names. “These are all your name, Roxenne.”

At a loogie being hocked into a hand at her right, Sapphire turned her head too slow to avoid a saliva-coated claw from smacking down and smearing all around her face, and with a screeching honk shoved the infuriated dragon aside.

“Her.” Roxenne growled, staring down the flustered gander with a look as corrosive as acid. “She’s gonna be the one to fight Indrid, and I take on anybody that says otherwise.”

“How about you idiots stop wasting time bitching with one another so we can decide?” Avery snapped. “If somebody goes into the ring tomorrow, it’s gotta be fair and even! No cheatin’, no arguin’!”

“Oh? And just why does this have to be ‘fair,’ Avery?” Roxenne challenged, approaching the Roc girl with her arms folded over her chest. “It seems to me it’d be ‘fair’ if Indrid had a fighting chance tomorrow. After all, you’re the one out of us who’s never losta fight. What do you have to be scared of, taking on a silver?” Roxenne leaned in with, to Avery, the most punchable that the good creator above could make possible on his own kin. “Scared of Indrid? Scared of losing?”

Avery scowled. “I ain’t afraid of the toilet your mom got pregnant on.”

With a grimace, Roxenne thrust her forehead against Avery’s, who pushed back in matching wits in the two pushing back and forth and rubbing their imaginary bullhorns, the two snorting and staring daggers and all, but were wedged apart by a set of gold-feathered hands that yanked both out of their showdown.

“Look,” Amaya butted in. “I think we don’t have to argue that there’s plenty of guilt to go around the ASL of fighters not wanting to tussle with Indrid, so for all our sakes, why don’t we just put tonight behind us and decide before the facility does for us?”

“That’s what I’m tryin’ to do! She’s the one dunkin’ the rest of us down!” Avery accused.

“I’m not saying you’re wrong, Avery! In fact,” Honing in on a mug of pens at Avery’s desk, Amaya took five and bit a dent into the butt of one, holding all together in her fist. “We’ll draw straws. Whoever gets the bite mark is the fighter. Okay?”

A nod from Avery. Amaya met eyes with Roxenne, who gave a delayed, rather stiff one herself, but when Amaya went through and took the end of a pen herself, a gold-furred paw delayed the vote again by smacking the pens from her wing.

“Nuh-uh.” Crumpet added. “That’s not how it work. The person with the straws let’s everybody else take one.”

“What’re you talking about?! It’s drawing straws! That’s exactly how it works!!!”

“The person with the straws let’s everybody else take one first, then they take whichever one is left for them! That’s how I always did it!”

“You know what? Fine. You win. Everybody else takes one.” Amaya pinched the bridge of her beak, the night bringing her to genuinely question whether making it in the ASL was worth it.

“Guys, come on, you aren’t thinking long term!” Roxenne snapped again, thrusting a thumb over at Avery. “If we send in somebody who isn’t all stars and they lose, then we’re all gonna have to fight her at some point! Send her over!”

“C’mon, just a few seconds ago you were threatenin’ Sapphire! You don’t care If it’s me! All you care is you not gettin’ in there! Why don’t you fight her?!”

“No, you fight her!”

“You fight her!”

“YOU FIGHT HER!!!”

“YOU FIGHT HER!!!”

BANG!!!

Everybody jolted at the noise from the door, all looking at the walls in surprise, but Avery, most notable, looked to her right tilted her head in mild annoyance. Massaging her eyelids, she broke from the huddle and went to the door, huffing our a sigh before pulling it open in regret.

“Hey, Claudine.”

Claudine’s lardy cheeks were puffed further in anger, still dressed in her nightly blouse with curlers spun into her hair, more pleased for Avery to brine in the awkward silence under her piercing gaze than chew her out.

Avery feared being the one to talk first, but Claudine apparently had enough mercy to focus instead at a certain black, blobby behemoth sloshing about to her left.

“Pearl, dear, may I ask you of something?”

Stopping mid-step, the blubber-bloated sea mammal was in the midst of hauling her next ‘lifetime-supply’ of cheeseburgers to her den, one caught wrapper and all in between her sharp teeth. “...hunh?”

“I’ve got Avery, Sapphire, Roxenne, Amaya And Crumpet in this room together. Would you do me a favor and mention one of their names aloud?”

Pearl swallowed the wrapped cheeseburger, brain weighing the claims of Claudine’s request...

12334113.content:
Whatever more Indred had in store for him, Marc didn't want any part of it. Unfortunately, given the sheer size and strength difference between him and his macabre, monolithic moth mistress, he had no means of resistance beyond the standard begging, flailing, and--though he would've denied it--weeping. It made no difference in the end. Indred just dragged him to an old, tattered chair in the center of the room. It was big enough for an anthro, but two metal, human-sized restraints had been built into the arms of the chair. He wondered how he could've possibly missed a chair so large during his initial inspection of the room, but that thought had to wait as Indred dropped him down onto the cushion causing a cloud of dust to engulf him. He coughed on the stale, dirty air. As such, he was too off guard to stop his mistress from locking one of his wrists into one restraint, then another into the other. The end result was that his arms were stretched uncomfortably up into the air and now he was fully trapped.

Now that he was completely at her mercy--ok, well, technically he'd always been completely at her mercy, but now he was even moreso--he expected his torments to truly begin. Indred stood over him, red eyes glowing. Marc's lower lip quivered. He knew what was about to happen next. It didn't take a rocket scientist to figure out the only reason she would secure him to a chair was so that she could sit on him. But with his arms already straining and her incredible weight, he was terrified his arms would just pop out of their sockets.

"Yesssss," Indred said with quiet relish. "The anticipation, the dread, the knowledge of the suffering that awaits you. A satisfactory appetizer of fear... but now I'll dig into the main course."

Marc shut his eyes. He couldn't bare to look! He just waited for the crushing pain to begin... and waited... and waited... and waited one last time until he finally cracked open an eye to peak at what was taking so long. Sure enough the sight of Indred's massive backside took up the whole of his vision, but she didn't lower it on him. Instead she was fiddling with something Marc couldn't see. He saw her raise her fist and bang on something. Was it some horrible instrument of torture that had been used so often it needed repair?!

"C'mon, stupid thing," she hissed. "Damn thing never works." BANG! BANG! BANG! "AH-HA! GOTCHA!"

Indred straightened and turned to give Marc her full attention, revealing what'd been hidden behind her... a television with rabbit ears hooked up to a VCR still flashing 12:00.

Alright, Marc thought, I'm not insane. That TV was definitely not here before. Where is she getting these things? What is she, magic? As soon as Marc thought it he shuddered. He didn't need any more reasons to fear her.

"That's right, human. Shiver in fear. What you're about to witness will chill you to the bone. Madness will be the only escape from your horror, but I'll make sure it never comes. Behold... true... FEAR!"

Here it was, the torture he'd been dreading was now before him! What did she have on tape? Home movies about the grisly tortures and murders she'd committed?! The fighters she'd devoured in the ring? The monstrous fates of all those hapless human servants who'd entered her abode never to return?!

Marc shut his eyes but Indred moved behind him and forced them open with her claws.

"No, little slave, it's show time."

"HELP ME!" Marc screamed. "SOMEBODY HEEEEEEEEELP!"

Wha-Whaaa-WHAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA...

PPPPFFFFFFRRRRRTTTTT!

It was the sound of a cartoon trombone signaling something embarassing happening to someone, followed by the fart-like noise of a whoopie cushion. Marc's cries for help stopped.

What the hell? he thought.

The picture on the black-and-white TV showed a human man around Marc's age, only shorter, scrawnier and as skittish as a mouse at a cat conference. He was dressed in disheveled, business-man attire, working in a cubicle that looked like it'd been built for someone ten times his size. He was standing on a revolving chair in order to reach the computer on his desk. He was typing painfully slowly as he had to reach over for each key on a keyboard the size of a coffee table.

"SPLA-AAAAAAAAAAAAT!"

A loud, sing-song voice like the fat lady wearing Viking horns in an opera cut through the office, triggering a laugh track from the video. The figure typing at the keyboard looked up in terror. Suddenly the entire office floor was shaking as the heavy footsteps of something massive made its way to the tiny man's workspace.

The figure was soon revealed to be a female warthog anthro who stood 15 feet tall. Her fur was dark brown while her black hair was streaked with gray and done up in a bun. She wore a pair of red horn-rimmed glasses and a blue woman's suit and skirt. Her gut wasn't half as big as Indred's but it was still impressive to behold, and her ass was one of the biggest ever to hit the silver screen, barely being contained by her too-short skirt.

She completely took up the space occupying the cubicle's entrance, looming over the tiny, trembling human. Her hands were on her hips, and a cigarette was held in between two pink-manicured nails. Her teeth and tusks were slightly yellow from smoking. She raised her cigarette while glaring at the man before her, took a deep drag between thick red lips, then exhaled through her snout, blowing the smoke directly on human who coughed.

"I said I wanted those reports on my desk first thing in the morning, Splat. It's second thing in the morning and I still don't have them!"

The man flinched and the canned laughter of a non-existent studio audience went off again. "I-I-I t-told you, Ms. Tuskington, I wouldn't be able to get them finished on time without an assistant!"

"And didn't I assign you an assistant?" the warthog demanded.

"Well, yes, but... after you left your lunch at home you ate him instead!"

"Excuses, excuses!" Ms. Tuskington boomed after the canned laughter had died down. "I want results! And if you can't give me results, your ass belongs to me! Or rather," she said, starting to smirk.

"Oh please no," the little man gulped.

"YOUR ASS BELONGS TO MY ASS!"

Ms. Tuskington turned and plopped her ass right down on her human subordinate. The laugh track was replaced by recorded whooping and cheers as if what the warthog had just done was something inspiring and triumphant. She smiled widely as she ground her cheeks into the seat.

"Consider this your lunch hour, Splat," the warthog said just before her stomach grumbled loudly. "Oof, speaking of which. Seems your assistant isn't agreeing with me."

PPPPPFFFFFFRRRRRRRRAAAAAAAAAAATTTTTTTTTT!

The man beneath her gave out some muffled screams as the laugh track resounded once again.

Marc watched the whole thing with a dumbfounded look. This was the big torture? The new Jack Splat movie? Two and a half hours of some hapless human getting squashed and snacked on by anthro ladies? He knew that anthros loved it and humans hated it, but this hardly seemed like torture to him.

Indred mistook the look on his face. "Yessssssss," she hissed quietly. "Gaze into the abyss of horrors. Can you not feel your soul weakening with its terrifying message of how pathetic your race is?"

... Ooooooooooookay, Marc thought. So it's not like I'm looking forward to being abused or anything (if I did this ASL hellhole would be a dream job) but just showing me some crappy movies are really taking the drama out of this whole "feast on my fear" thing she's got going on. Still, might be good to play along and get out of real torture.

What happens next?

1) Marc pretends to be terrified of the terrible movie to appease Indred and maybe save himself.

2) Indred uses her magic to somehow make this lackluster comedy movie into something legitimately terrifying for Marc.

123341131.content:
In a quiet shack far off in the countryside, somewhere immune to the prying ears of city life, Jack Splat stumbled into his home, back laid on the front door.

Hoo, boy, Splatcon wasn’t fun this year. Nor was it funny. Or the answer to his courtly prayers that this year’s con would be slightly more tolerable when the months were ticking down to that one week on the calender...and yet, much like the year before, he had weathered the storm. A painful, sweaty, seven-day long storm, but as with all things in life, it had passed. He had climbed one of the many dips of fate alive enough in mind and body, ready to ride on a few highs for a while.

Looking particularly high was the living room’s armchair. He couldn’t see the TV remote anywhere, but when the only gene of softness he’d had through the week was the hundred-ton magnitude of a sadistic rhino-woman’s behind, the quiet and solace of just sitting around in the privacy of his own domain was all the noise and excitement he needed. His bag fell off his shoulder. He yanked his lanyard from his neck, tossing it recklessly into the corner of the room. He wrecked his shoes even more by stomping on their soles to pull his feet loose, maneuvering with grace and vigor past the cushy carpeting that lay between him and the leap into his favorite chair, its arms open and in wait to pull him in and enable his mind to go slack to the cruelties of the outside of world...

SMASH!!!

...then the house’s entire roof and much of the walls were disintegrated in a cloud of splinters that shredded his clothes and slashed at his skin like a swarm of angry locusts, plowed through by a white fist the size of a car that swept away the furniture and much of his home’s foundations.

In its place loomed the pale grimace of a titan of muscle and rippling adipose sheeted by pale white skin, its finned form above the waist carrying the menacing revere befitting of any other shark, but balanced atop the eight legs of a furred arachnid.

“SORRY, JACK SPLAT!” Sharknantula boomed. “BUT EVEN WHEN THE CON’S OVER, THE SPLAT DON’T END WHEN SHARKNANTULA’S IN TOWN!!!”

Jack Splat’s already-occurring screams melted into the soundscape when the echo in Sharknantula’s voice dissipated, but with a leap and aerial pirouette, Sharknantula came down with force that struck him down like an atomic bomb, the camera zooming out only to be chased by the ensuing explosion of dust and uprooted dirt, causing all to go black.

Then came the metallic riff of a guitar, the title flashing on in tune with a biting serenade of heavy metal.


JACK SPLAT 18: SHARKNANTULA’S REVENGE



Really? Two hundred and forty eight hours of getting sat on by random cameos, and Sharknantula doesn’t appear until the last two minutes? I mean, even there isn’t any plot, that’s still a pretty big middle finger to the kind of people who actually watch this shit...

Or, as Marc roughly translated from thought to speech,

“AAAAAAAAAIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIGGGGGGGGGHHHHHHH!!!!!”

Marc was no expert on human emotion. Yes, fear was something he new quite frequently when the risk of getting eaten alive followed him around so much, but feeling it was a different kind of talent than being able to fake it on command. Not even in a middle-school play had he any time to rehearse how to act, so the display he was forced to satisfy Indrid with contained plenty of screaming, sobbing, or choking on his own spit in fake seizures that put to shame some of the horrific acting she was forcing him to watch.

Not that Indrid minded, sitting on the floor with her little meal ticket’s seat nestled up against her naval, antennae leisurely kicking about as her crimson eyes watched from above in contentment. Obscure her taste in torture may have been, her eye for bad movies was certainly keen; they were certainly bad. As in really, really, really bad, the kind of writing produced by an infinite amount of monkeys being given an infinite amount of typewriters to take a shit all over, but Marc would take all the atrocious comedy he could if it meant living in Indrid’s room without being eaten or getting his mind melted by her powers. He screamed at every ‘joke’ and dimwitted character like they were videos of medieval torture and executions, and Indrid’s eyes would nonetheless twinkle at his so-called ‘fear’, feeling at her behemoth of an abdomen in satisfaction when all he felt after eighteen hours of straight binge watching was a major need to take a piss.

The VCR hit the end of the tape, and silence returned to the room. Noticing the lack of stimuli, Indrid looked to her right and snapped her claw, the needle of her gramophone moving at her command. The horn belched up more static, {x-link:https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=MzjvYa0oKMM} then let loose another string of high-pitched scatting and ukulele strumming.{x-link}

Biting his lip, Marc put out a few tears whilst sobbing with the bounce of a hillbilly’s guffawing as Indrid lumbered over to the TV to produce another video. “Puh-lee-hee-hee-hee-heeeeeeeeease, make it stop!”

Her mind was made, but Indrid made a show of selecting a tape from the VCR, swishing her finger around beforedrawing it out with flair.

“Please...” Marc blubbered. “...if you’re gonna torture me, can you at least do it without the shitty music?!”

ack

Indrid paused at a single choke in her throat, the videotape stuck midway in the slot. Her shoulders squared, her chestfur frizzled, and the already quiet mothwoman went still that the silence that followed her became but the utter loss of his ear’s ability to hear. With her arm shivering, its claw locked in an open pose, Indrid’s head swiveled in Marc’s direction.

Her jaw fallen, Indrid stared at Marc, and he had to remember to keep in that piss he was holding at the way her eyes met him. This wasn’t the empty, corpse-like way she perceived her surroundings; despite a lack of pupils for him to tell as such, she was staring right at him.

“...what did you say?” She croaked.

“I...” He started lamely, playing at the spit in his mouth with his tongue. “I was asking if you could at least turn of the stupid music?”

The lack of an obscenity didn’t dampen what Indrid had heard. The fact that anybody had the will to tie a string out of those words opened a window to her soul, inviting a cold breeze that grazed at her heart. Her jaw begin quivering in horror as her eyes stretched implausibly wide, the light shed on some dark, terrifying corners of her mind that she yearned to always dodge away from thinking on.

Was it true? Could Indrid, the goddess of fear in the ASL, know it herself?

“Did...” She peeped, pointing a shaking finger at him. “...did you just insult Tiny Tim?”

‘’...wha...?” Marc barely narrated.

Her teethy breathing intensified, heaving in and out through her gums as her lips pulled back to bare numerous (and what Marc could now see were) sharp teeth locked together in her mouth, a delirious twitch flickering in her eyes before she shook her head out, eyes furrowing in absolute fury that tendered their glow so they appeared as holes in her face that allowed the burning heat inside of her to radiate through.

She trudged up to his seat, and Marc quit his staring contest with her by putting up another pitiful attempt at prying himself free of his bindings, but Indrid snapped both of her hands down around him and tore him out from the chair instead, holding him right at the center of her face.

It wasn’t torture on her mind, neither the real kind or her mockery of it. It was a murder.

“...did you just insult Tiny Tim?” She spat onto his body. “Did. You. Just. INSULT. TINY TIM?!!?”

12334331.content:
Hello, Marc Youngblood , and welcome to the Silver Division of the Anthro Sumo League!

You are one of few with the privilege to help maintain the flow of one of the world's greatest pasttime and invigorate the spirit of our reigning champions, bringing excitement to thousands of eager fans spanning across the globe!

Your assigned champion is Matilda Dowette of chamber 549 ! We wish you a hearty welcome and hope you enjoy your experiences in the Anthro Sumo League!


“Matilda...Dowette.” Marc narrated, savoring each syllable to the name printed. Lost to any memory of such a fighter around the ASL, he couldn’t say his hopes were up, but without the bile that rose up at the image of him being a slave to the likes of Stacey or Amaya, he allowed himself to take a shot of optimism and navigated around the platinum-imbued arches of the Silver Division’s corridors with a small perk to his step, observing the number plates to each door that he passed by.

549 was a doorway no more distinguishable or decorated than all the rest along its wall, further robbing him of any clues of how hellish a mistress she may be, but Marc ignored his ritual of praying before his first step in a new boss’ door and knocked right away. No answer came, but Marc took note of the intercom next to the doorframe and buzzed in.

“Just a second, please!” Came a distracted voice from the speaker, enough words to recognize a posh Australian twang rolling off her tongue. “Yes, who is it?”

“Is there a Miss ‘Matilda Dowette’ here?” Marc asked. “I’m the new servant you called for?”

Another pause, but more brief. “Servant? Hm...I don’t recall asking for a servant. Do you have the right room number?”

“That’s five...four...nine?” He scrutinized those three numbers, checking the door itself to see if his own eyes were reading them right.

“Well...yes, that is right...” She confessed. “Listen, I’m just coming out of the shower. How about you step inside and we’ll see what’s going on?”

“Can do.”

A click from the door, and it opened without a hand from the inside to push it open, activated by an electric motor from the ceiling. Marc happily marched inside; once again, many fighter’s first acts on a new servant were one of cruelty, some harsh words to assert their dominance as long as they were under their ownership. Even anthros whose rooms he’d been sent to by accident would find some way to punish him for interrupting their private time; he’d nearly been killed when an anthro tossed a plate of food at him for interrupting her TV time.

He let his hopes rise to probably dangerous heights when he observed his and her surroundings, the door shutting behind him and locking. Whoever it was, she didn’t read like one with an ego, the most flair to her living space being some potted roses and brand-new furniture, her sense of entitlement only as large as a modest trophy case sitting at the wall. Seeing her moderate tastes, Marc channeled all the scoldings and pains he’d endured in the ASL and practiced his best puppy-dog eyes, fantasizing that if this ‘Matilda’ was as patient as she seemed, she’d renege on her ‘mistake’ and take him in.

Speaking of, when the knob to a door at the other end spun, Marc put on his straight face as it cracked open, inviting six blobby tendrils to enter and transport their owner into the room, each fattened into a doughy nub that struggled to carry her great weight so their crux had any space over the ground, but nonetheless carried an expert array of movement as each leg maneuvered about in tandem with such precision that Marc could see it taking an entire childhood to perfect, the satisfying spectacle put to music by the rhythmic clicking made by their very points touching the floor...music that was tampered by the loud dragging of an enormous mass of chitin stemming from her backside as its bottom scuffed against the ground, its adipose sprawled out with more width than its highest point, but its peak still arched high over her hairline, painted by a stripe of red skin.

Platformed atop her legs was the upper half to a much more human being, or the overinflated caricature to one whose obese stomach billowed over her front legs’ crotch, strained against the belt and front to a fluffy pink bathrobe, yet her middle balanced the sheer mass to her hyper-endowed tits, each bloated past her stomach’s size and sagging over its slope akin to a swollen set of eyelids, hitting the full strain of her clothing and opening its neck to copious white-skinned cleavage.

Any remaining humanity ended from the neck up, the nose and mouth extending and molded together in a chubby muzzle guarded by sabre-tooth fangs, an array of six eyes resting above that remained shut as she toweled the remaining dampness from cascading locks of swirling black hair. Once she was satisfied that they would dry to their luxurious waves, her eyelids opened to irises of a vibrant red. Not those of the fires of hell, but cherry cider, tart with a layer of sweetness as her lips curled into a polite smile, ready to greet her new guest with friendly words.

Then she saw Marc.

Her smile fell, the mere glimpse of a human in her stead opening a window to her soul that enabled a cool breeze to blow in and graze at her heart. Marc tried to return her earlier warmth with a grin of his own, but witnessed in discomfort her legs curl up in fear, her former graceful movements killed and switched for shivering terror. That pleasing mix of confidence and compassion to her eyes dissolved as their reached outright cartoon-y sizes on observing his two legs, his two eyes, his soft, mammalian skin and discrete, humanoid features...

“...you okay, Miss Dowette?”

pew pew

Matilda threw out both her arms, launching from her wrists two fist-sized wads of silk that struck Marc in the chest, unfurling into sheets of webbing that catapulted him back, gluing him to the main door.

“Stay where you are!!!” She barked to the plenty-trapped human. “Don’t come near me! DON’T YOU DARE COME ANYWHERE NEAR ME!!!”

Those legs that carried such articulated movements nearly tied themselves into knots as Matilda scrambled for escape into her own room, her attempts at slamming the door shut ending with ramming it on her own arachnid behind several times before pulling through in full and closing herself off, the muffled rattling of furniture following after, their weight landing on the door several times before she was fully barricaded inside.

“...hello?” Marc peeped when he had the air back in his lungs to speak, hurt, confused, but mostly too dazed to fully comprehend what’d just happened. “Miss Dowette? Anybody? Hello?”


Choice 1: Eventually, Marlene is forced to come down to Matilda’s room to pry Marc loose and get things squared away between them. (I just realized...that’s three “M’s.”)

Choice 2: Marc spends six hours glued to the wall before Matilda finally leaves her room, demanding to know what’s going on.

Choice 3: Alternate story idea. Matilda actually doesn’t mind humans all that much, yet Marc suffers from crippling Arachnophobia...

choices: He heads back to Sasha to tell her about his find.
The vent's floor breaks, and he falls down straight into Roche's room!
He crawls backwards, only to find Raina behind him in the vent, eyeing him down.
12422212.content:
"So, what was that other thing you wanted to talk about?"

"She's got a new servant working for her, and just today, too. I don't know a name or face, but I'd keep an eye on the door for when he goes out to run an errand, or something." Roche continued. "Then, sometime before her next fight, you'll get this on his body. It's nothing illegal, or anything, but she's allergic enough to it that she'll swell up like a balloon the moment he comes back in...well, even more of one."

Wait a minute, are they talking about me? Marc scooted forward more along the vent, pressing his eye on the very bottom rung of the vent's airspace.

Roche he could still see, along with only a sliver of whoever she was scheming it up with, but a sliver was all it took. On top of the body of gold standing in front of her, he could make out the pink bangs from none other than Raina, eyes fixed on a bag of something green and leafy that the duck was holding high over her head.

The coyote didn't cease raising an eyebrow as she took the bag for herself, stuffed it into her pocket, and looked back down at Roche, folding her arms. "...and you expect me to get this on him how?"
