Marc's feet slipped inside her mouth and her tongue eagerly lapped at them. He tried kicking her in the throat to make her sick, but Roxie didn't seem to have a gag reflex. Given that she'd nearly swallowed him before without problem, he shouldn't have been surprised, but he couldn't fight his instinct to fight. With a gulp, Marc was pulled further in, his legs vanishing down the squirrel's throat.

"Impressive technique," Dominique said in appreciation. "No offense but from what I've seen, smaller gals like you usually take longer to down a human whole. You swallowed once and he's already halfway down your throat."

Roxie blushed even more at being complimented by her hero. "Ank oo," she said, with her mouth full. She swallowed again and the force of it was strong enough to yank Marc out of Dominique's hands. The hippo's jaw dropped in surprise. The only part of Marc that remained un-ingested was his head, which was peaking over her throat.

"Someone stop this, please! Gloria! Anyone! Please! I swear I didn't do anything!"

"You're just like every other example of your worthless species and gender," Dominique growled. "Instead of admitting your mistakes, you deny, deny, deny. You deserve to melt away in the belly of an anthro goddess. At least then you'll be serving some purpose, even if it is just as good."

"You're right!" Marc said, giving up on dignity if it earned him another shot at life. "I'm sorry! I was wrong and I take full responsibility!"

"Good," Dominique laughed. "Since you take full responsibility, you should have no problem letting Roxie swallow you."

"Wait! That's not what I--"

"Hey, Roxie. How about a selfie of the three of us before you send him on your way?"

Roxie couldn't talk with her mouth full but Dominique took her squeal of delight as a "yes." Dominique knelt down next to the squirrel. She still loomed over her fan but Roxie managed to get her, Dom, and Marc all in frame. The squirrel's smile widened as she saw tears running down the pathetic human's face. Marc knew his crying was being caught on camera by not just Roxie, but every fan and reporter present, but he couldn't help himself. He'd always known this fate was a possibility, he just hadn't actually expected it to happen to him.

"Ay eese!"

"Cheese!" Dominique said.

"HELP ME!"

A series of flashes went off from Roxie and her friends phones and the photographers cameras. They kept going off even as Roxie swallowed with her mouth open. They kept going off as the squirrel traced Marc's head going down her throat with a fat finger. They kept going off as Roxie patted her engorged stomach, which jiggled and bulged as Marc pressed against its walls in a futile effort to get out. And they kept going off as Roxie struck a heroic pose and let out a deep guttural belch, signaling her ultimate victory over the pathetic specimen of a human male.

BBBBBBBBUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPP!

"Pardon me," Roxie said, not in the least bit embarrassed. Dominique's fans went wild--Roxie's friends loudest of all, cheering her on and complimenting her on a job well done. Roxie felt pride in her accomplishment. She'd never been cheered on by an adoring crowd for her. Was this what Dominique felt every time she emerged victorious from the ring? She could get used to it. She could also get used to the feeling of an insignificant human man writhing in her gut. She didn't even know his name but the internal massage he gave her while trying to free himself was divine.

"Hey Roxie," Dominique said, flashing the squirrel a thumbs up. "You did good!"

"Thanks Dom-Inator!" Roxie gushed, blushing even more. Being complimented by her hero made Roxie feel like she had butterflies in her stomach... Or maybe that was just Marc? Either way, it was wonderful.

"In fact," Dominique said, "you handled yourself so well. I want to give you another gift. Something special for my Number 1 Fan."

Inside the squirrel's stomach, Marc couldn't believe his situation could get any worse. Bad enough that he was devoured to a round of thunderous applause and mockery, but Roxie's short and pudgy frame meant that her stomach was even more constraining than any of those of the much larger anthros. He was squeezed between Roxie's previous meals and the slimy walls of her stomach. He wasn't just gonna be digested, he was gonna be digested without any leg room. And now, overhearing the muffled conversation from outside, Dominique was going to give Roxie another reward for devouring him. What could it possibly be?

1) Backstage Passes for the match between the Dominator and the Glamor Gator. Roxie and her friends will go on a celebratory bar run beforehand, stuffing themselves and drinking, and Marc will be present for all of it.

2) Dominique wants to induct Roxie into the ASL as her protégé right away. She'll take her and start training right away. Marc's hell will get a lot worse as Roxie tries out her new wrestling moves.

Huntress
Species: Wooly Mammoth Anthro
Height: 20'
Appearance: Dark-red fur and long, tangled purple hair. Huntress wears a black top and loin cloth, leaving her massive belly exposed. Very fat, with a bulging stomach, but muscular arms and legs.
A cave woman from the dawn of time, this mammoth anthro was frozen in a block of ice only to be thawed out in present day. When asked who she was, she only ever responded, "Huntress," leaving it ambiguous if this is her name or her former role. The media surrounding her discovery was enormous, and the league wasted no time in signing her up. As a mighty warrior from her own time who was respected for her prowess, Huntress was more than happy to have a job where she could participate in grand battles once again. Even though she has to start in the Bronze League, most are confident she'll rise quickly through the ranks. Despite being hired to fight fellow anthros, Huntress bares them no ill-will. In fact, she considers every other anthro in the league as her friend. No matter how badly they treat her, she always naively assumes they're just joking or messing around. Huntress does have some trouble to adjusting to modern times, often confused by new technology and the current culture. Due to her lack of organizational skills, absent-mindedness, and oblivious awareness of present norms, her servant needs to act more as her handler, telling her when and where to train, and steer her towards matches. However, this is highly dangerous for humans as she lived in a time where humans (or "yummies" as she calls them) were nothing more than walking food, and she has not outgrown that mindset. It took the League a long time to teach her not to eat any fan or League higher-ups on sight. Servants like Marc, however? They neglected to tell her how to behave around them. Raina

Like Dominique, Raina is a fighter who possesses magical abilities. Merely some of the magic she's capable of includes transforming people's size or shape, altering memories, and even bestowing invincibility or immortality. This isn't known to the League at large however (with the exception of Dminique), and she doesn't use these abilities in the ring (or at least she claims she doesn't). 1332.content:
"RAINA!" a voice bellowed, causing Marc's ears to ring.

Marc froze in place. His new mistress's room was right around the corner, and from the sounds of it, there was quite the commotion going on. Nervously, Marc peered around the corner. Dominique was standing just outside Raina's room, pounding on the door and screaming her lungs out. Marc gulped. Dominique was one of the cruelest fighters in the league. Destroying men was her hobby! It was even rumored she could do magic. It was odd though, Marc had seen her before and she always had kind of a gothic style to her, but her current look was a complete 180. Instead of a red mullet, her hair was pink and in pigtails. It even had flowers in it! Instead of black clothes, she wore a golden sundress. The mystery of her appearance was quickly solved by her next bout of ranting.

"I KNOW YOU'RE IN THERE YOU FLEA-BITTEN COYOTE! I SAW YOU! YOU DID THIS TO ME AND NOW YOU'RE GONNA PAY! NOW COME OUT HERE AND FACE ME LIKE A WOMAN!"

Marc's heart was pounding in his ears. He did not want to go out there, not with a magic man-eater erupting like a volcano. Maybe he could sneak away and come back later.

"Boy, some people just can't take a joke," a chipper voice whispered in his ear.

Marc nearly leapt out of his skin and almost screamed but a white paw that encompassed his head, silenced him.

"Easy there, friend," the voice said. "No need to raise a ruckus and alert tall, not-so-dark, and angry."

The hand spun him around and he was face-to-face with a gigantic coyote, who was leaning down to match his gaze. Her fur was bright gold, except for the paws of her hands and feet which were white. Her long pink hair was done up in a ponytail. The coyote wasn't quite as fat as some of the other fighters in the ASL, but she was still massive compared to Marc. She was pear-shaped, with her gigantic ass at least five times as wide as him. She wore a light green top covered in a floral print, which showed off her prodigious breasts. She smiled widely.

"Name's Raina," she said. Before Marc could question how she got out of her room, she forcibly shook Marc's hand and crushed it in her grip. Marc managed to turn his cry of pain into a barely audible squeak.

"Honestly, though," she said, "I thought Dominique would be happy with her change in wardrobe! Before she looked so down and dreary, now she's a pleasant ray of sunshine! Ah well, some people are just so unappreciative. Shame. But I'm sure you won't be such a stick-in-the-mud, Marc."

"How'd you know my name?" Marc asked quietly, still terrified of the enraged hippo nearby.

"Stole your wallet," the coyote said nonchalantly, holding his wallet up between two furry fingers. "God, you had bad acne," she said, inspecting your driver's license.

"What?!" Marc said is a hushed, hurried voice. "Give me that back!"

"Sure thing," she said, dropping it into Marc's hands. "It's pretty worthless now that I've taken out the cash, credit cards and book club membership card though."

"You can't--"

"Sure I can!" she said. "I'm you're new boss, what's yours is mine! And you're mine too, technically, so it's not like you can forge a formal complaint. Now--"

"YOU CAN'T HIDE FOREVER, YOU STUPID MONGREL! MEET ME FOR A SURVIVAL MATCH AND I'LL FIX YOUR MANGY HIDE GOOD!"

Raina sighed and rolled her eyes. "What say you and I move this conversation somewhere more peaceful? I've set aside the whole day to play with my new toy, and I don't want Domi spoiling them before they even begin! Now, better hold your breath."

"Wha--"

Raina grabbed him and shoved him in her cleavage. One minute a struggling human was visible, the next her boobs concealed all sight of him. The only sign of him from the outside was the jiggle of her breasts as he squirmed against them. Raina began skipping down the whole, somehow not making a sound, leaving her oblivious nemesis behind her.

"I just know you're going to be my favorite toy, Marc!" she said. "I already have so many games in mind for us to play!"

Marc dreaded her frequent use of the word toy, but all he could do was wait for her to get to her destination and free him from his sweaty prison.

Where was she headed?

Hello, Marc Youngblood ,and welcome to the Bronze Division of the Anthro Sumo League!



You are one of few with the privilege to help maintain the flow of one of the world's greatest pasttime and invigorate the spirit of our reigning champions, bringing excitement to thousands of eager fans spanning across the globe!


Your assigned champion is Denise Elmond of chamber 106 ! We wish you a hearty welcome and hope you enjoy your experiences in the Anthro Sumo League!


Marc stared at the name, turning it around in his head. It didn't come up on any of his 'most wanted' lists, thankfully, but he also couldn't remember seeing it in any of the Anthro Sumo rosters before. There wasn't even a species or height to clue him in, leaving him totally in the dark about his new mistress.

Then he fully noticed the room number: 106. He looked up at the hallway, the doorways along the walls scaling smaller and smaller the further away from him they were, and the very largest nearby was one only big enough for an anthro in the range of fifteen feet: 200.

Marc ran forward, the hallway gradually shrinking around him like a funnel. He kept glancing between the sheet in his hands and the doors he was rushing by, startled each time by how slowly their numbers were shrinking. When he was halfway down, the doors were already for the nine-footers, and each were noticeably trunking down a few inches more than the last.

His mind was reeling, and soon he was staring only at the sheet, trying to make sense of all this. "What's going on?"

His eyes glanced to the side just in time to see "106" fly past, and he skidded to a stop just inches from hitting a single end table on the wall with a potted plant sitting on top. He took a few long steps back, stopping when he was at the door of his master.

He didn't move to knock it, however, and instead just stared in awe at its size. When he'd applied for the ASL, he'd had a pretty clear picture of what he was walking into; constantly getting sat on by some gigantic sumo wrestler, halving to dodge every which way whenever he was a few feet near a buffet, and just about any kind of hell a human could endure in a building of sweaty, obnoxious monsters thousands of times heavier than he was, but none of that could've prepared him for where he was standing right now.

The doorframe was perfect for his size. Blinking a few times, he moved his arm up and, for the longest time since he could even remember, reached down to grab the knocker and give it three quick raps.

"Coming!" He heard a light, yet mature voice inside say. There weren't any audible footsteps moving around in the room, but the doorknob still turned, pulling open from the inside.

And then, for a brief moment, Marc looked straight in the face of a whole lot of nothing.

"You're name's Marc, right?" A voice politely asked from somewhere around his stomach. "Name's Denise!"

Noticing a messy head of black hair at the bottom of his sight, Marc tilted his head down at a blurb of red standing in front of him, then flinched back from his new master.

Her stomach was abnormally large on her frame, understandable, given the league's indomitable waistlines, but its size was nowhere near as abnormal as the fact that it was only as large as an overstuffed bean bag chair, slightly crushed beneath an E-cup pair of breasts dressed in a black T-shirt that, by god, fit.

Her head was just a smooth, blubbery red ball with only two red eyes and a pair of black pincers left to emote, and all of them were currently looking up at him with a friendly smile, with two red antennae gently twitching through her hair.

Marc didn't answer, standing completely still as he stared down at his diminutive boss in utter awe, until she gave a humored giggle.

He shook his head. "I...I'm sorry, I just..."

"Ah, don't worry about it, I knew I'd get stares in a place like this." She laughed. She turned around, dragging around a thorax behind her as big as a backpack. "Come on in!"

Marc followed her, and was quick to feel unease by the size of her room. It was probably passable enough for a human to live in, as much as he could remember one being, but something about entering a room in the facility with a ceiling that wasn't a few dozen feet over him felt really off-putting.

Denise grunted softly as she went up a tiny set of stairs going up to a couch, then spun around, her tush expertly landing on the cushions.

"So...Denise..." Marc clumsily began, with Denise looking back with curious eyes. "...is there anything you'd needed me to do?"

1353312.content:
From the name alone, Marc was dreading the meeting with his new fighter. "Major Hurt." First off, it was corny as all hell. Second, it sounded like whoever came up with it thought she was tough shit. It was that second bit that worried him. The newbie fighters who wanted to prove how hardcore they were, were usually the ones who busted up their servants to prove a point.

That was bad enough but there was one other detail that bothered Marc. The fighter was a rat. Marc knew it was unfair to judge a fighter based on their species, but ever since high school, he'd had a phobia of rats. He'd avoided rat anthros at every opportunity, but even today he'd still have nightmares about things that happened years ago. He shook his head. That was a long time ago. Darwin Academy was behind him. As soon as he got the money from this gig and his contract was up, he'd be college bound.

He came to room at the end of the hall and knocked reluctantly.

"Come in," a muffled voice said from the other side.

Marc steeled himself then entered. Bronze Division fighters had the "poorest" quarters in the ASL, but their rooms still put Marc's grimy, little, company-owned apartment to shame. In his place, there was barely enough room to sit down in the bathroom. In this room, the living room alone could contain five of his apartments. The furniture dwarfed him, and posters of death metal bands lined the walls. Gym equipment was in the back of the room. The entire room was littered with half-eaten food, dirty dishes, and laundry clearly in need of wash. Marc walked into the middle of the room and sighed as he surveyed the mess. He just knew he was going to have to clean all this up.

"Congratulations, pipsqueak," a voice called out from the bathroom. "You have the honor of being my first slave. The first slave of the greatest fighter the ASL will ever see."

In normal circumstances, Marc would've rolled his eyes at the fighter's boast. Countless rookies came in claiming to be the best. Few ever walked away from their first survival match. That's what Marc would've thought normally, except he was preoccupied by a chill running down his spine. He recognized that voice.

"Oh God, please no," he prayed.

Major Hurt came waltzing out of the bathroom. She was dressed in a black t-shirt, black boots, and green, camouflaged pants. She wore a black leather jacket over her shirt with bright gold buttons. It looked like the first half of a uniform. The design on her t-shirt was of a rat-skull clamping its jaws down on a human skull which cracked under the pressure. Over her neon-green hair was a black commissar cap. She carried what looked like a riding crop in one hand and stroked it as she inspected it lovingly. No doubt she had a speech in mind to show her slave what a badass she was. Her preoccupation on that was the only reason why she didn't immediately notice her favorite punching bag standing in front of her.

At the sight of her, Marc froze. There was no doubt about it. She may have gone by Major Pain now, but Marc knew her as Meg, a name that struck more terror in his heart than any other ever had. She was a few years older than he last saw her, but it was definitely her.

From the second Meg had laid eyes on him in Darwin Academy, it had been hate at first sight. For some reason, Meg had decided the sweetest thing in the world was seeing Marc suffering. She and her pack of cronies would stalk Marc, waiting for him after class or after school only to deliver some new form of abuse. Marc had fought back at first but there was only so much he could do against a 20 foot rat with anger issues. Especially in a school that didn't mind if its students ate each other.

The abuse had started normally enough, for a given definition of the word "normal." Wet willies, purple nurples, noogies, wedgies, swirlies, Meg did it all. She stole his lunch money, kept him stuffed inside her locker, and forced him to do her homework. Over time Meg got more and more "creative" with her methods of punishing him. Forced foot massages, using his face as deodorant, using his body as bra padding, sucking on him like a breath mint, sitting in his seat and "forgetting" he was already sitting there, doing the same thing but eating ten breakfast burritos before hand. It was a nightmare.

Even outside of school he wasn't safe. He remembered summer vacation before junior year. He'd signed up to go to an all human summer camp just to finally have some fun in an environment where he wasn't constantly in fear for his life. He never made it on the bus. Meg had snagged him and stuck him down the back of her underwear, then kept him there for the entire summer. Nobody except her gang of cronies had any idea he was back there, not even his family. It'd been the worst three months of his life, and it was a year before the smell would go away.

Marc finally had enough in his junior year. The next time Meg picked him up to put him in her disgusting mouth, Marc cut loose and punched her right in the nose, making it bleed in front of a crowd of students. This was not his best idea ever. Meg headed to the cafeteria and devoured Marc as an early lunch. She planned on leaving him to digest like countless other unfortunates who'd made their way to her blubbery gut. He managed to survive for a day in the sweltering confines of her stomach. She ate so much Marc was able to form a mountain of chewed up food in her stomach and waited atop it as everything digested around him. He had to endure Meg's taunts all the while but at least he survived. The only reason he got out of there alive was because she ate a bad egg salad sandwich. An hour later she chucked up the contents of her stomach, which wouldn't have been so bad for her had she not been getting a lecture from the principal and let loose right in her face.

Marc remembered what happened next as the happiest day in his life. Meg had gotten in trouble countless times before and the principal was convinced Meg had thrown up on her on purpose. She was expelled from Darwin Academy and transferred to a military school. She remained convinced that Marc deliberately made her sick to get her in trouble and vowed revenge against him. Marc hadn't been worried. What were the odds he'd ever actually see her again?

Now here she stood in front of him. In the perfect position to perform untold horrors on him. If she could catch him.

Marc ran for the door without thinking. The sudden motion was enough to catch Meg's attention during the middle of her braggadocios speech. For the first time she got a good look at her slave as he made a break for it. Her eyes nearly popped out of her head like a cartoon character's.

"YOUNGBLOOD!" she screamed, speech forgotten.

No matter how huge she was, Meg had always been faster than him at Darwin Academy. Years of running drills had made her even faster. She stomped after him and the room shook like there was an earthquake. Marc was a step away from the door before Meg grabbed him by the scruff of his clothes and lifted him to her face. She was breathing heavily. There was a psychotic gleam in her eyes but she smiled at him, revealing a mouth full of fangs that could rip him to shreds if she wanted.

"Marc Youngblood," she said, grinning maniacally. "Aren't you a sight for sore eyes. How long has it been since you got me expelled and sent to that hellhole school?"

"Easy now, Meg," Marc squeaked. "Don't do anything rash. That was years ago. It's all in the past now!"

"I've been looking forward to this for a very long time," Meg said laughing. "You wouldn't believe every single evil thought that popped into my head at the mention of your name. I was afraid I'd never get to see you again but now the ASL gives you to me like a birthday present. Is this the best job in the world or what?"

At the sight of Marc wiggling like a worm trying to get free of her grasp, she licked her black lipstick covered lips and half lowered her green eye-shadowed lids.

"I've missed this. The look of you helplessly dangling in my grasp. I could destroy you in so many different ways. But I don't want you dead. Not yet. I want you to suffer. It's been years since I last got to play with you. Why don't we make up for lost time?"

Meg closed the door and locked it. Marc continued to fight in her grasp no matter how futile it seemed. This couldn't be happening. His worst nightmare had found him once again. And now he was her slave. Her property. She could do anything she wanted with him and no one could stop her. It was like he was in hell and she was the demon charged with his soul.

Marc recognized the look on her face as she watched him. It signaled a monstrous idea that had popped in her head. Marc winced as he waited for her first punishment.

What was it?

13533121.content:
"Alright Marc," Meg said with a tone that made Marc's hair stand on end, "I know the first thing I want. I want you..." Marc gulped. "To apologize!"

Marc was so surprised he stopped struggling. "What?"

"You heard me," Meg said. "I want you to apologize for getting me expelled."

Warning bells were going off in Marc's head like fire truck sirens. There was no way in hell that all Meg wanted was a simple apology. He'd lived through too much pain and suffering at her hands for that to be it. He still remembered all the promises of vengeance she swore at him as security dragged her away. But at the same time, he knew that telling her to screw off would only land him in even more trouble.

"I'm sorry," he groused.

"What was that?" Meg said, cupping a hand to one of her round ears. "I didn't catch that."

"I'm sorry I got you expelled," Marc said.

"Hmm," she said, rubbing her chin. "Here's the thing, pipsqueak. I'm not sure you mean that. Why don't you prove it to me?"

"How?"

Meg broke out into another evil grin and Marc instantly regretted playing into her trap. Without a word she let him go. Marc landed on his ass and cursed. Meg turned around. Her fat, black tail whipped out and wrapped around him like an anaconda. He was bound so tight he couldn't move. Meg snickered over her shoulder and hooked her thumbs over the brim of her pants. She bent forward, sticking out her ass, and slowly pulled her pants down. She revealed her furry cheeks, each large enough to fit three Marcs in. They were completely exposed by the dark green thong she wore.

"Remember your summer home?" Meg asked, chuckling.

Marc blanched at the smell coming off her ass. He remembered how he prayed that he'd go the rest of his life without ever experiencing the stench again. It looked like whatever divine power there was had other plans.

"You made your point, Meg! Let me go!"

"Not yet. You still need to prove how sorry you are."

Her tail yanked him forward, dragging him across the ground and bringing his face within inches of her ass.

"Prove your sorry, pipsqueak. Pucker up and give my ass a kiss!"

"Screw you!" Marc yelled in disgust.

Meg squeezed her tail around him tighter, lifted him up, then slammed him on the ground. Marc saw stars as the tail propped him back up in front of his tormentor's massive behind.

"For your sake, I'm going to ignore that," Meg growled. "But think very carefully, Youngblood. You can either apologize to me and take your first step in making amends for your past deeds, or we can just pick up where we left off the last time we met."

As if on cue, her stumbled rumbled hungrily. Marc winced. What she wanted was humiliating but at least it wasn't deadly. When push came to shove, Marc would take a blow to his ego over death every day. He closed his eyes, puckered his lips and reluctantly leaned in.

He kissed it once quickly, more of a peck. The second his lips met flesh and fur, he recoiled like he just kissed radioactive waste.

"What kind of half-assed attempt was that?" Meg asked. "Is this a joke to you?! Do it like you mean it, pipsqueak!"

Marc groaned. Of course she wouldn't make this easy. He closed his eyes again, held his breath and leaned in. He kissed it longer this time, resisting every impulse to pull away. He hated himself as he did it but forced himself to stay where he was. He doubted Meg would warn him again. After several seconds, he sensed a flash of light behind his eyelids. He pulled away with a disgusted look on his face and looked up to the source of the light when there was another flash that made spots shine in his eyes.

He blinked to clear his vision and as he did so he heard Meg cackling. "Oh man! Your expression was priceless!"

When Marc could see again, he realized that Meg had taken pictures of him on her phone. "Shit!" he thought.

"This is just too perfect! Thanks Youngblood, this is all the proof I need of our sorry you are. I'm sure the proof's going to be enough for our old classmates too!"

Marc's jaw dropped. "You're joking!"

"No way, pipsqueak. I'm sending these pics to all my friends. Also all your friends. I bet everyone you know will have seen these by tonight. It must be so embarrassing for you."

"You evil bitch!" Marc snarled.

Meg was in such a good mood that she didn't even get mad. She just laughed and used her tail to slam Marc against the floor again.

"I wonder how I should title these. What do you think?" she asked smugly. ""Youngblood Finds His True Calling"? No, that's not right... "Once an Ass-Kisser, Always an Ass-Kisser"? Nah. I got it! "Renewing a Friendship,"" she said, typing it as she said it. She laughed as she submitted it. "Man, I can't wait to read the responses on this!"

Marc cursed and struggled against her tail but was unable to break free. Meg saw his feeble attempts and snickered.

"You're so feisty, pipsqueak! I think you need a timeout, and I know the perfect place for you to chill out."

Once again Meg's tail lifted Marc up. He went pale as he saw Meg move her thong out of the way. She winked at him from over her shoulder and raised the phone for more pictures.

"Smile!" she said.

Marc cursed at her as her tail rammed him deep between her mounds of flab. The smell on the outside was nothing compared to how bad it was inside. She clicked away photos of Marc as he disappeared, her crack swallowing him whole. She felt him wiggling between her cheeks and felt a tingle go up her spine. She'd forgotten how much she missed the feeling of him in there. She wondered if it'd be possible to beat her old record of keeping him there for three months, but then decided she might try it later. There were still so many things she wanted to do to him, and there'd be plenty of time for more prolonged punishments later. She literally owned him now.

She pulled up her pants and clenched her cheeks a few times to feel Marc's squirms. She shook her hips in an exaggerated way as she walked over to her recliner. She turned around, leaped into the air and slammed her ass down on it, eliciting another moan from her captive.

"Whatsa matter, Marc?" she asked mockingly. "You not having fun? How about I give you a little fresh air?"

Marc knew her well enough to know what she meant and she heard his howls of protest. It was a shame Meg wasn't in a merciful mood.

PPPPPPPPPPPPPPFFFFFFFFFFFFFFRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT!

A world-shattering wave of flatulence washed over her prisoner. The smell was so rank it even stung Meg's eyes, but she was laughing so hard that she didn't care. She was too busy enjoying the screams and writhing motions of the slave sealed within her.

The perfect thing about having Marc--other than her dreams of revenge finally getting fulfilled--was that years of practice had made her aware just how much the human could take. He was a surprisingly durable guy, and he could take a lot of punishment. It was like he was made to be her bitch.

Meg had previously planned on forcing whatever servant the ASL sent her to tidy up around the place before getting into the more fun stuff. Now, however, she intended to spend the rest of the day lazing around, reacquainting Marc to his old home. She cracked open a monster sized bag of potato chips next to the chair and began munching away as she kept refreshing her phone. The comments on her pictures were coming in faster than she'd anticipated. All of her old friends couldn't stop laughing at the idea that Marc had found himself back in the clutches of his mortal enemy. Each of them had their ideas on how to make him suffer. Other comments came in from Marc's friends and old girlfriends, most of them expressing pity for him, acting like he was already dead.

Meg laughed as she shared every single comment with her prisoner who would respond by thrashing and trying to escape the prison of her ass. Every time he would get too uppity, Meg would respond by clenching her cheeks or blasting him with more rancid farts. Of course, she'd also do the same thing if he was behaving and she just felt like hurting him.

She sighed contentedly, leaning back in her armchair and propping her arms behind her head.

"This is the life."

Pffrt

Still that didn't stop Marc from trying. There really wasn't any other way he could respond to being forced to relive the absolute worst period of his life. The memories of that long summer living in Meg's rancid crack pushed him to try anything and everything he could to get out.

Unfortunately for him, there was an unforeseen consequence to his constant struggles. As Marc wiggled and squirmed he suddenly felt his feet become firmly stuck. Though he couldn't see the sudden suction that pulled him farther back brought forth a horrifying realization. Marc had bumped into Meg's asshole as he fought, and now he was being sucked in.

For Meg's part she was surprised as well. She nearly jumped out of her chair as the puny humans feet rammed right up her anus.

135332.title: Marc the Fighter?

choices: Skip Ahead to Marc's First Fight
1353321.content:
Marc didn't know the name of the fighter he was assigned to. The sheet of paper he'd been given only specified Room 0 in the Bronze Division. He didn't even know there were Room Zeroes. He followed the instructions on his paper through the winding halls, noticing that the closer he got to his destination, the worse the conditions were. They were nothing like the glitzy rooms he'd seen before.

His sense of foreboding only increased when he came to a stop before Room 0. It was located in a dimly lit hall with flickering lights, like something out of a horror movie. There was an odd smell coming from behind the door, and the door itself was covered in peeling paint. The label with Room 0 was crudely nailed to the door and hastily written in marker.

Preparing himself for whatever nightmare lurked behind the door, Marc slowly raised a fist and knocked on the door. It was only a light tap, but Marc flinched as the door creaked and slowly opened on its own, revealing a room the size of a broom closet with nothing in it but a sleeping bag and a light bulb hanging on a chain.

"Who the hell lives here?" Marc thought outloud.

"That would be you."

Marc practically leapt out of his skin at the unexpected noise. He whirled around, heart thundering, and saw a cat anthro standing directly behind him. Unlike the vast majority of anthros Marc had seen around the ASL, this one was slender. Marc had to take a few steps back to look her in the eye as she was eleven-feet-tall. She had black fur, blue hair in a bun, and a purple business suit and skirt. She wore rectangular glasses and had gold eyes.

He recognized her. Her name was Penelope Pierce. She was the agent who represented many ASL members, usually the most popular ones.

"We remodeled the janitor's closet to be a living space. I know it's not exactly living in the lap of luxury, but it's not like we could expect the higher ups to go out of their way for you. Maybe I can get them to fix the lock on the door." She was talking absently while checking emails on her phone. She didn't even look at Marc as she talked, so she didn't notice the confused look on his face.

"M-Ms. Pierce," Marc stammered. "W-what are you doing here?"

"Hmm? Oh. Just making sure our latest fighter was fitting into his new accommodations."

"Newest fighter? Who?"

"You."

"WHAT?!"

The cat shrugged and turned her attention back to her phone as she spoke. "I agree, it's absurd, isn't it? But the higher ups wanted a new gimmick to put more butts in seats and focus groups responded positively to the idea of human jobbers going up against anthro fighters. They think the matches would be good comedy between real fights. You know, kinda like that movie that came out this summer with Jack Splat? What Did I Sit In?"

Marc had seen that movie. It was a favorite of his last mistress. It was about a hapless human who kept being squashed by anthro women. It was the highest grossing movie of all time. He cringed at the memory of how his last mistress would sometimes get drunk and force him to reenact scenes with her.

"You can't do this! My contract says--"

Ms. Pierce rolled her eyes. "Oh please. We both know you didn't read that contract all the way through, otherwise you wouldn't have been so surprised when your duties consisted of being a servant to our fighters. The exact wording of the contracts states, "I hereby agree to carry out any and all demands put to me by the ASL, regardless of the possible risk to my life." I can have a copy of your contract delivered to you with the relevant text highlighted if you'd like."

Marc remembered that damn contract. It was the size of a phonebook. He felt faint and grabbed hold of the door frame to support himself. This was all happening too fast. When this day started out he thought he'd just be another servant, but now they expected him to be a fighter? He was in pretty good shape for a human, but he was no match for those monsters out there. His last mistress had been three times his size and a trained fighter and she'd still be eaten alive!

"B-b-but--"

"Look, Mike--"

"Marc."

"Whatever. I'm not anymore happy about this than you are. You think I want to waste my time representing a joke when I have real clients to take care of? Let's just do our best to make the most of this and get on with our lives." Before Marc could object anymore, Ms. Pierce shoved a key and a new ID badge into his arms. "Here's the key to your room and a pass that'll let you use the locker room, training hall, cafeteria, etc. Obviously it won't let you leave the facilities, so don't try to run."

Marc's throat went dry at the thought of daring to take a step anywhere the fighters in the ASL would be.

"Relax," Ms. Pierce said, as if reading his mind. "The fighters aren't allowed to kill you unless it's a survival match."

"OH THAT'S A RELIEF!"

"I'll have a list of personal trainers delivered to you," she said, as if he hadn't just shouted at her. "You might want to pick one to help you prepare for your fight. Your first one will be next week."

"NEXT WEEK?!"

"We haven't selected your opponent yet, but we'll let you know 24 hours before your match. We won't start you off with a Survival Match... though the higher ups may decide on one if you're not doing well for ratings. You might want to work on your charisma so the audience likes you. By the way, your stage name will be Mike the Mite--"

"MARC!"

"Whatever. Do you have any questions?" Marc had a million of them, but before he could ask a single one, Ms. Pierce's phone beeped and she sighed. "I need to go or I'll be late for my nine o'clock meeting with Dominique. Here's my card. Call if you need anything."

She shoved the card in his hand then closed the door on his face, leaving Marc alone in his janitor's-closet-turned-bed-room. He looked around.

"But I don't have a phone," he mumbled.

He sank down to his knees, feeling numb. How had he gotten himself into this mess? And how could he possibly survive the life of an ASL fighter? It had the highest mortality rate of any other profession. He imagined going up against someone like Dominique or Roxenne, and he shuddered. Maybe a personal trainer wouldn't be a bad idea... even if training meant he'd have to step outside and face his opponents in the ASL. He gulped. Maybe staying cooped up in his room for a week wouldn't be such a bad idea after all.
1353321.title: Ain't No Rule Says a Human Can't Sumo

13533211.content:
"Ouch!" Marc yelped as the nurse, a chubby black sheep woman, jabbed a needle into his shoulder. He felt ridiculous, wearing nothing but a pair of shiny gold trunks, a white cape with red polka dots, and a black domino mask. He looked like a two-year-old's rough draft of a superhero.

"Word of advice," Ms. Pierce said without looking up from her phone, "learn to handle pain better. Even if you're opponent wants to take it easy on you, they're not going to treat you like a delicate flower. It's why we're giving you this shot in the first place. To make your body less likely to break."

"That's a load off my mind," Marc grumbled. "And if the ASL has a shot that makes humans more durable, why the hell don't you give it to every human who works here? Do you know how many humans kick the bucket every year just because an anthro doesn't check to make sure a seat isn't taken?"

"The board considered it," Ms. Pierce said. "But the serum's too expensive to keep buying in bulk. It's just cheaper to hire more humans... What?" Ms. Pierce asked when she felt Marc glaring at her.

"You people are monsters."

"Oh please," the cat anthro said. "It's just business."

"And where's the business sense in making me dress up like a complete idiot?"

"Test audiences loved it," Ms. Pierce said. "Or, at least, they loved laughing at it. Look, you're comic relief, alright? You're supposed to look pathetic. Don't think about that, just focus on how to make your big wrestling debut as enjoyable for the audience as possible."

Marc was actually doing everything he could to focus on anything other than his big wrestling debut. He'd spent the last week in a state of panic, holed up in his broom-closet-turned-bedroom, jumping at every little noise and cowering in the corner whenever he heard heavy footsteps walking down the hallway. The first night three anthros had gathered around his door and tried to goad him to come out. Instead he'd wrapped himself in his sleeping bag, turned out the light bulb and pretended no one was home. That didn't stop them. They kept taunting him, telling him how he was a disgrace to their profession. They said how he wouldn't last a minute in his first fight before being turned into a stain in the ring. They kept it up for almost an hour before they stomped off, taking the time to tell him exactly what they'd do to him if they caught him outside with "real" wrestlers. Marc was just grateful they hadn't figured out the lock was busted, otherwise they might've grabbed him right there.

The taunts had been enough to keep Marc cooped up in his room for the entire week. He knew he should at least try to train, but the fear of what would happen if he left was too great to ignore. He was even too scared to run to the cafeteria in case he winded up on someone's lunch tray. The only reason he ate at all was because one of the ASL's security guards, a massive gorilla woman named Queen Connie, checked on him twice a day to make sure he hadn't made an escape attempt... or hadn't been taken by one of the other wrestlers. She agreed to bring him food from the vending machines in exchange for five times the amount they actually cost. At first Marc refused, but when he realized it was either that or starve, he decided extortion wasn't the worst thing that could happen to him.

The week had passed before he knew it, and now Marc was in the locker room, the match about to begin in only a few minutes. The sheep nurse offered him a lollipop after his shot and he politely refused, feeling too nauseous to eat anything. He'd felt that way ever since Ms. Pierce popped in yesterday to tell him who he was fighting.

Ms. Pierce's phone beeped and she said, "It's time."

Marc gave a nervous gulp.

"Good luck, Sugar," the black-furred sheep said.

"Thanks, mam."

"I'll have the defibrillators ready for you," she said kindly.

"... thanks," he said glumly as Ms. Pierce led him to the curtain separating him from the ring. The curtain was so big, a mountain could've been on the other side.

"Laaaaaaaadies and gentlemen!" the female announcer boomed on the speakers. "Welcome to another thrilling match arranged by the ASL! We have a special treat for you to get things started tonight. For the first time ever, the ASL will be hosting an anthro-on-human match!" Marc could hear the audience gasp outside. "This little guy came to us on hands-and-knees, begging for the chance to live his dream as an ASL wrestler, and our hearts were so touched, we couldn't help but make his dream a reality." Marc would've been outraged if he wasn't too busy having a panic attack. "Please welcome to the stage the Pummeling Pipsqueak, the Terrifying Tiny, the squishable, the stompable, the seatable and oh-so-eatable Mike the Mite!"

"They're not even going to get my name right on my tombstone," Marc thought just as Ms. Pierce shoved him roughly outside.

Marc stumbled on the way out and had to windmill his arms to keep balance. He staggered out of the spotlight, and caught himself on a nearby bench. The spotlight moved to meet him. The crowd was dead silent. Marc felt the sweat on his brow and nervously wiped it off his forehead. He laughed nervously and gave a feeble wave.

It was then the audience exploded into laughter.

"I don't know about you folks," the announcer said, giggling, "but I think we've got a real champion on our hands!"

The crowd laughed even harder and Marc blushed at the humiliation of it all. He tried to regain some dignity as he entered the ring, only to snag his foot on one of the ropes and face plant on the floor, his cape covering his head and his ass hanging in the air. Marc considered just staying there forever until the crowd just got tired and went home, but he considered it unlikely and got up.

"Don't worry, Mike," the announcer said. "You'll get the hang of it eventually! Let's give him a big hand folks."

The crowd clapped sarcastically, most of them too busy laughing to play along. Marc would've felt more embarrassed if the ring hadn't started shaking. He wondered if it was his nerves at first. Then he realized the entire stadium was shaking because of heavy footsteps approaching behind the opposite curtain. Marc grabbed the giant turnbuckle to stop from fainting.

"Now folks, let's welcome our challenger into the ring, a brave woman considering she's willing to face-off against an opponent as fearsome as Mike the Mite! You know her, you love her, you fear her and revere her, here she is..."
13533211.title: Definitely Not Ready to Rumble

135332111.content:
Marc watched in horror as the indigo hippopotamus came stomping out into the ring. Twenty feet of angry blubber wearing a black bikini with skulls on it. Her pink lips pulled back in a snarl to reveal a pair of giant, flat fangs. Marc couldn't stop his knees from shaking. Out of all the people he could be pitted against, Dominique was everything he was afraid of. She was a sadistic, human-hating, man-eating monster who took out all her anger over being dumped by a human man on every human servant she could get her hands on. Every human working for the ASL knew to steer clear of her, lest they end up subjected to her wrath. The stories about her were as blood-curdling as they were farfetched. Marc had even heard a rumor that she could practice black magic. As if she needed anything else to make her more terrifying. Before a week ago, Marc thought the worst thing that could happen to him was that he'd be assigned as her servant. Facing off against her in the ring? This was worse by far!

They met in the center of the ring and the sight was laughable. The ring itself was the size of a football field to accommodate for the fighters' gargantuan sizes. Marc barely came up past the hippo's shins! Ominous gurgles and growls came from her monumental stomach, which swayed only a few feet above his head. All she had to do was take a knee and Marc would be flattened underneath her flab. Marc was very aware of the hippo staring at him, making him feel vulnerable with her gaze alone.

"Oh! Looks like the wrestlers are trying to psych each other out!" the announcer said.

Marc did not need to be psyched out at all. He was already psyched out, and just hoped to leave a good enough impression that Dominique wouldn't want to murder him completely. Unfortunately, what spilled out of his mouth was a pathetic, "Um, may the best man win?"

Marc cringed as Dominique pulled back her pink lips in a haughty smirk, showing off her fangs, either one of which was strong enough to squash his head. "I can't believe I'm getting paid to annihilate a pathetic speck like you tonight!" she said, to the cheer of the crowd. "A worm of a human man like you isn't worth washing a real wrestler's underwear, much less stepping into the ring with one. I hope you folks enjoy the show, because this is gonna be Mike the Mite's first and last show!"

"Hey now," Marc said in an undertone. "You're not serious, right? This is just supposed to be fun for the audience--"

"Trust me, it's gonna be fun for them and me!" Dominique bellowed. "Everyone shut up and listen closely!" She raised a hand to her ear. "You hear that?" she asked. "I think Mite needs a closer look!"

Before Marc could move, Dominique seized him in one hand and stuffed his head into her bellybutton. The world went dark and Marc struggled feebly to pull himself out. All around him, the growls from the hippo's gut was deafening. Dominique cackled at his pathetic attempts to free himself.

"Now he hears the old girl! She's hungry tonight! What do you say, folks? Want me to fill her up on stage?" she asked, rubbing her growling gut. She smiled, feeling Marc's screams echoing in her bellybutton. She hoped he would at least be useful enough to clean out all the lint while he was there. Dominique let go and with a wet POP Marc's head was free and he landed on his ass. "Get a good look at your new home, Mite?" she laughed.

Marc coughed out enough bellybutton lint to choke out, "This isn't a survival match!"

"Oh, I know that. But she doesn't," she said, pointing at her stomach. "And she's in charge. I might not be able to help myself tonight." She licked her lips obscenely then chomped her fangs an inch over Marc's head, causing him to cower on the ground. She smirked then spoke low for the first time so only he could hear her, "Besides, it's not like the ASL would boot me from the roster over a nobody like you, would they?"

She wasn't serious, was she? She had to be messing with him, she just had to! Mostly because Marc knew he had no way of defending himself if she wasn't.

"Alright, break it up, break it up!" a loud voice said. The referee, a female zebra came over. She was a fraction of Dominique's size, but she succeeded in driving the hippo back a few steps. "It's like the Mite says, this isn't a survival match! It's a regular match! There will be no eating or killing of the opponent! Do you two understand?"

Marc had no idea why she bothered telling him that. If she thought he could kill a twenty foot carnivorous hippo, you wanted some of whatever she was on. Dominique only shrugged cheekily in response and gave her lips another lick while looking at Marc. Then she marched back to her corner of the ring. Marc's legs were too weak to move on his own so he had to be dragged by his cape to his corner by the referee.

"It's a regular match," he said to himself. "Not a survival match. A regular. I'll be fine. I'll be fine."

He didn't even remember getting to his feet before the bell rang.

DING! DING! DING!

Marc whimpered as Dominique bellowed and came charging at him like a freight train. All common sense went out the window and Marc tried to climb over the ropes out of the ring.

"Uh-oh," the announcer said. "Looks like Mike has cold feet. Good thing Dominique is here to show him the ropes."

As--bad--luck would have it, Marc snagged his foot again, leaving him a sitting duck for the angry hippo. She grabbed both feet in one hand and lifted him like a doll back into the ring.

"You aren't going anywhere, squirt," Dominique chuckled. "Your ass is mine!"

What does Dominique have planned first?
135332111.title: Dominique!

"Actually," Dominique said, a cruel smirk forming on her full, pink lips, "your ass doesn't belong to me. Your ass belongs to my ass!"
