"Wait! Don't--"

Dominique let go of him at the same time she slammed her ass backwards. The hippo's colossal ass engulfed Marc effortlessly. His back was pressed against the turnbuckle, Dominique's butt cheeks were on either side of him, crushing him like a vice grip, his face was forced up against the fabric of the hippo's bikini bottom. He was completely immobilized, his arms and legs pinned to his side, her ass sweat soaking his body, his nose forced to breath in the scent of her crack. Outside, Marc could hear the audience roar with laughter.

"Oooooooh," the announcer said. "That's gotta hurt! Dominique showing no mercy out of the gate as always. I hope the poor, little guy can take it."

In response, Dominique planted her hands on her hips and began wiggling her behind exaggeratedly, mashing Marc even more between her cheeks. He felt like pizza dough being kneaded by a pair of giant hands, flattened and squashed and stretched beyond reason. He thanked god for the shot he'd been given earlier. He doubted he'd still be alive if it wasn't for that. The squishing torment went on for several minutes, the audience couldn't seem to get enough of it. Neither could Dominique, for that matter. She beckoned them with her hands to keep cheering her on, and in response to their enthusiasm, she would mash Marc more and more.

Luckily, the announcer seemed to be getting bored, "Come on, girl. Have a heart. The little guy just wants to be a wrestler! Why not give him a fighting chance?"

Dominique stroked her chin as if seriously considering being merciful. A few seconds later, she sighed and nodded, lifting her ass off of her helpless opponent. Marc thought it was a miracle when some of the weight started to shift off him and he was finally able to take a breath that wasn't tainted by the smell of swamp ass. Then Dominique gave a laugh that chilled Marc to the bone. She waved her hand in a, "Naaaaaaaah," gesture, and slammed her ass back onto Marc. Hard.

WHAM!

Marc let out a little whimper as his world once again consisted of nothing but pressure, sweat, and crushing, crushing pain. The weight lifted off him for a second time, but only for an instant before the hellish hippo slammed her ass back into him over and over and over and over and over again.

WHAM! WHAM! WHAM! WHAM! WHAM! WHAM! Creeeeeeeeeeeaaaaaaaaaaaak.

Under the weight of her onslaught, the turnbuckle began to bend backwards. The ropes along the ring pulled tight. Marc let out a muffled scream of agony, but he may as well be yelling at a smelly wall for all the good it did him. He didn't know how much longer he could last. Sure the shot made him tougher, but it didn't make him invulnerable. He'd break at some point!

Finally, after five minutes that felt like five hours, Dominique pulled her ass away and kept it away. Marc slid down the turnbuckle at a 45 degree angle, and plopped on the ground. Dominique had her back to him and had mounted the opposite turnbuckle. She put her hand to her ear and encouraged the crowd to keep cheering her on. They were more than happy to oblige.

"These people are maniacs," Marc wheezed. "How can they possibly be enjoying this?"

He glanced to the side of the ring. There was still no one there. No security to stop him. He could just run. He'd done his time, damn it! How could anyone ask any more of him?

But on the other hand, if he did run, the ASL wouldn't like it. Blind panic had ruled him before, but now that he had a second to catch his breath and think about it, he realized if he kept trying to run, it wouldn't go unpunished. Who knows what they'd do to him? But what was his other option? Stand and fight? He certainly hated Dominique and would love to kick her ass, but in a straight-up fight he stood as much of a chance as a Chihuahua fighting a werewolf! But... it might keep the audience entertained. And Ms. Pierce did imply making the audience happy might make things better for him in the future.

Marc got to his feet. Fight or run, whatever he was going to do, he should do it while her back was turned.

What did Marc decide?
1353321111.title: Your Ass Belongs to Her Ass

choices: She's no bluffing, Marc's hippo food
She has another move planned to finish this fight
13533211111.content:
Marc knew running wasn't an option. Any punishment Dominique dolled out to him in the ring couldn't be half as bad as what the ASL decided to do to him behind closed doors. There was really only one option. If they wanted a show, he'd give them a show. Dominique still had her back turned to him. It was now or never. He charged! ... and charged... and charged. In his mind, Marc had pictured the ordeal as a spurt of adrenaline that'd take him the entire way in a matter of seconds. He'd forgotten just how long the damn ring actually was for someone of his size. It took him almost a minute to cross the ring and by that time, many people in the crowd were pointing at him and shouting at Dominique, trying to warn her of his approach. Marc couldn't tell if Dominique didn't hear them or was just playing dumb, but either way it was too late to give up now.

It was when he was within five feet of Dominique that a thought struck him: he had no plan of attack. That thought struck him a second before Dominique's foot did. She whirled around and kicked him, her foot bigger than his entire body. It was like a car hit him, sending him flying all the way back to wear he'd started against the damaged turnbuckle.

"Looks like his sneak attack wasn't so sneaky after all," the announcer said sympathetically. "Sorry little guy, looks like she was just playing dumb."

NO SHIT! Marc screamed, or, would've screamed if the wind hadn't been knocked out of him. He felt the vibrations of the ring as Dominique sauntered over to him. With her foot, she rolled him over onto his back so he could look up at her. Or, at least, theoretically could've if her gut hadn't been in the way.

"Fee-fi-fo-fum," Dominique said, "it's time to squash my little, Mite mun."

"That... rhyme... sucked..." Marc wheezed.

The hippo glared at him. "Fine. Then I'll let my belly do the talking."

Marc feared for his life what that could mean. He was positive she was going to devour him right then and there, but, instead of picking him up and eating him, Marc was amazed to see her walk away. He managed to sit up a bit, even though it felt like his ribs were broken, to get a better look. She was mounting the turnbuckle again and the crowd was roaring in anticipation. He knew what was coming next. One of her signature moves: The Gut Buster.

With agility that amazed Marc in spite of her girth, Dominique leapt into the air and did a backflip, positioning her stomach so that it was on a collision course with Marc's battered body.

I should've run, he thought.

BOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOM!

It felt like the stadium was in the middle of an earthquake. Everything was moving, the crowd falling into each other, the lights flickering, the doors and windows rattling, the ground shaking. Ripples ran up Dominique's colossal stomach, the gargantuan gut jiggling like an ocean of pudge from the force of her impact. It was, quite frankly, a miracle that Marc wasn't rendered a pancake under the force of her bellyflop, especially since she hadn't held back at all. Not that that gave him much comfort as every molecule of Marc's body was in screaming agony under the force of her stomach.

"Ahhhhhhhhhhh," Dominique said. "I could just lie here all day. What do you think folks?"

The crowd got to their feet and roared their approval. Apparently they would be fine just watching her lay about, doing nothing, so long as someone was getting hurt in the process. The hippo put her hands behind her head and leaned on her stomach like a giant exercise ball. Marc tried to move, but if it was impossible to move under her ass, it defied the laws of time, space, and reality for him to move himself an iota of an inch while pinned to the mat under her all-encompassing stomach. In a repeat performance, Dominique would alleviate some of the pressure off his body, peeling away some of her stomach and letting him get some fresh air, only to grind her gut back over his body, leaving him in hot, sweaty darkness, surrounded by her flesh and the sounds of her stomach.

Was it just his imagination or were the growls from her stomach getting louder? She wasn't getting hungrier was she? Dominique spoke and it was like she'd read his thoughts.

"Boy, crushing this sucker's hopes and dreams sure does work up an appetite," she said loudly to the crowd. "Does anyone know if there's a place I can find some decent food around here?" The crowd helpfully responded by pointing at her stomach and cheering. "What's that?" Dominique said, as if she couldn't hear them. "My opponent? Well, he does look tasty, but this isn't a Survival Match. I can't eat him... can I?"

The crowd couldn't get enough of her coyness. They cheered all the louder, voicing their approval, encouraging Dominique to indulge herself. Marc was waiting for the announcer to say something or the referee to step in or anyone to say anything that could save him! But no objections came.

"Alright," Dominique said as if the audience had only reluctantly convinced her. "I won't tell anyone if you don't." The hippo winked and pulled her stomach away and peeled Marc off the mat like a piece of gum stuck to the floor. She raised him before her mouth and licked her pink lips in anticipation.

"Tenderized," she said. "Just the way I like my meals!"

"Dominique," Marc said weakly. "You can't... it's against the rules..."

"Typical weak, pathetic human man," she growled under her breath. "You want to step in the rings with the big girls but you lack the commitment to carry through. You disgust me. Or you would if I wasn't so hungry. Wave buh-bye to your adoring public, Mike."

"It's Marc," he whimpered.

"Whatever."

The hippo raised Marc over her head. She opened her mouth wide, a gaping entrance to hell if Marc ever saw one. He couldn't help himself. He began to cry.

Is Dominique being serious? Is this really her finishing move? Does she eat Marc or is she just messing with him?
13533211111.title: Goes about as well as you'd expect

135332111111.content:
It was no bluff. One second Marc was dangling by his cape, crying for help in the outside world, the next Dominique stuffed him inside her mouth, managing to get every inch of savory human in her drooling maw. It was a tight fit, like a human cramming an entire slice of pizza into their mouth. Doable but difficult. She'd managed to snap his cape free, and now used it as an impromptu napkin to wipe the drool from her lips. Dominique's cheeks bulged as her captive meal thrashed around inside her. She sucked and slurped on him loudly, making no effort to disguise her enjoyment as she savored her meal.

"Mmmmm... oo nuu Mites taysth sho good?"

"Folks, I can't believe what I'm seeing!" the announcer cried. "It appears that Dominique--in a flagrant disregard for the rules--is devouring her opponent outside of a Survival Match! And the referee is just sitting back and checking her phone! How can this possibly be allowed to go on?" Even though the announcer was trying to sound outraged, there was a distinct undercurrent of laughter to the words.

Marc, meanwhile, was fighting for his life inside his dark, pink, foul-smelling prison. Her teeth could've easily crushed his head like a watermelon, but Dominique wasn't interested in resolving this quickly. She battered him around her mouth with her tongue, dousing him with drool. Every now and then one of Marc's flailing limbs would find itself slipping past her lips, only for Dominique to suck it back inside like a wayward piece of spaghetti. At one point, Marc's soaking wet head popped out, and through his mask and the saliva that stung his eyes, he had enough time to take in the roar of the crowd. He was blinded by the flash of camera lights, deafened by the cheers and the laughter. He couldn't believe it. A whole crowd of strangers eagerly anticipating his death. What kind of monsters were they?

He had only a second to think this before Dominique brought up her finger in front of Marc's face and wagged it in a "naughty, naughty" gesture. Then, using that very same finger, she pushed down on the top of his head and trapped him completely within her mouth again. The casual display of dominance only brought on a bigger cheer from the crowd.

Marc heard it, the cheers, the laughter, the pure delight the audience was taking in his misery. He heard it and he hated them. Hated them almost as much as the hippo who was only moments away from swallowing him whole. He wouldn't die here for their amusement. He swore it!

Righting himself as best he could so that his feet were on her bottom teeth and his hands were planted against her top teeth, Marc pushed. He pushed with his arms and legs, pushed with every ounce of strength in his body, straining to pry the hippo bitch's mouth open. As he strained, he heard the muffled voice of the announcer continuing to talk outside.

"Well folks, it looks like that's all she wrote. Mike gave it his all but he's just another in a long line of failed ASL fighters--BUT WAIT! What's this?! Is... is Dominique's mouth... OPENING?!"

It was. Despite Dominique's resistance Marc was managing to actually pry open the hippo's mouth. First only an inch. Then a few more. Now a foot. Adrenaline fueled Marc, pumping through his veins, lending him strength in his Herculean effort. He could hear Dominique gagging, could hear the crowd going dead silent. Everyone was transfixed as this puny human was, against all odds, working his way to freedom. With a final scream of effort, Marc opened Dominique's jaws all the way.

"YES!" he screamed triumphantly, his cry echoing through the silent stadium.

"Folks, this is unbelievable! I've never seen an opponent manage to get Dominique's mouth open once she's already gotten them inside! Oh folks, do you believe in--"

Just then Dominique brought her hand up in front of her mouth. Marc was horrified she was going to simply punch him and destroy all his hard work, but, somehow, what she did was even worse. She brought her hand up to cover a yawn.

And just like that the illusion of hope was gone. Of course Marc hadn't managed to overpower a twenty-foot-pachyderm and veteran fighter of a hundred matches. She was toying with him. But now playtime was over... lunchtime resumed.

The jaws effortlessly snapped shut, sealing him off from the outside world again. Dominique's tongue wrapped around him like a snake and dragged him to the back of her throat. He didn't even have time to scream as she worked his head past her uvula and swallowed powerfully. On the outside world, the crowd watched as a thrashing lump travelled down Dominique's throat before disappearing behind her bountiful cleavage. The lump's arrival into her stomach was heralded by the hippo patting her prodigious gut contentedly and letting out a ceremonial victory belch.

UUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRPPPPPPPPPPPP!

"Ooooh," the announcer said. "Scratch that folks. Looks like Mike's a goner after all... Shame..." The announcer allowed Marc's passing a respectful moment of silence. "Welp, no use dwelling on the negative!" the announcer said, voice growing chipper again. "We've still got a lot more exciting fights for you tonight folks, but first lets give a big round of applause this match's winner: DOMINIQUE!"

The crowd burst into thunderous applause as Dominique wiped her lips with Marc's cape again, then tossed it over her shoulder carelessly like a used napkin. She gave a last wave to her adoring fans as she made her way out of the ring, her stomach sloshing, filled with her wriggling, squealing prize. When she reached the locker room, she let out another satisfied burp.

"BRAAAAP! Ahhhh, not bad for a night's work, hey Mike?" the hippo asked her gut tauntingly.

"LET ME OUT OF HERE YOU PSYCHO!" Marc screamed. "THIS ISN'T RIGHT! IT'S AGAINST THE RULES!"

"Hmm, looks like my food's disagreeing with me," Dominique said, laughing at her own joke.

"A fine performance," a voice said. Upon hearing it Marc ceased his struggles. He recognized it.

"Ms. Pierce! MS. PIERCE! You have to get me out of here! You have to--"

"Eh, shaddup," Dominique said, smacking her bloated gut and causing Marc to fall down into her half-digested meals. The hippo turned from her stomach to the slender cat who'd entered the locker room. "What can I do for you, pussy cat?"

"You did a fine job tonight," Ms. Pierce said. "Apparently ratings were through the roof. Your match has already gone viral. Looks like the board was right. Viewers love seeing humans in pain. Though you weren't supposed to eat him," Ms. Pierce said, critically eying Dominique's stomach.

The hippo shrugged carelessly. "I missed lunch."

"Yes, well, regardless I have your bonus right here," Ms. Pierce said, holding up a briefcase that both women knew was full of money. "Just regurgitate, Mr. Mite and the agreed upon amount will be yours."

"Yeah," Dominique said slowly, "about that..."

What does Dominique say?

1) "The deal's off!" - Dominique decides she'd rather have a human digesting in her stomach than an extra bit of cash.

2) "Did you bring the ipecac syrup?" - Dominique keeps her end of the deal and Marc lives to fight another day.
135332111111.title: No Bluff, Marc's Hippo Food

1353321111112.content:
"Did you bring the ipecac syrup?" Dominique asks. She doesn't sound too happy about what's going to come next but Marc had never been so happy at the prospect of puke in all his life.

"I'm gonna live!" he thought to himself in elation, over and over again. "I'm gonna live, I'm gonna live, I'm gonna live!" While his thoughts were doing a conga line of happiness, Marc stayed perfectly still within Dominique's prodigious gut. The sensible part of him realized he wasn't out of danger yet, and he didn't want to do anything that could jepordize his impending release. Who knew if one wrong squirm could cause Dominique to reconsider? He didn't move a muscle.

"Forget the ipecac," Ms. Pierce said. "I've got something even better. Take this instead."

Dominique took the small bottle of pink liquid Ms. Pierce produced and inspected it as suspiciously. "What is it?"

"A little something the lab boys have been working on," Ms. Pierce said. "Last year saw a 35% rise in human mortality rates in ASL employees. Those contracts they sign may give us ownership over them and cover our asses if "workplace accidents" occur, but that doesn't stop those damn Save the Humans groups from making a big stink over the numbers. Some of them even saw tonight's match and have started trending #StopMiteAbuse."

"Bunch of bleeding heart crybabies," Dominique growled. "They thought a few lovetaps in the ring counted as abuse? I should take a page out of that triceratops, Tricia's, notebook and live stream his digestion just to show them what real pain is. That sound good to you, Mikey?" Dominique asked, picking up her gut and shaking it. Marc's world jiggled around him but he remained silent as the grave.

"Do that and you won't get your bonus," Ms. Pierce pointed out.

"I know, I know, I'm only teasing," Dominique said, then added under her breath, "mostly. Anyway, what's any of this gotta do with this pink crap you gave me?"

"That's one of the solutions the ASL has come up with to keep human casualties down. It's going to be part of our new line of (Comparatively) Human Safe Products. One of them is the treatment we applied to Mike which made him more durable for your fight. If that didn't work he probably would've been reduced to a bloody smear on your ass."

"Heh, I always did have a killer ass," Dominique snickered.

"Yes, you've told me that joke before. Many times," Ms. Pierce said, sounding highly unamused. "The bottle you're holding is called Ultra Fizz. It's a formula designed to react with humans when detected in an anthro's digestive system. It causes a build up of gas bubbles that lets our fighters belch up any humans they swallowed while leaving the rest of the food in their stomachs alone. We think it'll be easier to convince our girls to take this than induce vomiting. Less messy too. Now they can still snack on a human if they're in the mood without being forced to choose between losing a slave forever and puking their guts out. We hope when we unveil this line of products it'll take the wind out of the sails of the Save the Humans groups."

"I'll bet!" Dominique laughed. "That's unbelievable! You're telling me the ASL has come up with ways to pummel humans without them kicking the bucket? This is perfect! Now anyone who whines about "Saving Humans" won't have a leg to stand on! Heck, I bet when they find out they can munch on or squash humans without killing them, even some of those wusses will start joining in on the fun!"

"So long as the ASL thrives and profits keep going up, they're free to do whatever they want," Ms. Pierce said. "Now, please drink the formula before our latest sensation is digested."

"Whatever you say, Pussy Cat," Dominique said, raising the bottle to her lips, then stopped. "There's no side effects to anthros, right?"

"Minor gas. It should pass in less than an hour."

"Huh, alright, cheers!" There was only enough liquid in the bottle for a swig and Dominique drank it straight down. The pink potion tasted like cream soda and Dominique licked her lips appreciatively. To Marc, the small splash of liquid looked too miniscule to accomplish anything, but within seconds of hitting the hippo's stomach acid, bubbles began forming all around him. The stomach began gurgling and groaning all around him.

"Urph," Dominique burped into her hand. "You weren't kidding, this has--brap--a real kick to iooooOOOORRRRPPPP!"

Marc felt like he was inside a freshly shaken bottle of soda, the bubbles rising up all around him, he could feel the pressure building, building, building... and then...

"BBBBBBBBBBRRRRRRRRRRRRRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAPPPPPPPPPPP PPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPP!"

The belch sent Marc flying up and out of Dominique's throat like the popped cork of a wine bottle. He passed through the slimy tunnel of her esophagus and was flung out of her mouth. Ms. Pierce's eyes went wide and ducked as Marc sailed over her. If not for her catlike reflexes he was sure he would've taken her head clean off. Instead he immediately splattered against the stone wall and noisily slid down to the ground like a cartoon bird who'd flown into a window.

Dominique broke the silence that followed with a sarcastically dainty, "Pardon me."

"A fine job, Dominique. Thank you," Ms. Pierce said, all business again as she handed the hippo her briefcase full of money.

"Pleasure doin' business with you, Pussy Cat," Dominique said. "Let me know if you need me to eat him again tomorrow."

"That won't be necessary," Ms. Pierce said, lifting the dazed Marc up by his slime-covered leg and carrying him over to the nearest sink. It was the size of a wash basin compared to Marc and his cool cat manager dunked him inside like that was exactly what it was. A blast of cold water shocked him as it hosed off the contents of Dominique's stomach. Under the rush of water, Marc heard her keep speaking, "After tonight's success, we have him fully booked for the rest of the month."

Dominique shrugged as she counted her cash. "Oh well. If I ever need a snack, I know where he lives."

The hippo's nasty laughter followed Marc out of the locker room as Ms. Pierce wrapped him in an anthro's hand towel big enough to cover him like a beach towel and hauled him away. It was only when the room stopped spinning and the cold water wore off that Ms. Pierce's words sank in. He was booked up... the entire month?! How many more fights was that?! How could he survive even one more when it felt like he was dying already?

No answers came to Marc as Ms. Pierce escorted him to the janitor's closet that was his room and tossed him inside without even so much as a, "Good work."

How will Marc ever get out of this one?

1) He doesn't: Skip to the next fight.

2) Outside intervention: Save the Humans protestors sneak inside to rescue "Mike".
1353321111112.title: All Abord the Ipecac Express

13533212.content:
It had been a day since Ms. Pierce broke the news about Marc's new role in the ASL. During that time he'd stayed cooped up in his broom-closet-sized room. He hadn't been able to sleep a wink in all that time. It was cramped, it smelled funny, and it was dingy. Worst of all was the broken lock, which caused him no small amount of stress. Every now and then he'd hear footsteps coming down the hall and when he did, he'd hurry to the door, grab the handle, and pull on it as hard as he could, just in case any of the anthro fighters had figured out where he was living. He doubted fighters who dedicated their entire lives to the sport would look kindly on someone who was literally just going to be fighting as a joke. They'd probably consider it a mockery of their careers and want to deliver some payback--no matter how unwilling a participant he was in all of this. Luckily, none of the footsteps had stopped outside his room, and he wasn't dragged screaming from his new accommodations. However, the fear of who he'd run into on his own, without the back-up of an intimidating anthro mistress striding before him, kept him right where he was.

But he knew he couldn't stay in his room forever. He hadn't eaten anything at all yesterday and now today was halfway through. His stomach growled in protest as it tried to eat itself in lieu of real food. He looked at the pass Ms. Pierce had given him. He could head to the Fighter's Cafeteria... but the thought of willingly walking into a room filled with starving fighters who could literally eat him alive was a gamble he didn't want to take, even if he knew he'd have to either go there sometime, or starve to death.

Or he could head to the Training Room. The looming threat of next week's match hanging over his head filled him with utter dread. He knew that if he couldn't get out of it--which he doubted he would--that meant he'd need to actually train to fight. While he knew he'd only been made a fighter as a joke, that didn't mean he wanted to get totally creamed in his first match. It was bad enough he was in this scenario without having to worry about becoming a laughingstock on national television. He couldn't let his family and friends see him beaten to a pulp so effortlessly. Marc remembered Ms. Pierce talking about personal trainers he could work with to coach him. It might be a good idea to meet one. Hopefully, whoever it was, would go easy on him. After all, it was a trainer's job to help fighters get better.

Marc made up his mind. He took a deep breath and walked outside. Cafeteria or Training Room. Where does Marc go first?
13533212.title: Follow Marc as he Trains

choices: Claudine - He may live another day, yet.
135332121.content:
“Are you alright?”

Normally, Miku would’ve had a nasty look on paw for any human servants that she’d catch ogling her behind, maybe a good bop on the back of their necks with her tail, for good measure, but the small, wiry-looking man stared with such intensity but a breath’s distance from her plump behind that it provoked some remote sense of concern for him.

“Mm-hmm.” Marc murmured, only slightly lucid to the fact that somebody was nearby.

Miku observed him a few more seconds, uncomfortably noticing how his eyes barely moved to meet hers, then turned around to open the cafeteria door...only to flinch back with a squeak as the human shoved himself right in front of her and strode ahead.

In the early hours, Marc had enough space around the other fighters’ cumbersome girth’s that he had enough space to freely dodge and run around them, his relatively skinny frame able to scramble by without making too much noise.

The cafeteria’s servers didn’t even have enough time to smile when Marc seemingly materialized right in front of them and began grabbing straight from the bar, not even caring what he was taking as long as it was edible and available.

“Hurry, hurry, hurry!” Marc mentally chanted as he plopped a handful of ketchup packets on his tray, desperate to be in and out before an y prying eyes could notice his presence. A bowl of chili followed next, a bottle of water after, then just a raw ladleful of mayonnaise that he hastily slapped on his plate before finally pulling himself away, prepared to make one more beeline out the door and to his storage close-

SPLURTCH

Marc didn’t have a chance to look ahead before striking something face first, tasting the plastic of his tray as he was partially embedded into something incredibly wide, large, and too soft to be a wall or a support beam. Peeking over the rim of his tray, Marc fearfully backed away, his fingers shakily allowing it to fall and clatter amongst the chili and mayonnaise splattered on the ground, much of the same that was now smeared across the belly of his massive victim...
135332121.title: Cafeteria

choices: No. He's caught by a Fighter.
Yes. Now to recruit a Trainer.
135332122.content:
Marc got to the Training Room through a combination of stealth and dumb luck. He'd snuck through the halls as quietly as a mouse (a normal-sized mouse, not an anthro one), and the few times he'd heard thundering footsteps coming down the hall, he'd manage to duck around a corner, behind a vending machine or into a trashcan before he was spotted. Granted, he ended up kinda sticky and smelling a little ripe, but it was a small price to pay for getting to his destination safely. He grabbed a banana peel that had stuck to his head and tossed it away as he finally came to the Training Room entrance. He took out his pass, put it in front of the scanner, and the gargantuan doors unlocked, allowing him to slip inside.

Marc took one look inside and gulped. The Training Room was packed. It seemed every piece of gym equipment was occupied by a towering anthro fighter. Marc spied the elegant unicorn fighter, Claudine, hitting and kicking a punching bag shaped like an obese anthro. Her skills were more like that of a graceful and refined dancer as she practiced her routine. Next to her was Daisy, a superstitious pig anthro, who was using a similar training dummy to practice a new move, over and over again until she perfected it, as was her habit. With a spike of fear, he recognized Dominique the Dom-Inator, the sadistic, human-male hating, black-magic practicing hippopotamus. Right now she was doing bench-presses, roaring in exertion as she lifted the maximum weight possible.

He recognized many more famous fighters, but the scariest of all was Amaya, an obese yet muscular phoenix anthro. She was one of the biggest stars and top fighters of ASL's Gold Division. Her reputation for treating her human servants was almost as bad as Dominique's. She looked down on servants at the best of time, and anyone who wasn't in the Gold Division. Marc, a walking-talking jobber would elicit outright scorn at best, or utter loathing at worst. She was fighting in one of the practice rings in the back, using one of her poor servants as a "training dummy." Marc winced as Amaya got to the top of one of the turnbuckles and jumped off, squashing the poor human underneath her. When she got up, he was indented into the mat like a pancake. Clearly this was less about "training" and more about stress relief. Smoke was coming off the phoenix as she looked at her bruised and broken human.

"Pathetic," she sneered, peeling him off the mat. She tossed him contemptuously out of the ring, over to a pair of twin mouse anthros in hot pink nurse's outfits. The two loaded the groaning human on a stretcher as Amaya sneered down at him. "See if you can fix this loser up so he can still be useful. If not, put him in my pantry for later."

The entire display made Marc sick, especially when the two nurses rushed passed him with the smooshed human whimpering on top of it. They hadn't taken a step outside before one of the nurses slipped on the banana peel he'd carelessly tossed to the floor, and the two of them crashed, along with their patient. Marc winced/

"Hey, there's that new human jobber!"

Marc couldn't tell which fighter had said it, but realizing he'd been noticed was enough to finally break him free of his shock. His eyes darted around the gym, until he saw an office halfway through the Training Room marked, "TRAINERS". Marc rushed towards it, not quite running but certainly a lot faster than walking. He didn't want to show fear, but he didn't want to dally either. As he moved, he heard other female fighters grumbling angrily.

"Just who the hell does he think he is, coming in here with real fighters?" "I spent my entire life trying to get into the ASL, and this twerp is just handed a spot on a silver platter." "I bet he thinks he's so special. Someone needs to teach him a lesson." "I give him a week before he ends up a stain on the mat." "Week nothing. If I have it my way, he'll be a stain before the day is up." "Stain? What a waste of a perfectly good meal. He wants to be a fighter? I'll make him a part of one." "Does anybody else smell garbage?"

Marc decided to give up not looking scared. The office of the personal trainers was still far away. He started running.

"Awwwww, is the widdle baby scared?" "Pathetic! Grow a spine you wimp!" "Run as fast as you can, jobber, but you're not faster than me."


Marc heard footsteps right behind him and he started sprinting. He doubted he'd ever run so fast in his life, but the footsteps were gaining on him. He dared not look back to see who was chasing him. He heard the woman chuckling, saw her shadow looming over him. He was so close to the Trainer's Office. He dived through the air, hoping to make it through the open doorway. Did he?

1353323.title: The Human Experiment?

choices: "...we need to get you introduced to Norah."
Before Dante can finish, Norah appears!
13533231.content:
Marc was surprised when he received a text on his phone, asking for him to report to the ASL office building. That had never happened in the months since he'd been trapped here. He had always reported to the facilities and suites for the fighters. After all his experience so far, he didn't have the good feelings about this.

'Then again, what more could they possibly throw at me?', the young thought darkly.

Marc report promptly to the offices and surprised by how normal they were. Somewhat enlarged to accommodate Anthro proportions but nothing as exaggerated as what was given to the fighters. All and all it looked like a normal office space of the human world with various employees walking around talking, handing off reports, etc.

He wasn't given long to observe before a male velociraptor in a black suit strode up to him with a smile. He offered a clawed hand that Marc took with a firm shake.

"Mr. Youngblood, thank you for coming so swiftly." spoke the velociraptor. "I am Dante Talon and I'm here to offer you a proposition."

Marc's eyebrows rose into his hairline. "Really?"

Dante nodded. "Yes, we here at the ASL have come upon an interesting situation that requires your particular brand of services."

Now Marc was truly confused. "Ok what is it exactly?"

"Simple. The ASL is experimenting and looking to expand it's facilities with a new brand of fighters." Dante stated. "We wish to expand our horizons to include human fighters in matches."

Marc's jaw dropped. "P-Please don't tell me that you me to fight!"

Dante gave a small laugh while waving his hands. "No, no, no. We already have a candidate secured." Dante's face turned serious. "The issue is several fold, however. You see, we wish to see if a human is even capable of bulking up sufficiently to even be considered a fighter. Anthros have the natural disposition to grow larger in size through eating but human...not so much.
As such we have brought in specifically made foods and created a strict regime for diet and exercise for her to see if we can remedy that problem.

The next problem is that we have no way of knowing if that will work or even backfire. We will need observation on as many levels as much as possible. While we will be arranging checkups of all times, it is felt that we need a more personal touch. That is where you come in. You would act as her assistant as you have for other fighters. You will do you're typical duties but you will also be making periodic progress reports to us as well. Her attitude, your personal feelings on her progress, concerns, whatever you feel we should know.

We selected you in particular because you are the only other human assistant that ASL has available. As such, you can relate more easily to our possibly newest recruit. Plus, you already have experience in dealing with such...demanding personnel."

Marc weighed his options. On one hand, he got away from the anthros with this but on the other hand, he didn't want to deal with being what amounted to a glorified slave to another human being. Especially when it sounded like he was being given even more work to do on top of whatever this woman would have him do.

Dante sighed. "I can tell what you're thinking. Honestly, I can't and shouldn't blame you. After everything you've already been through, you've got to be thinking 'What do I get out of this?', right?"

The young man had enough shame to look sheepish and Dante continued. "We are prepared to offer you this, should you accept. If everything goes to plan and the ASL sees this experiment pan out successfully, we're prepared to let you go. You're contract will be considered complete and you will be compensated approximately two million dollars for your troubles."

Marc felt lighted head at that. He might actually get out of here and he'd have more than enough money to go to college! But as soon as his hopes rose, he became nervous.

"You said I get that if things go well but what if they don't?"

"Say that things go pear-shaped. You will still be compensated, just differently. You still fulfill your contract but it will be for three years, not five. In addition, you will become a maintenance and site employee instead of an assistant. You will work behind the scenes to keep our facility here running instead of directly working with the fighters.You be paid every two weeks, work five days a week, eights hours a day. You will be paid 100 dollars an hour. You will be given your own personal quarters and food will be paid for by us. Naturally, you cannot slack off during this time period or we will be forced to demote back down to your current position."

So I stand to benefit regardless, he thought to himself. This was honestly a no-brainer.

"I accept, Mr. Talon."

Dante gave a relieved look and offered his hand again which Marc shook.

"Thank you. We'll get all the paperwork drawn up and sent to you. Nothing complicated and you're free to review it. But in the meantime..."

14.content:
Marc sighed as he turned into one of the ASL's massive elevators, his mood utterly resigned. He needed to get to one of the upper floors to reach is new mistress/boss/torturer/person-he-didn't-want-to-meet. He pressed the button for the 3rd floor when he noticed something. The button, which should have glowed green, was red. Marc had no clue what that was about. A glitch, maybe? Bad wiring? With little to lose, he pressed the button again.

This time, however, the button didn't just light red, the panel sparked with a small surge of electricity. Marc jumped back in surprise and jumped again when the elevator started moving. Only, it wasn't going up, it was moving downward. Marc watched with mounting dread and confusion as the display for the elevator went showed it descending to the basement. Marc had no clue what was down there as he had never had a reason to go. Sadly, he wasn't given any time to ponder any unknown dangers that lurked there as the elevator went further.

"What the hell...?" Marc breathed out, eyes wide.

There wasn't another level to the ASL or, at least, there wasn't another level below the basement as far at the young man knew. Yet, that wasn't stopping the elevator from continuing its descent downward.

Marc didn't know how long he was in the elevator, his confused and terrified state making every moment feel like a lifetime. He was in such a stupor that he barely noticed when the elevator stopped with a rumble before the doors flew open. Despite himself, Marc poked his head out of the elevator.

He was greeted with a long, hallway. It was sparse, devoid of any ornamentation or decadence that the ASL exuded from every surface. Large, bright lights lined the ceiling. The sheer lack of anything familiar made Marc's skin crawl. He looked back to the elevator's control panel and noted that it was still sparking.

'I doubt that'll work,' He thought. He weighed his options. He could venture out into...wherever he was at. Maybe he could find someone to help him or at least another elevator to get back to the main facility. But there was the possibility that he'd get himself lost. Just from what he'd seen, everywhere looked the same. Or he could wait until someone came to the elevator. Surely someone would want to use it, right?

What would Marc do?

Has vibrant red skin, pointed ears, gold slitted eyes, extremely pale blonde hair with a single streak of black, black horns on her forehead, a long red tail and hooves for feet. Lexi central feature his her belly, a tight ball of packed fat that jets out in front of her like a small mountain. Face is surprisingly thin with attractive and perfect;y symmetrical features.

Lexi is a virtual unknown to the wider world and for good reason. Her existence is proof of another world in addition to the Anthro and Human ones: the Monster world. Anthros and Monsters used to coexist, if for no other reason than the fact that Anthros vastly outnumber Monsters. However, once Humans and Anthros met, the Anthros were quick to forcibly contain the Monsters in their original homeland due their fear of humanity's reaction. Due to this, she is confined to the Pit. How she came to be at the ASL is unknown but she's managed the Pit since it came into existence and is well acquainted with Marlene. She keeps the Pit running, checking on the status of the prisoners, looking after the integrity of the prison's tech and coordinating the staff that helps her run it.

Lexi runs the Pit with a firm hand and keeps her staff on task with mix charisma, respect and fear. She rewards competency in earnest but doles out punishment in proportion to the mistake. She is the best kind of friend but the worst sort of enemy who never truly forgets a slight even if she was to forgive it. She is usually charming and intelligent. Underneath it all, Lexi despises Anthros. She believes that if the Humans had been allowed to meet her people, the Anthros would never be allowed to treat them as second class citizens. She labors for the day that Monsters are able to truly be apart of civilization again and believe that if she can somehow get control of ASL, she can bring that day sooner rather than later.

1411.content:
Before Marc could make any sort of decision, he felt it. Before coming to the ASL, he'd have never noticed this particular sign, but his time spent in this hostile environment had all but required the honing of his senses for better or worse. Now, it was all but second nature.

He could feel the vibration of the ground underfoot and by the sheer level of it, Marc could tell that one thing: whomever it was, was absolutely huge.

Marc felt his heart rate pick up as he desperately sought somewhere he could hide or run. The problem was there really wasn't anything he could duck in or behind, the hallway was bare. As for running he just didn't know where he could go. The hallway only had two directions, right or left and both rounded a corner, making it so he couldn't tell from where the nearing danger was coming from. Usually, he was good enough in detecting such things as to figure out what direction one of the huge fighters was coming from. Yet, the approaching behemoth was so large that their bulk made vibrations so intense that they seemed to be coming from everywhere at once.

Marc cursed himself for his indecision. He cursed even more when he saw a figure round the corner to his left and felt his jaw drop as he finally saw what had been approaching him. She, because it was most definitely a she, was the single largest figure Marc had ever seen since his entrapment at the ASL. The first thing that Marc took note of, once he'd gotten over the sheer difference of height, was the fact that the person was wearing a neat black suit, perfectly tailored for the veritable mountain that was her body. While that might have seen such a strange thing to take notice of, such clothing was uncommon at the ASL. Many of the fighters didn't bother with normal clothes, if they bothered with clothes at all. Marc had gotten used to seeing various anthros in bikinis or ill fitting shirts-turned-bras and shorts. Instead, this one wore a rather nice looking black suit jacket and matching pants. She sported no shirt though, Marc saw, giving him a perfect view of the red skin her cleavage.

Marc was taken aback as he took in the female in front of him. This was no anthro! She had no fur or scales. Instead, her skin was a bright red, unblemished and unmarred. Furthermore, her face...was human. Or, at least, practically human. A noble, beautiful face framed and contrasting against flaxen hair with a single black streak trailed its way through her locks. Black horns jutted from her forehead. A tail of red and tipped with a spade-like growth trailed behind her while she walked, her bare, smooth hooves clacking off the ground.

This female was the perfect example of a demon from the various depictions that Marc had seen throughout his life and she was looking right at him with an expression of...
1411.title: Meeting the Demoness

14111.content:
A demon.

It clicked. Marc suddenly processed he was looking at a genuine, real-deal, from Hell demon. He'd met plenty of anthro mistresses who ACTED like demons, and knew plenty were evil enough to pass for one...but none had been actual hellspawn.

And now he was staring one down, with nowhere to run. He cringed and waited for the expected taunting over his doomed soul.

"Wait...what? How'd you get down here?"

That hadn't been it. "Um, what?" Marc asked stupidly.

"How did you get down here?" The demoness asked again. She bent down, her smart black business-dress straining to hold in her plump frame. She squinted her glowing yellow eyes at Marc, looking him over. Those eyes widened.
"You're a human! Down here, in the Pit!" she grinned. "This could be my chance...finally, Monsters can come out of the shadows!"

Marc was sweating. This demon woman had just started talking nonsense within seconds of meeting him. He took a step back, hoping to get back to the elevator--

And was enveloped in a giant red hand, then stuffed between the demoness's ample breasts. Immediately he felt the summer-day heat of her body envelop him. Fitting for a Hell-creature.

"My name's Alexis, but you can call me Lexi," the demon lady greeted cheerfully as she started walking down the hall. With his eyes now adjusted to the dark, he saw it was a spartan corridor of concrete and dim lights. Steel doors lined the walls.

"Uh, my name's Marc, Miss Demon--"

"Come on, call me Lexi."

"--Lexi. But...where is this? The elevator went wrong and brought me here."

"This is The Pit," Lexi answered, pausing at a set of double steel doors. They were reinforced with large rivets and bolts, like something from a military bunker. Lexi's hand paused at the bar. "Marc, little guy? Try to keep quiet."

She opened the door to a nightmare.

The room was massive--big enough to fit a small town. And all along the walls, extending past catwalks almost to the ceiling, were giant barred cells, each with an Anthro inside. All of them sneered, scowled, paced around their confinement. A few shouted greetings...and threats...at Lexi. And they all had murder in their eyes. Marc recognized a few Anthros from the news--serial killers, drug lords, assassins. They were all here.


"It's a prison," Marc breathed, feeling a shock of dread. Had this been under the ASL all this time? If there ever was a breakout, there was a stadium full of victims waiting above....

They walked by one cell housing a slender otter woman about Lexi's height. She perked up at the sight of Lexi--or rather, Marc. "You've got a human, Bael?" she asked quietly.

"Yes," Lexi replied, moving her hand protectively before Marc.

"Hey Human," the otter woman greeted. "Just so you know, if I find your family, I'll eat the kids first."

She'd said it so easily, so casually that it took Marc a second to process. His mouth suddenly felt dry. "W-what?"

"I said, I'd start with the children. They taste the best; like an appetizer." The otter said patiently. "Not to mention they're the easiest to eat--I can swallow children in one gulp; adults take a few swallows. Not to mention they're stronger: makes eating adults a bit of a chore. More complex flavors, though." She shrugged, like she was talking about the weather.

Marc felt his jaw drop, and shivered despite the heat coming off of Lexi. Plenty of anthros ate humans, especially the gluttons in the ASL. He'd seen his share of people getting eaten, even came close to becoming a meal himself. He'd always found it terrifying that these giant animal women saw him as a talking snack...

But NONE of his mistresses had been this cavalier about it. They threw out quips, made a show of eating humans, salivated when they got the chance. This otter woman seemed almost bored talking about eating people, as if she didn't even get the predator's satisfaction most anthros got eating humans...the people she ate might have been noodles to her.

And until now, even the most predatory, gluttonous anthros he'd met had NEVER mentioned going after kids. Some even had a soft spot for human children--even Dominique and Sapphire were friendly to the kid fans. But now...

The lack of obvious psychosis didn't matter.
This otter was evil.

Lexi must have felt his shivers. She pulled her dress closer around her chest, tucking Marc protectively between her breasts. Letting out a low, dangerous growl, she flicked her wrist--and a coiling fire in the shape of a whip formed in her hand.

"Practice that speech in front of a mirror, Helena?" the demoness hissed. "Think you can rile me up into killing you?"

"We don't have much entertainment down here, Bael. Not much to do but remember better times." The otter, now named Helena, said with a shrug.

...A shrug that turned into an agonized spasm as Lexi cracked the flailing whip in her face. The flaming coils phased harmlessly through the bars to strike Helena, throwing her hard to the floor with a cry of pain. Marc smelled burnt fur and singed flesh, and now saw the pathwork of blackened welts and scars on Helena's back as she lay on the concrete floor. He felt Lexi's chest heave as she took shuddering breaths; felt her heart pounding in her chest, nearly loud enough to drown out her voice.

"And you'll keep on remembering until you die and rot down here," Lexi growled. "However long it takes: years, decades; maybe even until you're one hundred years old--all you can do is remember everything you did, all those innocent people you ate. You won't get to cheat your suffering, Helena. And when you finally do wither and die, with nobody even remembering your name...I'll be there to drag you to Hell myself. And I'll make sure you suffer everything you put your victims through....but I hope it takes a long time for that to happen. I want you to rot to the bone down here, you bitch."

Lexi sneered down at the writhing prisoner, then stomped down the hall, now silent after her display on Helena.

When Helena's cell was well behind them, she gave Marc a comforting pat on the head. "It's alright. None of them will get to you. You're safe with me, Marc. I promise--just stay close."

A long staircase brought them to a fortified watchtower/office that overlooked much of the basement. Lexi let herself in, gently plucking Marc from between her ample breasts.

"Welcome to the Pit, little one."

Marc shook his head clear, fighting down the choking shadow of horror his talk with Helena had thrown over him. Unable to speak, he looked around the spartan office/security station...


1.) Alone with Lexi: He and Lexi are the only ones there--she tries to talk to him and see if he's alright; fascinated at meeting a human.

2.) Guardians of the Pit: One of Lexi's fellow jailers is there, and notices the new arrival.

3.) Meanwhile...: Some of the ASL higher-ups (or perhaps Marc's mistress) notice his absence, and goes looking for him!

info.brief_description: Welcome to Anthro Sumo League! Try to survive...
info.description:
Set in the same world as Anthro Tech, this time you will be guiding/controlling Marc as he goes about his daily duties at an ASL (Anthro Sumo League) site. This site is not just a staging area for the various matches but also where the various wrestlers live, train, and pamper themselves. While at first glance you would think that it would be like the human sumo sport, you would be wrong.

In the ASL, while the fighters may huge in height and bulk, their fighting has more in common with MMA (Mixed Martial Arts) than traditional sumo. The ASL is hugely popular in both the human and anthro worlds for its highly volatile matches. Many even pay thousands of dollars just to show up and see a match in person everyday and even more bet on the victors and losers of various matches. Their are three main division in the ASL and you can tell what division each fighter belongs to by the colored ASL logo on their belt.

Divisions: Each division has it's own compound in the site that is private to them and general staff assigned there.

Gold Division: Considered to the cream of the crop of the ASL, these are the fighters who receive the most fame, given the most money for their victories, allowed access to the best R&R sections of the ASL compound and given the most leeway for rule breaking. Those of the Gold Division are generally the largest and/or most skilled fighters in ASL. The luxury they have access to is far above that of five-star, world class resort.

Silver Division: Those of the Silver Division are considered to be above average in size and skill and on their way to Gold Division. However, they haven't made it just yet. Silver Division see the most traffic, with anthros going from bronze to silver, then silver to gold and back down from gold to silver. The Silver Division has privileges that are comparable to a 5-star resort.

Bronze Division: The lowest division in terms of general size and skill but the largest pool of fighters. However, they are probably the most ambitious and daring. The facilities they have access to are comparable to a 4-star resort.

The Pit: The Pit is not an actual division but instead a massive, underground prison complex located underneath the ASL. The ASL attracts some of the most dangerous competitors in terms of personality, size, skill or some combination of the aforementioned traits. However, most of these behemoths are just that - competitors, seeking to do their best at the ASL and contain the viciousness to the ring or personal property. Yet some descend into true madness, depravity or other malevolence that goes far beyond what the ASL is willing to tolerate. Such dangerous individuals cannot be simply allowed to roam free and, thus, the Pit was created to contain them. Should a fighter become too dangerous or unreasonable, this is their destination. The Pit is a state of the art technological marvel of security and innovation utilizing everything from knock gas dispensers in the cells to forcefields to contain the prisoners to teleporters for travel in and out of specially designed cells. No fighter sent to it has ever escaped it's oppressive walls. The Pit is unknown to the general public and no human has ever visited it...

In addition, there are 5 types of matches that the fighters can participate in:

1. Regular: These matches are the standard matches that are seen the most of the time. They end when a fighter submits or is tossed out of the ring.

2. Survival of the Fittest: These matches end only after one of the fighters is consumed by another. This can be either whole or even in pieces. These type of matches can only be issued by a fighter/team of fighters to another. They can also be declined, however, that can result in a loss of face. Survival matches can bee issued by any member of any division to another.

3. Promotion: These matches are for when a fighter is about to be promoted upwards in division. To enter a higher division, the fighter must defeat a member of said division. Promotion matches can also be coupled with Survival matches.

4. Tag: This is type of match is always 2 on 2. It can also be a regular, survival, or promotion.

5. Free for All: Free for all's are matches between 3-5 fighters. Fighters lose if they submit, tossed out ring or eaten.

Promotion/Demotion: For a fighter to be promoted, she must win 10 consecutive matches of any kind. A fighter will be demoted a division if she loses 5 consecutive matches.

Characters

Main
Marc Youngblood
Species: Human
Height: 6'1"
Appearance: Tanned skin, black hair, brown eyes. Slim, athletic build.
Marc is a young man who needed money to go to college as his family fell on hard times. Determined to pull his own weight he signed up to work for ASL to make money to pay for his education. What he didn't know was that the job entailed him basically acting as a servant to the fighters. He has little to know rights and the only things keeping him alive is the ability to please the fighters, his wits and the excellent medical facilities of the ASL. Marc is fairly polite but has a sense of pride that can cause him to speak/lash out when abused or demeaned. This has gotten him sent to the hospital several times. Now, he does his best to curb his tongue and tries to avoid being wrapped in any plots or deranged behavior. He's stuck at ASL until his five-year contract is up. Recently, he's been assigned to a new fighter as her personal servant/slave. Can he survive his new charge and even if he can, will SHE stay top dog long enough for him to even get used to her.

Other Characters
Faculty & Staff

Marlene (Created by lwut)
Species: Penguin
Height: 64'11"
Appearance: Has dark purple feathers and a white underbelly, with bright red eyes and a yellow beak. Marlene sports a pair of breasts and an ass that each put the waistlines to some of the biggest fighters in the facility to shame, but she's mostly bombarded by an utterly titanic belly that perpetually lays on the floor, which she decorates with a variety of colorful tattoos to show off as it hangs out of all her shirts. She's reaching her late forties, but looks to be ten or fifteen years younger.

The owner, founder, spokeswoman, and undisputed champion of the ASL, Marlene is undeniably the absolute biggest combatant in all the facility. Most of the time, she's rarely seen anywhere outside of her office, where she keeps the facility's upkeep and paperwork under control, but at the end of every month, there's a fan poll held where viewers can elect fighters to battle her in a five-on-one cage match, a battle that she rarely loses, despite being so obese.

When she's away from the desk, Marlene can only be described as an anthro who's always hungry. Hungry for food, money, success...and love. In the walls of the facility, she's notorious for flirting with or forcing herself on anybody within a boulder's throw of her, whether they be male or female, or even fighter and staff. Rumor even has it that she makes secret deals with elected fighters to date her in exchange for victory.

Of course, the worse off are her assistants, her mad fetish for all things tiny being the main reason humans can be hired in the first place...

Alexis 'Lexi' Bael
Species: Demon
Height: 64'1"
Appearance: As a demon she appears very similiar human though naturally different. Has vibrant red skin, pointed ears, gold slitted eyes, extremely pale blonde hair with a single streak of black, black horns on her forehead, a long red tail and hooves for feet.
